loans.name: Dina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dina lo integran tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Cándida Rosa S. vende verduras y animales domésticos como gallinas, chancho, patos…etc. desde hace siete años aproximadamente. Ella con el crédito comprara yuca, papa, ayote, pipian y animales.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Jenifer H. quien vende cosméticos desde hace cinco años y Leonora H. venta de sandalias desde hace cuatro años. Ellas tienen la meta de aumentar sus negocios y crecer.
texts.en:
The Dina group consists of three hardworking women. One of them is Cándida Rosa S.; for about seven years, she has been selling vegetables as well as domestic animals such as chickens, pigs, ducks and so on. She plans to use the loan to purchase cassava, potatoes, squash, cushaw as well as animals. Her partners in the group are Jenifer H., who has been selling cosmetics for five years, and Leonora H., who has been selling sandals for four years. Their goal is to increase their sales volume and grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, vegetables, and domestic animals

loans.name: Sarita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sarita lo integran tres mujeres emprendedoras, esforzadas y decididas una de ellas es Rosa del Carmen G., coordinadora del grupo. Ella desde hace cinco años comercializa cosméticos y joyería de manera ambúlate. La meta de G. es poder tener su propio local donde pueda vender más segura y con una mejor instalación.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Anielka Jahoska M. L. de 23 años tiene una pequeña pulpería y María José C. Guzmán vende ropa y cosméticos  desde hace seis años y sueña con tener su propio local.
texts.en:
The Sarita group is comprised of three enterprising, hard-working, and determined women. One of them is Carmen G., the coordinator of the group. She has been selling cosmetics and jewelry as a traveling merchant for five years. G.’s goal is to be able to have her own place where she could sell more safely and have better facilities. Anielka Jahoska Montaon L., a colleague in the group, is 23 years old. She has a small mini market. María José C. Guzmán, her other colleague, has been selling clothes and cosmetics for six years. She dreams of having her own place.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics and jewelry

loans.name: Lilia María

texts.es:
Lilia es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Piura, ubicado en la región del mismo nombre. Se encuentra ubicado a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de artículos de uso diario. Este negocio le permite hacerse de ingresos permanentes con los cuales apoya a su esposo en el mantenimiento de su familia.

Lilia desea adquirir mas productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Lilia es una mujer honrada y bastante trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Sus vecinos y clientes la consideran una mujer amable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Lilia is a 37 year old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the district of Tambogrande. This agricultural district is in the province of Piura, which is located in the region of the same name. The area is more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than five years, Lilia has been selling basic necessities and groceries from a store she operates out of her home. There she offers her customers all types of everyday products. This business allows her to earn a steady income that helps her husband support their family.

Lilia wants to acquire more products to satisfy the demand of her customers, increase her sales, and earn more income. In order to do this, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN to help reach her goal.

Lilia is a honest and hardworking woman. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman so that she can improve the quality of life for her family. Her neighbors and customers consider her to be a kind and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: La Finca Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Finca está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Ileana Margarita C. S. quien desde hace cinco años vende refresco, juego y gaseosa. El sueño de ella desea tener una venta donde pueda comercializar desde granos básicos, chiverías, pan etc.

Sus compañeros de grupo Heydi Ángeles G. Mungía vende ropa de forma ambulante hace tres años y Concepción B. vende carne desde 1980 negocio que ha progresado con arduo trabajo.
texts.en:
The group “La Finca” (The Farm) consists of three hardworking women. One of them is Ileana Margarita C. S. who has been selling refreshments, juices, and sodas for five years. Her dream is to have a vending post where she can sell basic grains, yogurt, bread, and other products.

Her fellow group members are Heydi Ángeles G. Mungía, who has been selling clothing as a traveling merchant for three years, and Concepción B. who has been selling meat since 1980 and has made progress through her hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase refreshments, sodas, and juices

loans.name: Yeni Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yeni del Carmen L. R., mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien es comerciante de sombreros artesanales, chinelas entre otros productos. Ella hace siete años se fue a trabajar a Costa Rica donde ahorro un dinero para luego venir a su país que tanto extrañaba a crear su negocio.

La meta de L. es tener su propio tramo ya que ella vende de manera ambulante en el mercado de Masaya.
texts.en:
Yeni del Carmen L. R. is a hardworking, enterprising woman who sells handcrafted hats and slippers, among other products. Seven years ago she went to work in Costa Rica, where she saved enough money to then return to the country she missed greatly and create her business. L.'s goal is to have her own stand at the market in Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handcrafts

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un pequeño hijo, radica en el caserío Pedregal del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Piura, ubicado en la región del mismo nombre. Se encuentra ubicado a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda. Allí ella pone al alcance de la mano de sus clientes productos de uso diarios por los que tendría que trasladarse hasta el pueblo. Esta actividad es la única que le genera ingresos por lo que trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible.

Viviana desea adquirir más productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Viviana es una mujer luchadora que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de su condición de madre soltera, su mayor anhelo es darle a su hijo una educación de calidad que le permita convertirse en un hombre de bien.
texts.en:
Viviana is 30-years-old. She's a single mother with a small child. She lives in the hamlet of Pedregal in the district Tambogrande, an agricultural district in the province of Piura, located in the region of the same name. She lives more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For more than five years she has sold essential items and groceries in a store inside her home. At this store she puts essential daily items at the reach of her clients, who would otherwise have to travel to the nearest town to shop. This business is the best way for her to generate enough income to maintain a suitable quality of life. Viviana wants to acquire more products to satisfy the demand of her clients, expand her sales, and increase her income. For this reason she has asked for the first time for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency; equivalent to $550) from Edpyme Alternativa, which will help her achieve her goal. Viviana is a determined woman who has known how to come out on top despite being a single mother. Her greatest wish is to give her son a quality education that will help him become a good man.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of essential items and groceries to expand the store in her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of materials to replace his roof and build a wall around his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She is going to use the money to buy materials for her home. She is going to change the roof of her house, since it has problems and water is leaking in. She is also going to take care of some unexpected expenses.

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es:
En la foto se encuentra María U., Ana María C., Dielka T. y Consuelo Gaitán. La foto de rostro es de Alba G..   

El grupo las Azucenas lo integran cinco integrantes féminas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y  con iniciativa una de ellas es María del Socorro U. C., coordinadora del grupo. Esta joven de 23 años inicio vendiendo tortillas bastimento por excelencia de los nicaragüenses hoy en día comercializa carne y hueso.

Sus compañeras de grupo son la señora Consuelo Gaitán de 52 años quien tiene una tortillería desde hace dos años,  Dielka María T.  quien tiene una panadería y tortillería, Ana María C. quien también se gana el sustento se cada día realizando tortillas bastimento de preferencia en los hogares nicaragüenses y  Alba Lidia G. Gaitán de 25 años tiene dos años de vender comida en la zona franca de Masaya.

Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios para seguir creciendo y ampliar sus negocios. Además están muy agradecidas por las oportunidades de crédito y capacitación que Adim les brinda las cuales les parecen excelentes ya que así pueden administrar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
In the photo are María U., Ana María C., Dielka T. and Consuelo Gaitán. The faceshot is of Alba G.. The Azucenas group is made up of five entrepreneurial female workers with initiative. One of them is María del Socorro U. C., the group coordinator. This 23-year-old youth began selling tortillas, a Nicaraguan staple. Today she sells meat and bones. The other group members are 52-year-old Consuelo Gaitán who has had a tortilla shop for the last two years, Dielka María T. who has a bakery and a tortilla shop, Ana María C. who also earns her daily bread making tortillas (the preferred staple of Nicaraguan homes) and 25-year-old Alba Lidia G. Gaitán who has been selling food for two years in the free-trade zone of Masaya. They will invest the loan in their respective businesses in order to continue growing and expanding them. In addition, they are very thankful for the loan opportunities and capacity building that Adim provides them, which they find excellent, since they allow them to better administer their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Meat and bones

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y actualmente no tiene hijos dependientes, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Illimo, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de flores en el cementerio de Illimo desde hace mas de diez años. Ella ofrece sus flores en el exterior del camposanto y los principales clientes son aquellas personas que llegan a visitar a sus familiares difuntos. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida y los ingresos que percibe le sirven para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Juanita desea adquirir mas flores para aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias, para lograr su meta ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer alegre y entregada a su trabajo, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para sentirse activa. Sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una mujer responsable y amable.
texts.en:
Juanita is 55 years old, married and currently does not have any dependent children. She lives with her husband in Illimo district, an agricultural district in Lambayeque province, an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling flowers in the Illimo cemetery for over ten years. She sells her flowers outside the graveyard and her main customers are people that come to visit their late family members. The business has been well-received and the income that she earns serves to help her husband with the family’s expenses. Juanita wishes to acquire more flowers in order to increase her sales and profits. In order to achieve her goal, she has solicited a credit of 2000 Peruvian nuevos soles (PEN). She is a cheerful and hard-working woman whose greatest wish is to continue working in order to feel active. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her a responsible and friendly woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flowers to expand her sales business

loans.name: Fadilla Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fadilia lo integran tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Ana Patricia L. quien vende cosméticos, perfumes y ropa. Ella comercializa su producto de manera ambulante e invertirá el crédito en la compra de perfumes.
 
Sus compañeras de grupo son Cinthya Auxiliadora H. P. quien vende verduras desde hace diez años y Yelba N. Bermúdez comercializa productos lácteos especialmente leche desde el 2000. Ellas invertirán el crédito en capital de trabajo para seguir creciendo y progresando.
texts.en:
The Fadilia group is made up of 3 hardworking women. One of these is Ana Patricia L., who is a street vendor who sells cosmetics, perfumes and clothing. She will invest the loan in the purchase of perfumes. Her fellow group members are Cinthya Auxiliadora H. P., who has sold vegetables for 10 years, and Yelba N. Bermúdez, who has sold dairy products, especially milk, since 2000. They will use the loan for working capital to continue growing and developing their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perfumes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel porch and put wrought-iron bars on windows.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen E. T. es una mujer trabajadora, humilde y esforzada originaria de de la Montañita 1 zona rural de Tisma. Ella hace seis años empezó a  vender de ropa y cosmético en pequeñas cantidades, hoy en día distribuye por mayor y tiene colaboradores que le ayudan en la comercialización y el cobro de dichos productos.

E. sueña con ser una gran distribuidora de productos variados pero para ello necesita invertir en la adquisición de estilos de ropa de vestir y de cama, cosméticos y plásticos como vasos, platos y panas entre otros.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen E. T. is a modest but spirited, hard-working woman from La Montañita, a rural area in Tisma. Six years ago she began selling clothing and cosmetics in small quantities. Today she is a wholesale distributor, with partners to help her with marketing and collections. E. would like to be a major distributor of an array of products, but to do so she must invest in the purchase of clothing, bed linens, cosmetics, and plastic items such as glasses, plates, bowls, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing, cosmetics, plastic goods, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay household expenses that they have in their home, health expenses, and improvements to the house – change the electrical system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For her home and personal family expenses (sickness)

loans.name: Monica Fabiola

texts.es:
La Señora Mónica B. es socia del banco comunal Génesis, vive en la ciudadela Calderón en de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por ser la cuna de escritores, por estar bañada por sus cuatro ríos que le hacen una ciudad especial, gracias a sus iglesias, su centro histórico, su gente.
 
Nuestra señora tiene 37 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija de 16 años que estudia en un colegio de esta ciudad. El esposo de la señora. Mónica tiene  profesión de policía en los Estados Unidos, emigro y el como conyugue nunca olvidó a su esposa ni tampoco a su hija,  siempre que puede las visita. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Nuestra socia tiene el negocio de elaboración de bufetes (comida para eventos sociales) hace cuatro años, los realiza bajo pedido, también elabora almuerzos hace cuatro meses, trabaja de lunes a viernes, todos sus platos lo aprendió a realizar ella sola, así  gana recursos para su familia.

 Es socia del banco hace dos ciclos, fue invitada por una socia de la banca; con el dinero de su crédito va  a pagar una letra de su automóvil que adquirido. Su meta es  crecer poco a poco hasta llegar tener un negocio muy grande.
texts.en:
Monico B. is a member of the Genesis village bank and lives in the suburb of Calderon in the city of Cuenca. The city is known for being the cradle of authors and for being surrounded by 4 rivers; it is a special city thanks to its churches, its historical center and its people. Monica is 37 years old, married and has a 16 year old daughter that is in the city high school. Monica's husband is a policeman in the US; he emigrated but has not forgotten about his wife and child and visits whenever he can. They don't have their own home so they continue to rent. She has run a catering business for special events for the past 4 years; 4 months ago, she started offering lunches from Monday to Friday. She learned how to prepare all the dishes on her own in order to support the family. She has been a member of the bank for 2 cycles and was invited by a fellow bank member. She will use the money to make a payment on her car she uses for the business. Her goal is to grow her business little by little till it is very large.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make vehicle payment

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
La Señora pertenece al banco comunal Génesis, vive en Totoracocha que es un hermoso lugar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por ser la cuna de escritores, esta bañada por sus cuatro ríos, es una ciudad especial, gracias a sus iglesias, su centro histórico, su gente.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, su primer hijo es de 30 años de edad ya es casado y vive independiente, su segunda hija de 28 y su hijo de 23 años de edad, están estudiando en una universidad de la ciudad, finalmente su ultimo hijo de 17 años sigue estudiando en el colegio y afortunadamente este año se gradúa. Su esposo es ingeniero comercial, gracias a él y su esposa, toda esta familia vive tranquila y feliz en su casa propia.

La señora María tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y también se dedica ala venta de cosméticos por catálogo hace diez  años, es directora de “moda internacional” en la Provincia del Azuay, no tiene horario de trabajo, trabaja de lunes a viernes hasta altas horas en la tarde.

Su nuevo crédito que realiza en la Fundación ESPOIR lo va a invertir para comprar ropa y cosméticos, su meta es darles a sus hijos una educación de primera y que estudien un postgrado.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Genesis village bank and lives in Totoracocha, a beautiful part of the city of Cuenca. The city is known for being the cradle of authors and being surrounded by 4 rivers. It is a special city thanks to its churches, its historical center, and its people. Maria is 52 years old and married with 4 children. Her oldest is 30 years old and married and lives on his own. Her second is a 28 year old daughter and her third, a 23 year old son. They are studying in the local university. Finally her 17 year old son is still in high school and graduates this year. Her husband is a commercial engineer, thanks to him and his wife, the family is happy in their home. Maria runs a business selling clothing and has sold cosmetics through a catalogue for the past 10 years. She is the director of "International Fashion" in the province of Azuay. She doesn't have a fixed work schedule but works Monday to Friday till late in the afternoon. This loan she will receive through Fundacion ESPOIR will be used to buy clothing and cosmetics; her goal is to provide a great education for her children and that they do post-graduate work.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blouses, pants, t-shirts, make-up, perfumes, and creams

loans.name: Elsa Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina es socia del banquito Génesis, vive en San pedro del cebollar, que es un prestigioso lugar de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por ser la cuna de escritores, esta bañada por sus cuatro ríos, es una ciudad especial gracias a sus iglesias, su centro histórico, y su gente.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 31 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 9 años de edad que estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo labora como empleado de una fábrica, con el esfuerzo conyugal han llegado tener  casa propia.
 
La Señora Catalina se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, desde que se inicio con los créditos de la fundación se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogos, fue incentivada por sus amigas para que comience en este negocio, se encuentra hace tres ciclos en la fundación, con ellos ha iniciado su negocio y da gracias a su hermana que le invitó a ser socia de nuestro grupo.

 Su nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar para la compra de más ropa para vender en su negocio y así de esta forma obtener más ganancias para llevar el pan de cada día a su casa.

 El sueño de nuestra socia es viajar a los Estados Unidos para conocer una nueva cultura.
texts.en:
Sra. Catalina is a member of the Genesis Communal Bank. She lives in San Pedro del Cebollar, which is a prestigious area of the city of Cuenca. The city is surrounded by four rivers and known for being the birthplace of writers. This place is special because of its churches, its historical center, and its people.

Catalina is 31 years old, married, has two children (ages 10 and 9) who are students at the local school. Her husband is a factory employee. After some effort, they were able to acquire their own home.

Sra. Catalina is dedicated to her household activities. Since she started receiving loans from Fundación ESPOIR, Catalina has been selling clothes through catalogs. Her friends convinced her to start this business. She has participated in three loan cycle with the Foundation, which helped her start her business. Her sister is the person who invited her to become a member of this group.

This new loan will be used to buy more clothing to sell in her business, which will allow her to generate more income so that she can provide for her daily household needs. Catalina dreams of traveling to the United States so that she can learn a new culture.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, T-shirts, blouses, dresses, and pajamas

loans.name: Tatiana Fernanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Tatiana L. es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive en la Ciudadela Uncovia en la Ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, reconocida por sus escritores y artistas, su bella arquitectura, sus 4 ríos quienes bañan esta hermosa ciudad, las manos hábiles de sus artesanos y su deliciosa gastronomía.

Nuestra socia es muy joven con apenas 20 años, vive en unión libre, tiene una niña de 11 meses de nacida, su esposo se dedica a la profesión de futbolista en las divisiones menores del equipo de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora Tatiana se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, también en sus tiempos libre y fines de semana, se dedica a la venta de ropa, la cual vende recorriendo  la ciudad, actividad que la realiza hace 2 años, el mismo tiempo que se encuentra en la banca comunal,  ha ingresado a este hermoso grupo de mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras gracias a una amiga.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para continuar con su negocio y así poder crecer, su meta es de tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Sra. Tatiana L. is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacer Uncovia” (Uncovia Rebirth). She lives in the neighborhood of Uncovia in the city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay Province. Cuenca is known for its writers and artists, its beautiful architecture, the four rivers that bathe this beautiful city, the skillful hands of its artisans, and its delicious cuisine.

Tatiana is very young, being only 20 years of age. She is in a common law marriage and has an 11 month old daughter. Her husband is a professional soccer player who plays for the city team in the minor leagues. She does not have her own house, so her family is living in a rental property.

Sra. Tatiana is devoted to her household activities, but she also sells clothing during her free time and on the weekends. She travels throughout the city selling her products and has been in this business for two years. Around the same time, a friend introduced her to the Communal Bank and she is now part of this lovely group of determined and enterprising women.

This new loan will be invested in the purchase of clothing so that she can continue her business and make it grow. Her goal is to have a much larger business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, shirts, T-shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Katty Corina

texts.es:
La Señora Katty N. es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive en el  sector del Crea en la Ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, reconocida por sus escritores y artistas, su bella arquitectura, sus 4 ríos quienes bañan esta hermosa ciudad, las manos hábiles de sus artesanos y su deliciosa gastronomía.

Nuestra socia es de la ciudad de Guayaquil pero vive en Cuenca hace 11 años la cual vino en busca de trabajo y un mejor porvenir para su familia, tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 20, 17, 12, 6 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo no esta a su cargo ya que vive con su abuelo en la ciudad de Guayaquil, su segundo hijo le ayuda en la economía de su hogar ya que se dedica a trabajar, sus hijos de 12 y 6 años estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando, su esposo al igual que nuestra socia se dedican a la  de venta de comida trabajando de domingo a domingo sin descansar un solo día, laboran desde las 8 .m. hasta las 3 p.m.

 Es su segundo crédito que realiza en la fundación Espoir, lo va  a invertir en la compra de otra carreta (carrito para vender comida) y así crecer en su negocio, va a comprar  ollas y una cocina que le hacen mucha falta, su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Katty N. is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacer Uncovia” (Uncovia Rebirth). She lives in the Crea section of the city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay Province. Cuenca is known for its writers and artists, its beautiful architecture, the four rivers that bathe this beautiful city, the skillful hands of its artisans, and its delicious cuisine.

Katty is from the city of Guayaquil, but moved to Cuenca eleven years ago in search of work and a better future for her family. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children (ages 20, 17, 12, 6, and 3). The oldest child is no longer under her care because he lives with his grandfather in Guayaquil. Her second child is working and helps with the household finances. The children who are 12 and 6 attend school in the city. Katty does not have her own house and lives in a rental property. Her husband works in the same business as Katty selling food Sunday through Sunday without a day of rest. They work from 8am until 3pm.

This is the second loan she has received through Fundación ESPOIR. She plans to invest the funds in the purchase of another food cart to grow her business. Katty will also buy pots and a stove that she lacks. Her goal is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a stove, pots, and a food cart

loans.name: Gladys Marlene

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Gladys B. es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, reconocida por sus escritores y artistas, su bella arquitectura, sus 4 ríos quienes bañan esta hermosa ciudad, las manos hábiles de sus artesanos y su rica gastronomía.

La Señora. Gladis es socia del banco comunal hace 2 ciclos y ha sido invitada por una amiga de la banca comunal, los créditos el han beneficiado para su tienda ya se dedica a la venta de víveres, en la cual lleva trabajando 4 años y le va muy bien ya que cuenta con una clientela muy fiel, le hace falta dinero para surtirle mucho mas a su tienda, en la cual está abierta para todos los días de la semana desde las 6 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m.

Doña Gladys tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 7 hijos quienes se encuentran de 30, 29, 28, 27, 17, 16 y 10 años de edad, sus 4  hijos mayores son casados y viven de manera independiente con sus familias que han formado, sus tres hijos últimos estudian los dos en un colegio y uno en la escuela respectivamente, su esposo trabaja como empleado privado en una empresa en la ciudad, con el esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal han logrado comprar su casa propia la que están pagando.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando víveres para surtir un poco mas su tienda, su meta es tener una tienda mas grande y también terminar de pagar su casa.
texts.en:
Gladys B. is a member of Communal Bank “Renacer Uncovia” (Uncovia Rebirth). She lives in the large city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay Province. Cuenca is known for its writers and artists, its beautiful architecture, the four rivers that bathe this beautiful city, the skillful hands of its artisans, and its delicious cuisine.

Gladys has been a member of the Communal Bank for two loan cycles after being invited by a friend who is also a member. The loans have benefitted the store where she sells provisions. She has worked at her business for four years and has done very well because she has a very loyal customer base. However, she does not have the money to restock her store with more products. Her business is open every day of the week from 6am until 10pm.

Doña Gladys is 53 years old, married, and has given birth to seven children who are now 30, 29, 28, 27, 17, 16, and 10 years of age. Her four oldest children are married and live independently with families of their own. The three youngest children are students, two in high school and one in elementary school respectively. Her husband works as an employee for a private business in the city. By working together as a married couple, Gladys and her husband have been able to pay for their own home.

This new loan will be invested in provisions to slightly increase the inventory of her store. Her goal is to have a large store and also finish the payments on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, oil, rice, soap, flour, eggs, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Nelly Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora Nelly V. es nuestra socia hace 3 años y ha sido invitada a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres emprendedoras gracias a su suegra, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la ciudad de Cuenca capital del Azuay, reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, su gente, su gastronomía siendo nombrada como Patrimonio cultural del Ecuador en 1999.

Nelly es socia del banco comunal Fe y Alegría, tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 9, 8, 7 y 3 años de edad,  sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo se dedica al comercio de CD de audio y video, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora Nelly es comerciante de calzado actividad que la realiza hace 4 años,  ha llegado a tener un local en el mercado de la Feria Libre, trabaja solo los días miércoles y el resto de la semana se dedica al cuidado de sus hijas ya que aun son muy pequeños.

 Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más calzado para así ampliar su negocio, su meta es de salir  adelante junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Nelly V. has been a member for three years and was invited by her mother-in-law to join this great group of enterprising women. She lives in the Feria Libre section of the city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay. Cuenca is well-known for its beautiful architecture, its people, its cuisine, and was named a World Heritage Site for Ecuador in 1999.

Nelly is a member of the Communal Bank “Fe y Alegría” (Faith and Joy). She is 28 years old, married, and has given birth to four children who are now 9, 8, 7, and 3 years of age. Her first two children attend school in the city. Nelly’s husband is a merchant who sells audio and video CDs. They do not have a house of their own, so they live in a rental property.

Nelly is a shoe merchant and has been in this line of work for four years. She has her own vending location at the Feria Libre Market. Nelly only works on Wednesdays and during the rest of the week, she takes care of her daughters who are still very young.

This new loan will be invested in more shoes so that she can expand her business. Her goal is to move forward together with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Carmen Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen E. es socia del banco comunal Fe y Alegría, vive por la Ciudadela Uncovia en la ciudad de Cuenca capital del Azuay, por su belleza arquitectónica, su gente, su gastronomía siendo nombrada como Patrimonio cultural del Ecuador en 1999.

Nuestra socia se encuentra de 59 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 4 hijos que se encuentran de 35, 33, 31y 25 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven de manera independiente con sus nuevas familias y sus dos últimos hijos trabajan y son quienes le ayudan económicamente a su hogar, su esposo es de profesión Tipógrafo y con el esfuerzo del trabajo en conjunto han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora Carmen se dedica a la venta de ropa la cual vende recorriendo los mercados de Azogues y Gualaceo, realiza esta labor hace 10 años, trabajando todos los días, pero hay veces que no sale a vender y se dedica a realizar comida la misma que vende en su casa.

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 4 años y los créditos le han beneficiado para comprar mas mercadería, su crédito lo va a invertir para comprar ropa para su exigente clientela.

Espera gozar siempre de buena salud para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen E. is a member of the Communal Bank “Fe y Alegría” (Faith and Joy). She lives in the Uncovia neighborhood of the city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay. Cuenca is well-known for its beautiful architecture, its people, its cuisine, and was named a World Heritage Site for Ecuador in 1999.

Carmen is 59 years old, married, and has given birth to four children who are now 35, 33, 31, and 25 years of age. Her two oldest children are married and live independently with families of their own. The two youngest children work and help with the household finances. Her husband is a professional typographer. By working together, Carmen and her husband have been able to build their own home.

Sra. Carmen sells clothing by traveling to the markets of Azogues and Gualaceo. She has been in this line of work for ten years. During the times she does not travel to sell clothing, Carmen prepares food and sells it from her house. She has been a member of her Communal Bank for four years and has benefited from the loans in order to buy more merchandise. This loan will be invested in the purchase of clothing for her existing customers.

Carmen hopes to always be in good health so that she can continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase T-shirts, blouses, dresses, trousers, etc.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe ( Portoviejo ) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen de Guadalupe se reúne en la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita de gente muy trabajadora, reconocida por su exquisita gastronomía.

El señor Juan Carlos es Comerciante de mariscos en el mercado numero uno de la ciudad de Portoviejo, el crédito que recibe es para invertir en el negocio, siempre ha viajado hasta el puerto pesquero de Tarqui en Manta donde compra por gavetas el pescado, trabaja con un socio y los dos se dividen el trabajo, nos cuenta que le va muy bien en el negocio y que lleva ya 10 años dedicado a esta labor, Juan Carlos tiene 27 años de edad, está casado y su  esposa esta dedicada a las labores del hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos.

Nuestro socio es muy responsable con su familia,  para el no es un sacrificio salir desde las 4 de la mañana a trabajar, su jornada es diaria y los días sábados y domingos es cuando mejor le va en sus ventas, aprovecha la feria, con este nuevo crédito seguirá creciendo en su negocio, invertirá todo el dinero en comprar pescado, camarón y calamar, nos comentó que gracias a su  mamá fue que él empezó en este negocio ella tenía un comedor en el mercado y él le ayudaba a trabajar desde muy niño y fue creciendo en el mundo de las ventas y ahora le ha servido de mucho para salir adelante; ha podido ahorrar y en los actuales momentos tiene su casa propia, se siente muy contento con lo que hasta ahora ha  obtenido.

La señora Digna forma parte del Banco Comunal Virgen de Guadalupe, este  banco se reúne en la ciudad de Portoviejo.
La señora Digna tiene 50 años de edad, está casada tiene 5 hijos, la actividad de nuestra socia es la venta de comida preparada y tiene un restaurante en la ciudad de Portoviejo, se levanta a las 3 de la mañana ha realizar las comprar al mercado central de la ciudad, aprendió de la labor junto a sus padres desde muy niña, desde hace 1 año empezó a trabajar lo realiza sola aunque su niña de 15 años le ayuda en ocasiones.

Los días domingos la señora Digna aparte del restaurante también vende pescado por libras, ella compra y revende. Con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en su negocio comprando arroz por quintales, legumbres, carnes y todo lo necesario para preparar los alimentos. El sueño de nuestra socia es poder mejorar el espacio para su negocio y mantenerse con salud para seguir cuidado a sus hijas y verlas realizadas.
texts.en:
The Virgin of Guadalupe Communal Bank meets in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabita. The people who live there are extremely hardworking and the area is known for its exquisite cuisine.

Sr. Juan Carlos is a seafood merchant at Market Number One in the city of Portoviejo. The loan he received will be invested into his business. He always travels to the fishing port of Tarqui in Manta to buy containers full of fish. Juan Carlos works with another member and the two of them divide the work. He says his business is doing very well and that he has been in this line of work for ten years. Juan Carlos is 27 years old and married. His wife devotes her time to taking care of the household chores and looking after their children.

Juan Carlos is very responsible with his family. He does not consider having to leave for work at 4am each morning to be a sacrifice. Saturdays and Sundays are when he sells the most because he takes advantage of the fair. With this new loan, Juan Carlos plans to continue growing his business. He will invest all of the money in the purchase of fish, shrimp, and squid. Juan Carlos says he was able to start this business thanks to his mother. She had a diner at the market where he worked as a little boy. As he grew up, he was exposed to the world of sales and now serves many people so that he can get ahead. He currently has his own home, so he feels very content with what he has achieved so far.

Sra. Digna is also part of the Virgin of Guadalupe Communal Bank that meets in Portoviejo. She is 50 years old, married, and has five children. She sells prepared foods and has a restaurant in the city of Portoviejo. Digna wakes up at 3am to go shopping at the central market in the city. As a little girl, she learned how to do this job from her parents. She started her business a year ago and works alone, although she occasionally has the help of her 15 year old daughter.

Apart from the restaurant, Sra. Digna also sells fish by the pound on Sundays. She buys her products and then resells them. With this new loan, she plans to invest in her business by purchasing rice by the quintal (46kg), legumes, meats, and everything else necessary to prepare her dishes. Her dream is to make improvements to her business space and maintain her health so that she can continue caring for her daughters and see them develop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish, shrimp, and squid

loans.name: Najibullah Group

texts.en:
Hokum Bibi is the leader of Najibullah Group. She lives in District 3 of Jalalabad city. She is 45 years old. She is married and has six children: two sons and four daughters. She runs an embroidery business. Currently, her husband has some financial problems. Therefore, she wants a loan to buy more rolls of cloth and different colors of thread to allow her to embroider more clothes. She wants to increase her business income to be able to support her husband and children. 

Hokum Bibi would like to extend her gratitude to both AFS and Kiva lenders for their effective process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Arjomand Group

texts.en:
S. Wahid is the leader of Arjomand Group. He is 33 years old, married and has three children who are in school. He lives in the district 3 of Jalalabad city. 

He runs a tailoring business. Currently his business income is not enough to meet his family's needs and pay salaries to his workers. Therefore, he wants to take a loan to purchase some rolls of cloth and thread to increase his business income and broaden his business capacity. 

He would like to thank  all Kiva lenders around the world for their effective process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and thread to broaden his business and increase income.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan is married with a grown son. He is a businessman from Beregovo. He offers car repair services in his hometown. Stepan launched this venture 15 years ago. He is an experienced technician who always tries to introduce newer equipment for a quality outcome of his work. His serious and responsible business approach has helped his business grow over the past 15 years. Currently, Stepan has about 50,000 grivnyas in inventory. His gross income amounts to 17,000 grivnyas, and his net profit is about 5,000 grivnyas.

Stepan is seeking a 10,000 grivnya loan to purchase spare parts for different vehicles he repairs in his workshop. A broader assortment of necessary parts will help Stepan attract more customers to his venture; thus, increasing his monthly income. Stepan is very serious about loan repayment. He has repaid previous loans without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To purchase spare car parts

loans.name: Vasilina

texts.en:
Vasilina is divorced with two daughters and a son. She is an entrepreneur from Uzhgorod who sells souvenirs, gifts and items made out of fur, like hats, warm vests and even footwear. Vasilina has been in this business for seven years. She has learned how to reach potential customers and make good deals with them. Many clients who have bought from her keep coming back for other reasonably-priced items.  Vasilina’s net profit amounts to about 9,500 Grivnyas a month. 

Vasilina is requesting a loan of 18,300 Grivnyas to diversify the assorted merchandise she offers for sale in her gift kiosk. Vasilina calculates all her costs. She has always been a financially conscious entrepreneur, which has helped her business develop and stay competitive in this region of Ukraine. Being a single mom, Vasilina works hard to make sure her children have all their needs met. One of her biggest goals is to see all three of them in college some day.

loans.use: To diversify her assorted merchandise

loans.name: Mikhailo

texts.en:
Mikhailo is married with a son and two daughters. He is a small vending entrepreneur from Khoost, Western Ukraine. Mikhailo sells groceries in a little store called “ABC." His food store is the only one on his street, which makes it a popular spot for many of his neighbors as they come home from work every night. Mikhailo has been in this business for 15 years. His net profit amounts to 5,700 Grivnyas a month. 

Mikhailo is seeking a loan of 6,000 Grivnyas to increase his working capital. He is a businessman of integrity and responsibility. He has gained a solid reputation in his community. Mikhailo tries to keep his good name by keeping up the good work and meeting his customers’ demands.

loans.use: To increase his working capital.

loans.name: Pavlina

texts.en:
Pavlina is a widow with two grown children. She is an entrepreneur from Belaya Tserkov. Pavlina sells sweets, noodles, dried fruit, cheese and meat in one of the local marketplaces in her hometown called “Bilotserkivets." She owns two vending kiosks and basically works without any days off. Pavlina started this grocery sales business five years ago. Currently, she has about 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory.  

Pavlina is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to increase the merchandise she offers for sale at the marketplace. She is hoping to increase her income as a result. Pavlina has been a widow for 16 years. She has endured many hardships and struggles. She works very hard to give her children a better life. Pavlina is planning to use a portion of the generated income to pay for her daughter’s college fee.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is divorced. He lives in Novomoskovsk. He is a market entrepreneur selling men’s outerwear, such as t-shirts and shirts, in the central marketplace of his hometown. Victor’s vending kiosk is located in a good spot, drawing many potential customers to his business. Victor has invested 45,000 Grivnyas in this business. He is making about 10,000 Grivnyas in income. 

Victor is requesting a loan of 14,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional seasonal merchandise. He usually travels to Odessa, southern Ukraine, to buy assorted inventory from wholesalers there. Victor launched this venture two years ago. He admits he is still in the process of learning some of the nuances of his trade. Victor’s sick father lives with him and is incapable of getting a job. Victor’s enterprise is the only source of income for the two of them.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Yana

texts.en:
Yana is married with a 7-year-old son, Vladislav. She is an enterprising venture owner from Novomoskovsk who sells sportswear, footwear and jeans in the central city market. Yana has been in this trade for three years. She has 90,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Monthly income is about 30,000 Grivnyas. 

Yana is very communicative. She has many acquaintances in the market. Her enterprising and adventurous spirit has helped her start this venture and stimulate its growth. Yana is an active hard-worker who usually works long hours. All her customers give her positive references. We believe her constant desire to see her business expand and grow is her best motivation which guarantees prompt loan repayment. She is seeking a loan of 8,200 Grivnyas.

loans.use: To develop her business

loans.name: Rukaya

texts.en: Rukaya M. sells a variety of slippers and children’s wear in Abura. She is single and has received junior high education. Rukaya has been selling slippers for 13 years. She is responsible for her own welfare. Her loan will be used to buy more slippers to fill her shop for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy more children’s wear to sell.

loans.use: To buy more slippers to fill her shop for sale

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina A. is single and has no formal education. She is a hairdresser in Abura. She has been a hairdresser for 13 years. She uses her revenue to take care of herself. She is going to use this loan to purchase more hair products for her customers' hair.  Faustina plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to buy a steam dryer.

loans.use: To purchase more hair products to use for her customers' hair

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary M. sells provisions in Abura. Mary has no formal education. She is married and has four children. Her husband works with a manufacturing company as a factory hand. Mary has been selling provisions for three years now. She helps her husband take care of the entire family. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to complete a building she has started with her husband.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah A. bakes bread to sell in Abura. Hannah has not received any formal education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an electrician. Hannah has been baking for a year now. She helps her husband with the general welfare of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to bake, so she can supply those who need larger quantities for resale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to bake

loans.name: Ayisietu

texts.en: Ayisietu A. prepares kenkey for sale and also sells oranges in Abura. The type of kenkey she prepares is commonly called “Ga kenkey". It is prepared and eaten by the Ga people in the Greater Accra region. As the Fante have Fante kenkey; so the Ga have Ga kenkey. The difference between the two is that corn husk is used for wrapping, whilst plantain leaves are used to wrap Fante kenkey, but the method of preparation is the same. Ayisietu has received senior high education. She is married and her husband is a mobile phone repairman. She helps her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare kenkey for sale and a greater variety of fruits, including oranges, to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to roof the place where she sells.

loans.use: To buy more maize to prepare kenkey for sale and fruit, including oranges

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu I. is married and has two children. She has received a junior high education.  Salamatu prepares tuo zaafi (often called TZ) at Abura for sale. Tuo zaafi is a local dish common with the people in the Northern Region of Ghana. It is either prepared from corn flour, sorghum flour or millet flour and accompanied with okro soup and groundnut soup with any kind of meat or fish of your choice. She has been doing this for six years. Her husband is a mason.  Salamatu uses her income to help her husband take care of her family.  Salamatu will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare tuo zaafi to sell. With the new profits from her extended business, Salamatu plans to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to prepare tuo zaafi to sell

loans.name: Hagah

texts.en: Hagah E. smokes fish to sell at Abura.  Hagah has no educational background.  She is divorced and has three children. Hagah has been selling smoked fish for 10 years. She has been responsible for paying school fees and utility bills after her divorce. The loan she wishes to receive will be used to buy more fish to smoke (a way of processing fish to keep it longer before it goes bad) for sale. She is hoping to use the new profits from her business to save to provide a meaningful education for her children. At the time of visit, Hagah was dressing the fish to be smoked.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke

loans.name: Hagra

texts.en: Hagra B. is divorced and has three children. Hagra prepares fante kenkey to sell at Abura. She has been through junior high school. She has been in her kenkey business for 12 years. Hagra single handedly takes care of her children. She is going to use the loan she hopes to receive to purchase bags of corn to prepare kenkey to sell. With the earnings from her expanded business, Hagra plans to save to build a small kiosk for her kenkey business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of corn to prepare kenkey

loans.name: Muniratu

texts.en: Muniratu M. sells provisions at Abura. She is married and has a child. She has received a senior high education. Muniratu has been dealing in these things for six years now. Her husband is a vulkanizer (he fixes car tires). Muniratu uses her income to help her husband provide the general needs of their home. Muniratu will use the loan to buy more provisions to fill her shop. With the new income from her extended business, Muniratu plans to save to open a new shop in a different location.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to fill her shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells provisions, plastic buckets and containers, and utensils at Abura. Mary is a widow who takes care of four children. She has not received any form of education. Mary has been selling provisions and other things for quite some time now. She is responsible for the entire well-being of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions and other goods for her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and other goods

loans.name: Azumi

texts.en: Azumi S. is married and has a child. Her husband is a carpenter and she has received a junior high education.  Azumi sells oranges at Abura. She wishes to use the loan to buy fruits including oranges in sacks to be able to sell in both smaller and larger quantities. She has been in this trade for six years. Azumi uses her income to help her husband take care of the family. With the new profits as a result of the loan, she plans to reinvest in other kinds of fruit to bring variety into her business.

loans.use: To buy fruits including oranges in sacks

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi K. sells secondhand clothes and cloth at Abura.  Esi has a junior high education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. She is responsible for helping her husband take care of the family. Her loan will enable her buy large quantities of secondhand clothes to sell. She is confident she will use the new profits from her business to save to acquire a shop for her business.

loans.use: To buy large qunatities of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua Y. sells tuo zaafi, commonly called TZ, at Abura. This kind of dish is prepared and well known by the people who come from the Northern part of Ghana. Ekua has a junior high education.  She is married to a driver. Ekua has been selling tuo zaafi for some time now. She is responsible for paying her accommodation and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients to prepare tuo zaafi.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare tuo zaafi

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Kuña Katupyry, se conformó en noviembre de 2009, actualmente están  desarrollando el 3° ciclo del programa comité de mujeres.
 Este comité pertenece a una de las zonas rurales de Encarnación,  por lo que todas las integrantes son oriundas de zonas muy humildes  y  desprotegidas alejadas de la ciudad es por ello que las mismas se sienten muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que les brinda el Programa de Comité de Mujeres Rurales  ya que les brinda la oportunidad de que la gente conozca los trabajos que realizan día a día para sacar adelante a sus familias.
En las zonas donde viven estas señoras hay poco movimiento económico por ellas deben viajar hasta el centro de la ciudad para ofrecer sus productos como por ejemplo, leche, yuca, queso, verduras frescas, maíz, maní, chipas, grasas, y otros productos que las mismas elaboran para vender.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Teresa a A. quien se dedica a la venta de leche.
Ella posee varias vacas lecheras, y para mantenerlas debe dedicar varias horas al día al cuidado de las vacas ya que su marido trabaja un día entero como agricultor.
La actividad lo realiza en ocasiones con la ayuda de sus hijos quienes también estudian.
Ella todos los días se levanta muy temprano para el ordeñe de las vacas ya al amanecer ya lo debe tener listo para la venta desde su casa  o trasladarlo hasta la ciudad.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas ya que desea construir fletes para ordeñe que facilitara bastante su trabajo diario.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupyry Women's Committee was formed in November 2009 and is now developing the third cycle of its Women's Committee program. This group belongs to one of the rural zones of Encarnación so all the members are from very humble, unprotected areas outside of the city. Because of this they feel very grateful for the opportunity offered by the Committee of Rural Women program which provides them with the chance for people to know about the work they do day after day to help their families get ahead. In the area where these women live, there is little economic activity so they need to travel to the center of the city to offer their products such as milk, yuca, fresh vegetables, cheese, corn, peanuts, tortillas, oil and lard, and other products that they produce for sale. One of the members is Ms.Teresa A. who works selling milk. She has several milk cows and to care for them she must work several hours each day taking care of the cows since her husband works the entire day as a farmer. She sometimes does the work with the help of her children who also study. Every day she gets up very early to milk the cows since by early morning she must have everything ready for sale from her house or to take to the city. She requests the loan for the purchase of wood since she wants to construct milking stalls that will greatly facilitate her daily work.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise at wholesale for retail sale, like cleaning items, books, sewing items, food items, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El Sr. Fernando G. S. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá compañía Espartillar, es casado con un hijo.

              El Sr. Fernando G. se dedica a la venta ambulante de artesanía hace más de 10 años cuenta actualmente con más de 80 clientes. 
Sus productos vendidos son generalmente productos de artesanía todos hechos y producidos en la misma ciudad de Carapeguá.
Ademas de la venta ambulante que el realiza el tambien posee un negocio de venta de productos de uso domesticos.
Pero la mayor parte de su tiempo lo dedica a la venta de artesania ya que en la atencion del negocio lo su señora.

          Con el crédito que obtendrá comprará muchas artesanías como hamacas de hilos, frazadas, sabanas bordadas, manteles y otros.
texts.en:
Fernando G. S. is from the Espartillar neighborhood in the capital city of Carapegua, and is married with one child. Mr G. makes a living selling crafts door to door which he has done for the last 10 years, and currently has more than 80 customers. The craft products he normally sells are made in Carapegua. Besides his door to door business he also has a business selling daily use products. However, the majority of his time is spent selling crafts since his wife takes care of the other business. With this loan he will buy a number of different craft items such as hammocks, blankets, embroidered sheets, table cloths and others.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hammocks, blankets, embroidered sheets, table cloths and others.

loans.name: 08.1.1 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Hanh N. T. (1) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Hanh is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 08.1.1 Nam Ngạn.

Hanh is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Hanh owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Hanh has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Hanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hanh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. N. T. Hau (2) is a 51-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

2. H. T. Son (3) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

3. N. T. Hai (4) is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

4. D. T. T. Hong (5) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5. N. T. Dong (6) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hanh N. T. (1) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 08.1.1 Nam Ngạn (08.1.1 Nam Ngan).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hanh kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, Hanh đã T. gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng T. gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Hau (2) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  H. T. Son (3) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  N. T. Hai (4) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  D. T. T. Hong (5) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  N. T. Dong (6) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon S. has spent her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learnt from her grandparent when she was young. She is now married and has three kids who go to school. Her husband works as a vehicle repairman and also frequently works alongside her on the farm. 

Fishing is a popular business which is able to deliver good profits for most operators. Phon S. and her husband want to operate this business to generate additional income. To start the process, Phon S. decided to look for capital in order to buy a net, trap, and other equipment needed to fish around the river.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita N. is from the village of Pigsag an Cagayan de Oro City. She is 55 years old. Nenita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Nenita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2008, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Nenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Pangkung Liplip Indah Group

texts.en:
Ni Kadek S. is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali.  Ni Kadek is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Pangkung Liplip Indah (PK-10161).


Ni Kadek is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Kadek owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Ni Kadek has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 100,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, Ni Kadek joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Kadek is requesting her first loan from MUK for 1,500,000 IDR, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by Ni Kadek from MUK.  Ni Kadek plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Kadek S. (0) merupakan 28 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Kadek adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Pangkung Liplip Indah (PK-10161).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Kadek sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Kadek menghasilkan sekitar 100,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Kadek bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Kadek meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana A. is from the village of Lingating, Baungon, Bukidnon. She is 74 years old. Susana is widowed and has eight adult children. To make a living, Susana operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for her business comes from buying and selling cashew nuts in the local community. Susana has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2007, Susana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Susana is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Susana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona B. is from the village of Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old. Chona is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Chona works in someone else's business running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Chona has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Chona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Chona is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Chona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Port

texts.en:
Mrs. Port S. has spent her life cultivating crops on her own farmland. This is a skill she learnt from her grandparent when she was young. Port S. is now married and is blessed with six children: two are married and the other four are single. Most of her children are employed, while her husband frequently works alongside her on the farm. 

Growing crops is an annual activity with which she has had great success. She is able to plant crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for growing, however, Port S. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So, she is looking for a loan to hire a laborer to plow the farmland, and to buy fertilizers, insecticides, a pump and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, insecticides, a pump and seeds

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa S. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 64 years old. Elisa is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Elisa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elisa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Elisa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Mrs. Yon S. is a young woman whose husband appears in the photo. They do not have any children and live in a medium-sized home in Kompong Cham Province. Presently, the couple owns a piece of farmland that they inherited many years ago from their grandparents. They use this land to grow different kinds of crops to earn their living. Their current income is not sufficient so Yon S.’s husband wants to sell chopped wood, but he requires some cash and accessories to operate this business. Yon S. has, therefore, decided to borrow $1100 for her husband to use as start-up capital for this new venture.

loans.use: To invest in starting a chopped-wood selling business

loans.name: Nai

texts.en: Mrs. S., 44, lives in a medium-sized home in Kompong Cham Province. Presently, S. earns a living as a laborer who is hired by people to do tasks for a fee. Her husband also works with her in the same sector. S. now has three young kids, two are employed and the other one attends school. Her school-aged child requires money to pay fees to continue studying. Due to a lack of funds, S. applied for a loan to pay her child's school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Non

texts.en: Mr. Non C. is a middle-aged man whose wife appears in the photo. Non C. collects or buys wood from the forest and burns it into charcoal for sale. By doing this, he is able to generate a profit for his family. His wife raises crops and pigs to earn a living. The couple is blessed with three kids who attend the local school. Non C. needs more capital to make more charcoal to satisfy customer demand. He has, therefore, decided to ask for a loan on Kiva.

loans.use: To make more charcoal.

loans.name: Urtnasan
