She learned this skill from her grandparent when she was young. She is now married and has five children. Three of them are already married and live separately, while the remaining two are single and attend school. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual business that brings a lot of benefits for this family. The couple is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Saut S. I will use some of the money she has borrowed to plant crops. Recently, both of her school-aged kids needed to pay their school fee, thus Saut S. I will use the remaining cash from the loan to pay this fee.

loans.use: To plant crops and pay a school fee

loans.name: John Irungu

texts.en:
John has been in the retail business for four years selling basic household goods such as maize flour, sugar, biscuits, etc.  He is 29 years old, married to Hannah Wanjiku and they have one child.

John was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to buy sugar and maize flour in bulk, which he will later sell in small quantities for a profit. In the future, John hopes to build up his business to the wholesale level.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and sugar in bulk

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea Z. is from the village of Salvacion, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 55 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Irenea owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Irenea has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Irenea joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irenea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Irenea is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Irenea from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zipporah Muthoni

texts.en:
Zipporah has been selling charcoal in the town of Naivasha for the last three years.  She is 30 years old, married to Peter M. and they have three children.

Zipporah was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the cash to buy four sacks of charcoal which she will later sell in small quantities for a profit.

In the future, Zipporah hopes to be the major supplier of charcoal in Naivasha. It is still the favored means of fuel for many locals who cannot afford alternative fuel, which is expensive.

loans.use: To  buy four sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Charles Deya

texts.en: Charles has been extracting stones to sell for 16 years. He is 52 years old, married to Rose Atieno, and they have four children. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to employ someone else to help with the extraction. Charles hopes to grow his stone extraction business and be able to take all his children to school.

loans.use: To employ someone else to help extracting stone

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly N. is from the village of Macapari, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 39 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Jelly owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Jelly has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Jelly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Jelly is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business by buying more baby livestock to raise. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Jelly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business by buying more baby livestock

loans.name: Philace

texts.en: Philace N. O. is 25 years old, married and has one child aged 3. She has been selling vegetables such as tomatoes, kale, cabbages, carrots, etc. for the last five years to the local people. Her business is located at Pipeline, a busy market near Kitengela. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is debtors not paying as per the agreement. However, she works very hard to keep her business going well. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy more vegetables to expand her business. She hopes to build up her business and plans to open a restaurant in the future. She describes herself as very hardworking and social.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, kale, bananas

loans.name: Daniel Agengo

texts.en:
Daniel has been working in quarrying for 22 years in the town of Naivasha. He is 42 years old, married to Irene Awuor amd they have four children.

Daniel was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to pay his casual workers who help extract stones from his quarry site. Daniel plans to buy a lorry which will make transporting stones from his site easier.  He currently hires transportation, which is expensive.

loans.use: To pay his casual workers

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita B. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 38 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Poblacion, Damulog, Bukidnon. Anita has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Anita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joseph Gatoto

texts.en:
Joseph has operated his butcher shop in the town of Naivasha for three years. He is 26 years old, married to Eunice Mbare and they have one child. 

Joseph was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy beef and add it to the goat meat which he sells in small chunks to his customers.

In the future, Joseph hopes to have an animal farm to supply his stock instead of buying his meat from other farmers.

loans.use: Buy beef

loans.name: Joseph Otieno

texts.en:
Joseph has been in the car wash business in the town of Naivasha for 8 years. He is 37 years old, married to Rasoa Anupi and they have three children.  

Joseph was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 2nd loan. He used the first loan of KES 15,000 to buy a mopping machine. He plans to use the proceeds from this loan to buy a buffing machine, which is used to add sparkle to old faded cars or to remove stubborn stains from a car's paint.

In the future, Joseph hopes to expand his business and his number of clients.

loans.use: To buy a buffing machine

loans.name: David Chege

texts.en: David has been in the motorbike transport business for 10 years in Naivasha town. He is 27 years old, married to Jane Wairimu, and they have two children. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. His first loan for 63,000 Kenyan shillings was paid well and in good time. He used the cash to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one he was using. He now wants to buy another new motorbike. He will employ somebody else to operate it for him, thus doubling his income. David plans to buy a mini bus in the future with the help of KADET, which he will use to transport people and goods from place to place.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Guzal

texts.ru: Аликулова Гузал проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 21 год. Не замужем. Образование среднее. Занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи и фрукты. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 2 года. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Guzal A. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 21 years old, single. She has a secondary education and is involved in agriculture. Guzal leases a plot of land, where she grows vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this type of business for 2 years. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Nekaiyoni

texts.en: Nekaiyoni has been wheat farming in Naivasha town for nine years. He is 38 years old, married to Charity Katito, and they have three children. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy wheat seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides in preparation for the new planting cycle. Nekaiyoni plans to buy his own set of farming equipment in the future which he will use at his pleasure, also saving him thousands of shillings which he has been using to rent this equipment.

loans.use: To buy wheat seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: James Nkoyetu

texts.en: James has been planting wheat to sell since 2003. He is 40 years old, married to Nelly K., and they have five children. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy fertilizers and pesticides in preparation for wheat planting. In the future, James plans to buy his own combine harvester and tractor which he will also hire out to other farmers to diversify his income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides in preparation for wheat planting

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina N.'s main source of income comes from providing transportation services to local community members. She is 23 years old, married and has one small child. They are from the village of Omonay, Damulog, Bukidnon. Gina has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase repair materials and tools needed to provide her service. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu S. is married and has five dependants. She has been through junior high school. Salamatu sells waakye and rice with tomato and pepper sauce in Abura. To prepare waakye she gets beans, rice and colored leaves from the market. She cooks the beans until they become a little tender. She then adds the colored leaves to give the boiling water of the beans a wine color, then she adds her rice to get a mixture of the rice and beans in the water. She cooks until the rice becomes tender to eat. Waakye is normally eaten with macaroni, wele (smoked cow hide), gari (couscous-like grain made from grated cassava), salad with pepper sauce, tomato sauce, fish of any kind, and meat of your choice. She has been cooking food to sell for the past eight years. Salamatu's husband is a mason. Salamatu uses the revenue she generates from her sales to help her husband with the general welfare of the family. She will add this loan to her own capital to buy more rice, beans and other foodstuffs to increase her production and expand her sales. Salamatu plans to reinvest the new profits from her extended business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Samrith

texts.en: Mrs. P. has been married for years and is blessed with two kids, all of whom are young. She is married to Samphors, 39, who drives a motorbike taxi. Mrs. P. used to be a laborer in a garment factory. Because this work only provided her with a small salary that was not enough to contribute to her family, she started selling goods in front of the taxi park. Mrs. P. sells items like snack food and soft drinks to passengers who wait to take taxis. By doing this, she hopes she will be able to earn much more income to fulfill all of her family's needs. Because she has just started the business, it may not go well due to lack of capital. Therefore, Mrs. P. has decided to pursue a loan from Kiva through HKL’s project. She will use the money to purchase more inventory for her store.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her store

loans.name: Joseph Muli

texts.en:
Joseph deals with soap detergents in Naivasha town. He has been in the business for one year now. He is 33 years old, married to Biata Muli and they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 2nd loan. He paid off his first loan, well and on time, which he had used to buy detergents to sell. His business, and the demand for his products, has grown with customers coming from far and wide. He now wishes to buy a motorcycle which he will use to deliver the detergents to his clients.

Joseph plans to open another shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle which he will use to deliver his products.

loans.name: Kilainga Ole Tinina

texts.en:
Kilainga has been in livestock farming for 13 years.  He is 56 years old and takes care of his three children, since his wife died.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy more goats to raise and to later sell at a profit.

In the future, Kilainga wants to open a retail shop to diversify his income.

loans.use: To buy more goats to raise and sell for profit.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia B. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Virginia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Virginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Simon Kamakei

texts.en:
Simon has been a farmer in Naivasha town for four years now. He does cross farming of potatoes and wheat. He is 28 years old, married to Ann Muleiyo and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy fertilizer and pesticides for potatoes on the farm and also to help prepare part of his farm for wheat farming.

Simon plans to buy his own farming equipment, which he will be using on his farm. This will allow him to save the money that he would use to hire equipment.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for potatoes on the farm.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 31 years old. She is married and has four children who are between 1 and 7 years old.  Beatrice is well known in her business. She sells a variety of goods, mainly hardware items, like cylinders, lock machines, etc. Beatrice has been in this business for about 5 years. The hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day.

Beatrice is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase a large quantity of those hardware items so she can start wholesaling, as well as improving her retailing business. With this loan, Beatrice will, hopefully, earn more profits, so she can keep reinvesting in her business and improving the lifestyle of her family.

loans.use: A variety of goods including hardware items etc....

loans.name: Merci Plus Group

texts.en:
Elodie V. is the leader of a Community bank named “Merci Plus”, which is composed of 24 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Elodie, 28 and married, runs a cellphone booth. She has been in business since 2001, selling eggs with a beginning capital of $70. With hard work and good management, she has been capable of diversifying her business by adding prepaid cellphone cards and wigs to resell in order to increase her working capital. She makes a profit of about $10 per day. Elodie’s ambition is to become a prepaid cellphone cards and wigs provider in her area. As she wants to develop her business, she decided to join one of Hope’s groups in June 2009. She is planning, with the next loan, to purchase dozens of prepaid cards and wigs. Elodie, with good strategies, has succeeded in building up permanent customers. She always talks to her customers, she knows them well by their names, and she never runs out of stock. Elodie has a six year old son who attends school.

loans.use: For purchasing dozens of prepaid cards and wigs to resell in order to increase her working capital.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida C. is from the town of Poblacion, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 56 and married with two adult children. To make a living, Adelaida raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Adelaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to  purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to renovate existing shelter for her livestock. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Adelaida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to renovate existing shelter for the borrower's livestock

loans.name: George Oluoch

texts.en: George has been extracting stones from a quarry in Naivasha town for sale for 10 years.  He is 34 years old, married to Lillian Achieng and they have three children. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to purchase another quarry and expand his business. George hopes to grow his business in future, earning enough to send all his children to school.

loans.use: To buy another site for extracting stones.

loans.name: Koyai Ene

texts.en: Koyai has been rearing animals for sale for nine years. She is 36 years old, married to Seriten D. and they have three children. She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy more goats and sheep, which she will rear to sell. In future, Koyai hopes to be a big meat supplier in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy more goats and sheep to raise and sell.

loans.name: Dodarbek

texts.ru: Чононов Додарбек проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Братья на заработках в России. Сам Додарбек имеет средне - специальное образование, медбрат. По профессии работал 2 года. Сейчас он занимается растениеводством. Имеет большой участок земли, где выращивает овощи и фрукты. В этой области более 7 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Dodarbek C. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 30 years old, married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. His brothers work in Russia. Dodarbek has a secondary-specialized education as a nurse. He worked in that field for 2 years. Currently, he is involved in agriculture. He has a large plot of land, where he grows vegetables and fruits. Dodarbek has been in this field for over 7 years. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Meliyio

texts.en:
Meliyio has been in livestock business for the last four years. She buys the animals, fattens them, and then sells them at a profit. She is 33 years old, married to W. Ole Kioma, and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the proceeds to fatten her livestock and sell them later at a profit.

Meliyio plans to open a butchery where she will also sell meat to the locals.

loans.use: To fatten the animals and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married. She has five children who go to school. She also takes care of her elderly mother. 

Margaret owns a charcoal store on Lubaga Road. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She buys these bags of charcoal from the villages of Luwero and uses public transport to and from shopping. Margret goes shopping twice a month. She has been in this charcoal business for nine years. 

Besides her charcoal business, she also fries and sells samosas. Margaret works from her home, so she doesn’t pay rent for her business. She sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. She works seven days a week.  Her business challenges includes transportation and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow big and start selling on wholesale only. 

She joined MCDT because of low interest compared to other MFIs. Margaret resides in and owns a four-room house. The family has access to electricity, but has no piped water. Her monthly expenses includes food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia A. is from the village of Kitingting in Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Anatalia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anatalia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Anatalia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Anatalia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anatalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Anatalia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Anatalia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dickson Palentuan

texts.en:
Dickson is 29 years old. He is married to Jackline K. and they have three children. He has been in livestock farming for 10 years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy calves which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

His future plan is to have a large farm where he raises cattle, both to sell and for milk production.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en: Bahrom A. is engaged in the farming business. He tills a piece of land that he inherited from his parents. Because of his farm, it is easy now for him to feed and clothe his family. Bahrom says, "I am the head of the family, I need to work better for the future of my children.” Bahrom needs a loan of 7,500 Somoni. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farm. The loan will truly give Bahrom a better yield so that he can continue to support the needs of his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: David Mukira

texts.en:
David has been selling fish in Naivasha town for two years. Being next to Lake Naivasha, he normally gets his fish at discounted prices. He is 49 years old. He is married to Emmah Wanja and they have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, by his friend and this will be his second loan. He plans to use these funds to make an entertainment place at his fish joint, equip it with a dart board and charge customers by the game. This will increase his income.

In future, David plans to build his own building in which to operate his fish business, saving on rent.

loans.use: To buy a dart board for entertainment at his fish kiosk

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah is married with eight children. Only three of her children go to school and the rest of her children are working. Hadjah owns a bar, selling all types of beer and local gin. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of local gin and crates of beer. She buys crates of beer from delivery vans and local gin from Mengo Kisenyi.  

She has been in this business for 12 years and with MCDT (a Kiva partner) for 10 years. Hadjah works six days a week. Her business challenge is the transportation of jerrycans of local brew from Kisenyi to her business in Mengo.    

She is aspiring to sell on a wholesale basis only. Hadjah joined MCDT because of the low interest charged. 

She resides in and owns a four-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of the local brew and crates of beer

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida G. is from the town of Poblacion, Kadingilan, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Aida is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Aida raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Aida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Aida is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Aida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mirahror

texts.en: Mirahror A. is 44 years old. He is married with three children. Five years ago, Mirahror, with his mechanic skills, started to do work for his neighbors and acquaintances. He learned this skill at another shop, until he had the opportunity to begin his own business. With faith and enthusiasm, his auto-mechanic business started to grow little by little. Villagers who use machines for their business always come to have their machines repaired by him. Now, Mirahror is finding that the tools he has are not enough to work at his job with full speed. For this reason, he is seeking a loan of 7,500 Somoni. This loan will be use to buy tools and materials used to repair autos. With your help, Mirahror will be able to provide for his children's education and for the well-being of his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing tools and materials used to repair cars

loans.name: Esther Wanjiru

texts.en:
Esther has been selling fruits and vegetables in Naivasha for one year now. This has been her primary business. She is 28 years old and married to Peter Mwangi. They have two children.

She was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, by her friend and this will be her first loan. She wants to expand her business and diversify her products.  She will use the cash to buy paraffin, which she will sell in small quantities to her clients as a secondary business.

In the future, Esther hopes to grow her business and operate a larger grocery store than what she currently has.

loans.use: To start selling paraffin as a secondary business

loans.name: Nematullo

texts.en: Nematullo has 18 years of experience in producing potatoes, melons, watermelons and other items in his community, which has a favorable climate and where the cultivation of these crops is an established tradition. Nematullo works the fields with the support of his wife and children, who are also dedicated to the production. This family has been perfecting and modernizing their production processes. The maintenance of the land has a high cost, due to the attention that must be given to the plants in each phase of the productive process: manually weeding, using organic fertilizer and using natural supplements for the control of diseases. These give better yields for their crops, since they prevent the soil from deteriorating so much, provide better conditions for cultivation at planting time and improve the quality of the crop, increasing its value since organic products currently obtain better prices in the market. At the same time, Nematullo also runs a transportation business with his lorry (truck). Nematullo requests a loan for the purchase of supplies for his crops, such as seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. Part of the loan he will use for paying for the partial repair of his lorry. The loan will greatly improve Nematullo’s income and his family's living standards. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Orocarita

texts.en:
Orocarita C. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 56 years old, married and has two adult children. To make a living, Orocarita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from  buying and selling personal products and some ready to wear items in the local community. Orocarita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Orocarita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Orocarita is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn L. is from the village of Kitingting, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 35 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Arlyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Arlyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Arlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Moses Ndirangu

texts.en:
Moses has been selling basins and buckets from his retail shop in Naivasha town for two years now.  He is 23 years old, married to Leah Wanjiku and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to add to his stock of basins and buckets as they are in demand.

In future, Moses hopes to grow and build his own wholesale store supplying the local market in bulk.

loans.use: To buy basins and buckets to sell

loans.name: Yusufali

texts.ru: Акачонов Юсуфали проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 44 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей. У него магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Этот бизнес приносит доход. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Yusufali A. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 44 years old, married and has 4 children. He has a secondary education and has been involved in retail sales for over 5 years. Yusufali has a store, where he sells food products. This business earns him an income. He is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
N. Betty is a 32-year-old mother of two. It’s now a decade since she began her banana-selling business in Yesu Amala, Kampala. She began it with persuasion from close friends and relatives who had come to the realization that her circumstances would improve once she did something that would bring her some income. This was in the wake of her husband’s demise.

With her experience and hard work, Betty has come a long way ever since, fending off the many operational challenges that come with running a business, especially in the outskirts of Kampala. Her business has been generating her profits totaling up to 500,000 shillings a month. With steady income accruing from her business every month, she has managed to give her children an education.

With this loan, Betty wants to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new women's clothing to sell

loans.name: Lukas Otieno

texts.en:
Lukas has been in the auto repair business in Naivasha town for eight years now.  He is 38 years old, married to Lucy Awino and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He used the first loan to buy a painting spray. He repaid the loan well and on time. With the proceeds from this loan, he plans to add more paint and paint mixers to sell in his paint kiosk.

In future, Lukas plans to grow the paint kiosk which is his secondary business. He hopes to become a major supplier of paints to the auto repair garages in town.

loans.use: To buy paints and paints mixers to sell in his paint shop

loans.name: Marcelline Francoise

texts.fr:
Femme commercante de 50 ans, mariee et mere de 4 enfants dont l'age varient entre 22ans et 15 ans, et tous vont a l'ecole, pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille,elle s'est lancee dans cette activite depuis bientot 20ans.
Avec le pret qu'elle compte recevoir elle tient a renforcer son activite en achetant des tissus et metrage comme voile et voilage pour les rideaux, tissus boussac, dentelles, lins et soies.
En moyenne elle vend 10000f a 25000f par jour ; surtout pendant les vacances ou il ya beaucoup de mariages , les clients achetent beaucoup de cadeaux a offrir; Pour accroitre son activite elle use de beaucoup de strategies; livraison a domicile, dans les administrations pour ameliorer ses revenus; et elle epargne une grande partie de ses benefices pour soutenir aux etudes des ses enfants et plutard voyager souvent pour aller acheter a l'etranger.Tres sociable ,elle fait montre d'une bonne reputation dans son entourage.
texts.en:
This is a woman merchant who is 50 years old and a married mother of four children, who vary in age from 15 to 22. All of the children are in school. To provide for her family, she got started in this business almost twenty years ago. With this loan she plans to obtain, she is anxious to bolster her business by buying some fabrics and yardage, such as veilings and sheers for curtains, Boussac cloth, lace, linens, and silks. On average, she sells goods amounting to 10,000 to 25,000 francs per day, especially during vacation, when there are many weddings. Customers buy many presents to give. To grow her business, she uses many strategies: deliveries to homes and offices to improve her revenues. And she saves a large part of her profits for supporting her children's education and later for traveling abroad often to make her purchases. A very sociable woman, she demonstrates her good reputation among those around her.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying quality fabrics and luxurious yardage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new kids' clothing to sell for the summer season

loans.name: Mma

texts.en: Mma H. cooks 'banku' (a local dish made from corn dough) and serves it with okra soup, palm nut and groundnut soup at Abura.  Mma has no educational background.  She is divorced and takes care of three children. She has been cooking 'banku' for sale for four years. She is responsible for the well-being of her children. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of maize to prepare 'banku' and to sell raw to those who might want to buy it. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy extra bags of maize to prepare 'banku' or to sell raw

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn V. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from selling personal products and ready to wear items in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to invest in expanding the business. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Loise Nyaguthii

texts.en:
Loise has operated her retail shop in Naivasha town for the last 11 years. She sells basic household items like plastic basins and dry foodstuffs such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and salt. She is a widow aged 43 years old and has four school-going children. 

Loise was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her third loan from KADET. She plans to use the loan proceeds to increase her shop's stock of maize and wheat flour, rice and sugar.

Apart from retail, Loise is also hoping to move into wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To increase her stock of dry foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Marziya

texts.en:
H. Marziya is 32 years old and is married with four children. She has a tailoring business at her home, in which she sews clothing for women and children. Her workmanship is very good and she has a good eye for design. She is very organized and with a good head for business. Marziya has had this business for eight years and this is her third loan from IMON International. With her loan, she is planning to purchase fabrics for sewing national dresses. Help this family with improving the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Marziya’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina sells retail items such as pantyhose, stockings and socks in one of the markets in her home town. She has been running this enterprise for 12 years and has invested about 100,000 UAH in her business.

Georgina is seeking a loan of 12,000 UAH to increase the assortment of stock. She would like to offer her clients a better selection of merchandise ranging from cheaper brands to more exclusive and quality ones. Georgina can be characterized as a stable and solvent borrower. She has repaid all her previous loans without any delinquencies. 

She is married with two children. Her family lives in Mukachevo in western Ukraine.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of stock

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.en:
K. Sadullo is from Dushanbe, Tajikistan, and is married with four children. He has been working in agriculture and cattle for the past two years. He is well known as a small producer in his community. Sadullo's young son is the motivation for his efforts and the reason why he is always looking for ways to work hard and get ahead.
Sadullo has applied to Kiva partner, IMON International, with the goal of obtaining a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crop. He hopes the loan will allow him to increase his yield above and beyond what it was in previous years. As for his future plan, he wants all of his children to go to university and get good jobs. You can be an important part of the growth of Sadullo’s business.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: James Mwaura

texts.en: James, a 37-year-old single man, wants to venture into the motorcycle transport business.  He heard about KADET from his friends and  joined a group that is currently registered as KADET clients. James is now requesting a  loan as start-up capital to buy a motorbike, hoping to develop a transportation business and in the future buy a pick-up truck to ferry goods and people to and from the main Niavasha market.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Leos Nduati

texts.en:
Leos is 26 years old, married to Virginia Wambui, and they have one child. He has been in the motorcycle transport industry for four years.  He is also contracted to supply cakes for a local baker in town.  After doing the cake delivery service for two years, he also believes he can bake his own cakes and start supplying them in town.  That is why he is asking KADET to help him buy an oven with this loan.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 2nd loan.  He used his first loan of 81,000 KES to buy a new motorbike which he's been using in his transportation business.  He paid the loan well and on time.

Leos hopes to grow the bakery business in the future and become a leading supplier of bread and cakes in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy an oven and start baking bread and cakes for sale as a secondary business.

loans.name: Aslon

texts.ru: Чураев Аслон проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование высшее, экономист. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он в основном покупает и продает украшения. Целью кредита является закуп золотых украшений.
texts.en:
Aslon C. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 25 years old, married and has 2 children. He has a higher education as an economist. Aslon has been involved in retail sales at a market for over 5 years. He primarily buys and sells jewelry. The goal of this loan request is to purchase gold jewelry.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of gold jewelry

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle P. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Michelle is married and has three adult children. 

To make a living, Michelle owns a business which provides motorcycle services to local community members wherein her husband drives the motorcycle and transports passengers in their village. Michelle has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Michelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Michelle is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Michelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
K. Mahmud is 48 years old and lives with his wife and four children. His plans for his family are to improve their quality of life and give a better education to all his children. 

Mahmud began working in the fields two years ago. It was his father who taught him how to work with the earth. Mahmud works in farming and also raises cattle, which he sells to bring in extra income. With this loan he will buy farming supplies so his harvest will be good and he can sell it for a good price in the market. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. 

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes Y. is from the village of Salvacion, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Agnes is married and has one adult child. 

To make a living, Agnes owns a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Agnes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agnes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional hybrid seeds to plant. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers for her corn. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Agnes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr:
Femme commercant de 49 ans, mariee avec 6 enfants dont l'age varient entre 23 ans et 8 ans, et tous vont au lycee, au college et a l'ecole primaire, connaissant sa charge , pour palier a la misere elle s'est lancee dans la vente de vaiselles en 2000 pour aider a ameliorer les conditions de vies de sa famille .
Elle vend en moyenne 10000f a 20000 f par jour; avec le pret qu'elle souhaite recevoir elle tient a renforcer so commerce en achetant de la porcelaine de Chine; de Sevres; des flutes a champagnes, des verres en cristal; des produits qui marchent bien , puisque sesclients lui demandent ses produits durant les festivites de mariage et differentes ceremonies.
Tres strategique,elle est parfois ambulante ou fait des depots dans les administrations pour accroitre ses revenus, malgre la crise , elle s'efforce a trouver de nouveaux creneaux de vente pour joindre les bouts du mois; et aider sa famille pour subvenir aux etudes des enfants qui sont a l'universite: tres connu dans le marche, elle a une bonne reputation.
texts.en:
This is a 49-year-old merchant, married and the mother of six children whose ages vary from 8 to 23 years. All attend school, be it primary, secondary or university-level. Given her family responsibilities and to avoid empoverishment she started selling dishes in 2000 to improve her family’s living conditions. Her daily sales range from 10,000 to 20,000 francs. With her foreseen loan she wants to bolster her business by purchasing porcelain dishes from China and Sèvres (France), champagne glasses and crystal glasses. These are articles that sell well, because her customers request these articles for weddings and other festive occasions. She shows good marketing strategy, as she also sells as an itinerant vendor and by leaving depots at administration offices to vary her sources of revenue. Despite the financial crisis, she keeps trying to find new sales outlets to make ends meet and support the tuition costs of her children attending university. She is well known in the marketplace and holds a good reputation.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dishes, pots, glassware, cutlery

loans.name: Mansurjon

texts.en:
M. Mansurjon has dedicated himself to the agriculture business. He grows potatoes, tomatoes, and onions on his land. His family is made up of his brother and his parents. It is important to point out that this gentleman has succeeded in this business and has been able to improve the condition of his business thanks to his sacrifices and great efforts. Today Mansurjon needs a loan to provide technological assistance to his crops which is why he confidently waits the approval of this loan knowing that it will be of great use in this business and that his family will greatly benefit. Mansurjon and his family sincerely thank you!

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene C. is from the village of Miaray, Dangcagan Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Arlene is married and has four school-aged children. Arlene owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2008, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 11,000 PHP and was used purchase additional inventory & as working capital.

Arlene is now requesting her fifth loan from HSPFI, for 7,000 PHP, which will be used to to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en:
N. Umedjon is 25 years old and is married. He owns a shop in which he sells spare moped engine parts, a business he has been running for the last 7 years. The income he earns allows him to support his family including his parents too. To meet his customers’ constantly growing demand, Umedjon would like to increase his shop’s capacity. The profits from these sales will allow him to continue to improve his living conditions. The loan will greatly improve Umedjon’s income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: Purchasing car spare parts

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida B. is from the village of Macapari, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Aida is married and has five adult children. Aida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 26 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Aida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 5,000 PHP and was used expand the business.

Aida is now requesting her second loan from HSPFI, for 8,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase even more products to sell.

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria P. is from the village of Kitingting, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Asteria is married and has three school-aged children. Asteria owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Asteria has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Asteria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 10,000 PHP and was used purchase baby livestock to raise & sell.

Asteria is now requesting her fourth loan from HSPFI, for 13,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Abdukosim

texts.en:
S. Abdukosim has been baking traditional bread since childhood. He inherited this skill from his father and grandfather. His working day starts at 4 a.m. when he and his assistants begin to knead dough, form the bread, and heat the stove. For the first time, Abdukosim kneads dough from 2 sacks of flour of 50 kg. each. The summer is an important period for his business, as citizens have many weddings and other family events. He needs to have a stock of flour and coal. For this reason Abdukosim applied to IMON International for a loan of 9000 Somoni. Abdukosim and his family appreciate your support in helping him improve his business.

loans.use: Purchasing the flour at wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver R. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. He is 42 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Oliver owns and operates a service-based business offering trucking labor services (soft drink trucking). Oliver has been engaged in this job for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Oliver joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Oliver is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his third from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is 54 years old and a married father of six children between the ages of 15 and 30. All his children, except one, have completed school.
Wesley is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for 30 years and has two employees. His main product is milk, which he sells to the local market. He is also a cash crop farmer and sells his tea to the local market. He also operates a retail shop in the same area. Wesley's biggest challenge in farming is lack of animal feed and water since there is no piped water and he has to rely on rain water and water from the wells.
Wesley recently completed his previous loan from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, for 60,000 KES and has requested this new loan for 80,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will assist him in paying school fees for his youngest son and improving his family's living standards. In the future, he would like to have a pure bred and build a dairy unit.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Sanginmurod

texts.en:
Z. Sanginmurod is 32 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in Dushanbe and has been working in the footwear sales business for the past 15 years. Sanginmurod is a very ambitious man with amazing selling skills. He was able to expand his small business, over the year, into a well-known shop in his neighborhood. Sanginmurod is a very enterprising man with a great desire to get ahead. His business has shown the fruits of his labor and he hopes to grow as a businessman.
Sanginmurod is requesting a loan of 5000 TJS, which he plans to invest in inventory in order to offer better service and variety to his customers. You can be an important part of the growth of this business.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty B. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 50 years old, married, and has nine adult-aged children. To make a living, Betty owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Betty has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Betty joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Betty is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: M'foulou-Ngoulou

texts.en: M'FOULOU-NGOULOU A. is a 36-year-old mother to four children. She is married and has been able to send her children to school due to income from her business. Her oldest is 19 years old and the youngest is just turning 3. She started her business selling a variety of clothes and sandals about 15 years ago and has been able to continue to provide for her family's basic needs. With this loan, she will be able to purchase better quality sandals and grow her business. Her dream is to improve her family's living conditions and send her children to a better school for a better education.

loans.use: Purchase better quality sandals to add to her inventory

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is married to a taxi driver and they have seven children.  None of their children goes to school. They are all mature people. Asiya takes care of her grandchildren.  

Asiya roasts bananas, maize, potatoes, and also sells yellow bananas. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of potatoes, maize and bunches of bananas. She has been in this business for over thirty years. She buys bananas and potatoes from Owino market.  

Asiya sells to all categories of people and works seven days a week. She has been with MCDT for nine years, servicing her nineteenth loan. She works on Lubaga Road streets and so doesn’t pay rent but pays daily dues of 800/=. Her business challenge includes seasonality (during the rainy season) which disturbs her work because she works from an open place. 

Asiya is aspiring of seeing her business grow big and starting to go directly to villages herself. Asiya joined MCDT because of low interest. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house but the family has no access  to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes food and medications.

loans.use: To buy more bags of potatoes, maize, and bunches of yellow and green bananas

loans.name: Cercio

texts.en:
Cercio L. is from the village of Salvacion, Kadingilan Bukidnon. He is 41 years old. Cercio is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Cercio owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to local community members. Cercio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cercio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cercio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan went to repair his motorcycle used in the business. Cercio is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a set of tires to continually provide service. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Cercio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a set of tires

loans.name: Kirui

texts.en:
Kirui is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He is 30 years old and married with 2 children, ages 2 and 4 years. Neither of the children is attending school.

Kirui has been farming for 6 years and has one permanent employee. His main product is milk which he sells on the local market. He is also a cash crop farmer and sells his tea on the local market. His biggest challenge is lack of enough water since they don't have piped water.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.30,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will assist him to cater for the family's basic needs.

He would like to have at least 3 quality dairy cows and a dairy unit in the next 5 years.

He is grateful to Juhudi for giving him a loan.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Gerardo Andres

texts.es:
