Gerardo S. es de la ciudad de Carapeguà,Barrio San Josè, es soltero, tiene 23 años, vive con sus padres.

 Gerardo comenta que terminó sus estudios secundarios y montó una despensita ya que no podía iniciar sus estudios universitarios por que no contaba con recursos económicos suficientes por lo que se vio obligado a realizar algún trabajo para poder solventar sus gastos y también ayudar a su familia. 

Hoy día gracias a su sacrificio y dedicación al trabajo va ampliando su negocio. 

Con el crédito él  podrá comprar  mercaderías para ampliar su negocio  como panificados, productos a granel, granos en general, embutidos, enlatados, artefactos eléctricos y otros.
texts.en:
Gerardo S. is from the San José neighborhood in the city of Carapeguá. He is 23 years old, single, and he lives with his parents. Gerardo says that he finished high school and set up a small grocery store. He was not able to start his university studies because he did not have sufficient economic resources. He felt obligated to work to be able to pay his expenses and help his family. Now, thanks to his sacrifice and dedication to his work, he is expanding his business. He will use the loan to buy merchandise to expand his business. He will buy things like baked goods, products in bulk, basic grains, sausages, canned goods, electrical appliances, and others.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baked goods, products in bulk, basic grains, sausages, canned goods, electrical appliances, and others

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina M. is currently in the business of selling earrings and necklaces in a shop and is requesting a loan to stock more ornaments to sell.  Regina is 41 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more ornaments to sell

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 29 years old. He is married with one child age 4, who is currently attending school.

He is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been practising mixed farming for 5 years and has employed 5 people from his community. His main product is milk which he sells on the local market. He also sells tea to Kenya Tea Development Authority.

His biggest challenge is limited land for expansion and lack of good dairy breeds.

Bernard has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo, after successfully completing his second loan of Kes.40,000. He has requested this loan for Kes.50,000 to purchase a dairy cow. He will be able to get a good source of income from the dairy cow which will assist him to pay school fees and get other basic necessities for his family.

In future, he would like to purchase more land to expand his dairy farming and purchase a plot of land to build an agrovet shop.

He is grateful to Juhudi for giving borrowers a chance to access credit facilities.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 33 years old. He is married with 2 children ages 2 and 4 years old. His elder child is currently attending school.

He is farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya where he has been practising mixed farming for 5 years. His main product is milk which he sells on the local market. His biggest challenge has been the high cost of animal feed which has affected his output.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.30,000 to expand his poultry project. The extra income from this loan will go towards the education of his children.

In future, he would like to acquire more land to enable him to venture into large-scale farming.

Martin is grateful to Juhudi because of the loan which will assist him improve his poultry farm. He also promises to repay well.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Barak

texts.en:
Barak T.  is currently in the business of selling local brews and beer out of her home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Barak is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bar.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Hilder

texts.en:
Hilder is 51 years old. She is married with 6 children who are all adults. She looks after her grandchild who is attending school.

She is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya. Hilder has been farming for 5 years and has been employing several people on a temporary basis. Her main products are milk and eggs which she sells at the local market. Her biggest challenge is diseases which are costly to treat.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.30,000 to expand her poultry project. She says that the proceeds from this project will go towards the education of her grandchild.

In future, she would like to construct some rental houses on her plot of land that will boost her revenue.

She appreciates the fact that Juhudi has assisted her obtain a loan which she had applied for in other areas but failed to receive.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda F. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to sell. Roda is 45 years old and married to a businessman. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a supermarket.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise (shirts and pants) in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary L.  is currently in the business of selling various items, such as biscuits, sweets, tea leaves, etc., at a shop. She is requesting a loan to stock boxes of soap and bags of sugar and salt to sell.  

Mary is 36 years old and married to a businessman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock boxes of soap and bags of sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Felicite

texts.en:
Felicite is 48 years old, married with 9 children who are between 7 and 28 years old.  Felicite is commonly known in the business of selling Irish potatoes, and she has been in this business for about three years.  Felicite starts her business from 7 am and goes to 4 pm every day.

After realizing her inefficiency at satisfying the demand of her customers, Felicite is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Felicite will hopefully earn more profit and this profit will allow her to reinvest more in her business.  Through the earned profits, Felicite will also start saving for her future as well as improving the lifestyle of her family.

loans.use: buying a large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Kuña Mbareté Group

texts.es:
Descripción:	El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Mbarete, se conformó en fecha Octubre de 2.009, en la ciudad de Encarnación y se encuentra trabajando cada una con actividad diferente. 

Trabajan en forma solidaria y van tomando conciencia de la importancia de trabajar en equipo para salir adelante y hacer frente a las dificultades que se presentan día a día.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Celia quien se dedica a  la venta de productos de limpieza, como detergentes para cubiertos, jabón para lavar ropas, lavandinas, todos estos productos son elaborados por ella.
Ella compra todos los ingredientes para la fabricación de sus productos y los vende a precios bajos a demás integrantes del comité y a varios negocios de la zona.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de soda caustica, esencias para los jabones, grasas, colorantes, y otros ingredientes.
texts.en:
The Kuña Mbarete Communal Bank was formed in October of 2009. It was formed in the city of Encarnación. Each member works in a different activity. They work in a unified way. They keep in mind the importance of working as a team to get ahead and facing the day to day difficulties. Celia is one of the members. She sells cleaning products like detergents for cutlery, soap for washing clothes, and bleach. All of these products are made by her. She buys all of the ingredients to make her products, and she sells them for low prices to other members of the communal bank and to various neighbors in the area. She is requesting the loan to buy sodium hydroxide, essences for soaps, fats, colorants, and other ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sodium hydroxide, essences for soaps, fats, colorants, and other ingredients

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at her home  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Lucia is 41 years old and is widowed.   She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Regine

texts.en:
Regine is 57 years old and is married with five children; most of them are mature and one of them is a teacher. Even though she is middle-aged, Regine works with great effort at her business of selling various products out of her home. Regine has been a businesswoman for a long enough time; this is her second loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. She has changed her business because these days she sells cosmetic products, water, juice, and so on.

Regine is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to continue improving her new business through purchasing more products which will help her to attract more customers. This will be one way of earning a lot of money. With extra money, Regine expects to have a big business, so she needs to save money in order to reach her goal.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma K. is currently in the business of selling dresses and pairs of trousers at the market and is requesting a loan to stock sandals and shoes to sell.  Wilma is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has 2 children; her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a pharmacy.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock sandals and shoes to sell

loans.name: Rene Prosper

texts.fr:
Commercant de 42 ans,celibataire avec 3 enfants a commence cette activite il ya de cela 19 ans avec une somme de 50.000f ,quand il a arrete ses etudes puisque n'avait personne pour subvenir et  le soutenir 
 Avec ce pret il compte renforcer son activite en achetant des cravates,des chemises, des chaussettes et des habits a la mode que les jeunes apprecient.
Pour faire croitre son activite il choisit les meilleurs marches pour s'approvisionner en habits et livre ses tenues dans les administrations et a domicile.Il sait faire face aux difficultes sur le marche, A l'avenir il compte effectuer des voyages, epargner pour ouvrir un magasin pour homme et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This businessman who is 42 years of age and single with three children, began his activity with a sum of 50,000 francs 19 years ago, when he had finished his studies and had no-one to provide for him or support him. With this loan he is planning on strengthening his business by buying ties, shirts, socks, and fashionable clothes that young people like. In order to grow his business he chooses the best markets to buy his supplies of clothing and he delivers his outfits to government offices and to people's homes. He knows how to cope with difficulties in the market. In the future he is planning to travel, save money in order to open a menswear shop and provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shirts, ties and socks

loans.name: Mujeres Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Mujeres del futuro, se conformó en fecha Octubre de 2.009, en la ciudad de Kambyreta y están desarrollando el 3er ciclo.  
El comité inicio su conformación mediante la comunicación de otras mujeres que ya estaban participando en la misma zona. 
Hasta la fecha se muestran muy conformes y con ganas de seguir avanzando con el trabajo  que vienen realizando.
La venta de ropas es una actividad muy común entre las mujeres de la zona de Encarnación y la señora Lidia es una de ellas.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas desde que comenzó a integrar el comité de mujeres, y se encuentra muy contenta realizando esta actividad ya anteriormente solo realizaba  los trabajos de su casa.
Lidia compra sus mercaderías y dos día de la semana sale a diferentes compañías de la zona de Encarnación para ofrecer sus ropas llegando casa por casa.
Su trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que debe caminar y llevar sus mercaderías al mismo tiempo, pero ella nos comenta que está muy contenta y satisfecha ya que puede ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, buzos, camisas, camperas, pantalones y otros.
texts.en:
This group called, “Mujeres del futuro” (Women of the Future) was formed in October 2009, in the city of Kambyreta, and is now in its third cycle. The group began through conversations with other women, also working in the same zone. They are very satisfied and have demonstrated a strong desire to continue to move ahead with their work. Clothing sales is a very common activity among the women in the Encarnación zone, and Lidia is one of them. She has been selling clothing since she began forming the group and she is very happy. Prior to this, she was a homemaker. Lidia buys her merchandise and travels to different parts of the zone to offer her merchandise door to door. Her work requires lots of sacrifice, because she must walk and carry her items, but she tells us that she is happy to be able to help her family with the household expenses. She is asking for this loan in order to buy additional inventory, such as sweats, shirts, pants, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Diaye Sounkar

texts.fr:
Diaye Sounkar B. est une femme de 62 ans; elle est veuve et mère de 07 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAKIDIOTO depuis le 12 juin 2005. Elle fait un petit commerce, et avec l'avènement de CAURIE-MF dans son village, elle a commence son activité par la vente de thé, sucre, cigarette, allumettes etc. Au bout de six ans, elle a construit un local où elle vend divers produits et denrées de alimentaires. Les profits qu'elle en tire lui permettent d'assurer ses charges familiales de veuve(nourriture et éducation des enfants)
Avec elle souhaite renforcer le capital de sa boutique qu'elle gère depuis qu'elle est membre du programme. Elle souhaiterait faire plus de revenus afin de pouvoir prendre en charge l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Diaye Sounkar B. is a 62-year old woman; she is a widow and mother to seven children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in BAKIDIOTO since 12th June 2005. She has a small business, and with the arrival of CAURIE-MF in her village, she began to sell tea, sugar, cigarettes, matches etc. After six years, she built premises from which she sells various products and foodstuffs. The profits she makes allow her to cover her family's expenses (food and her children's schooling). With this loan she wants to reinforce the capital of the shop she has been managing since she became a member of the program. She would like to make more money to be able to provide for her children's schooling.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her investment capital in order to reinforce her shop

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is thirty-seven years old, married, and has one child aged twelve years old. Her business is located at Mukuru kwa Njenga, a busy market, especially during the morning hours. She has been selling fruit and vegetables such as oranges, onions, kale, cabbages, carrots and other vegetables for the last ten years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is the changing weather which destroys the vegetables. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Rose is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more fruit and vegetables to expand her business. She hopes to grow her business and be able to open a supermarket some day. She also sees herself owning a home. She describes herself as very hard-working and honest.

loans.use: Fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Laetitie

texts.en:
Laetitie is 38 years old, married with 3 children who are 3, 6, and 13 years old.  Laetitie is an experienced woman selling Irish potatoes, and she is very proud of her business.  Laetitie's business hours are from 8 am to 6 pm every day.

Laetitie is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through adding a large quantity of Irish potatoes.  With this additional quantity of Irish potatoes, Laetitie will hopefully earn more profits which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for a better financial stability and continue building a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buying a large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married to a professional teacher  and they have  three children. All her children go to school.  Christine also takes care of her two nieces and her sister.  She owns a stall in Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, selling onions. She has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for five years. 

Christine wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of onions.  She works seven days a week. She at times sells onions to selected supermarkets in Uganda.  Her customers come from different areas within Uganda. She doesn’t incur any transport cost to and from shopping because she buys from her place of work.  Her business challenge is the ever increasing prices of onions due to floods which hit most parts of Uganda.  

Christine is aspiring of owning her own delivery van and also building her house. Christine joined MCDT because of its methodology of loaning to low income women who are in groups. Christine resides in and rents a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of onions

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama BA est une femme de 31 ans, elle mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAKIDIOTO depuis le 12 décembre 2006 et a 9 fois de suite reçu de crédits. Avec l'implantation de CAURIE-MF dans son village, elle a commencé commencé à initier une activité par la vente du thé, sucre, cigarette, allumettes etc. Au bout de quatre ans, elle a construit un local où elle vend divers produits et denrées de consommation. Les profits qu'elle génère lui permettent d'aider son mari sur les charges familiales nourriture et éducation des enfants elle souhaite également renforcer le capital de sa boutique qu'elle gère depuis qu'elle est membre du Banc Villageois. Elle souhaiterait faire plus de revenus afin de pouvoir prendre en charge l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adama BA is a 31-year old woman, married and the mother of two dependent children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Bakdioto since December 12, 2006, and obtained loans nine times since joining. After the Caurie Microfinance institution started operating in her village, she launched an enterprise selling tea, sugar, cigarettes, matches etc. After four years, she was able to have a store built, where she sells different products and foodstuffs. The income generated through the store allows her to help her husband take care of the family expenses, such as food and education of their children. She would also like to bolster the business capital of the store she has been running since joining Banc Villageois. She would like to increase her income in order to be able to provide for her children’s education.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolster her investment capital in order to expand her store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose I. A. is forty-six years old, married, and has five children aged between twenty-eight years old and eighteen years old. Her business is located at Pipeline, a busy market near Kitengela. She has been selling vegetables such as tomatoes, kale, cabbages, carrots and others for the last ten years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area doing the same business as hers so customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. 

However, Rose works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more vegetables to expand her business. She hopes to grow her business and become a market leader. She describes herself as very hard-working, entrepreneurial and ambitious.

loans.use: buying tomatoes, onions, etc.

loans.name: Denise

texts.en:
Denise is 42 years old, married with five children, aged between 8 and 20. Denise's husband is a driver; both work hard in order to develop their family. Denise owns a business selling beers and soft drinks. This is her 4th year of being successful in her business. The hours of her business are from 10 in the morning to 10 in the evening every day.

Denise is now requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing a lot of beers and soft drinks for the purpose of earning more profit. With this profit, Denise wishes to add various products other than beer to her inventory and to buy her own house.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Kossa

texts.fr:
Kossa G. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAKIDIOTO et a 15 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle vend des légumes et condiments au marché de Tanaff. Il lui arrive, avec son plateaux chargé de quelle marchandises de faire du porte-à-porte pour vendre. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de sept ans. Les recettes qu'elle en tire lui permettent de contribuer à l'éducation des enfants.		
		
Avec elle souhaite renforcer le capital de son commerce qu'elle gère depuis qu'elle est membre de CAURIE-MF. Elle souhaiterait réaliser plus de revenus afin de pouvoir de mieux prendre en charge les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kossa G. is a 47 year old woman. She is married and the mother of 8 children, for whom she is responsible. She is a member of the "Banc Villageois" of BAKIDIOTO and has been granted loans 15 times in a row. She sells vegetables and condiments on the Tanaff market. From time to time, she goes selling from door to door with a tray loaded with goods. She gets her supplies from weekly markets. She has been in this trade for over seven years and the revenue generated allows her to contribute to her children's education. With this loan, she intends to strengthen the capital of her business, which she has been running since she has become a member of CAURIE-MF. She hopes to make more profits in order to better meet her children's needs.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her level of self-financing

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia G. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 57 years old. Julia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Julia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Julia has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Julia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  purchase additional products to sell. Julia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Julia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 29 years old, married with 3 children who are 5, 7, and 9 years old.  Epiphanie makes a living by selling a variety of goods in her shop which is open from 6 am to 8 pm every day.

Although Epiphanie has spent 10 years working at her business, her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully so she feels she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  Once she gets this loan, Epiphanie hopes that her sales as well as her customers will increase and this in return will result in a greater profit.  With these profits, Epiphanie will reinvest more in her business and improve the lifestyle of her family.

loans.use: purchasing variety of goods which include cosmetics and foodstuffs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan M. O. is twenty seven and married with two children aged twelve years and two. Her business is located in a busy residential area called Tasia in Kitenegela and is well known by the name "Sunshine Medical clinic." She has been selling medicine and cosmetics to the local people for the last ten year. Susan says that this business is profitable except when there are no customers and she is not able to make the anticipated income. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more drugs and cosmetics to expand her business. She hopes to buy a plot and build her own home. She also hopes to give her children a quality education. Susan describes herself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: Drugs and cosmetics.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon F. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao Lanao del Sur. She is 49 years old and married with eight adult children. To make a living, Corazon owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products. She has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Corazon from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 21-year old single man from Lebanon, living with his parents and three young siblings. In 2008, he started selling chocolates and candies in his area. He found it a good business and started covering several other areas. He is now requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to increase his merchandise and introduce new products.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou T. est une sociétaire  de l’U-IMCEC à la caisse de Bambilor. Elle est âgée  de 49 ans et est membre depuis novembre 2009. Elle est mariée et mère  de 5 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 15 et 30 ans. Madame T. s’active dans le secteur du commerce et s’adonne à l’achat et la vente de lait frais et caille depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle a choisi cette activité  dans le but de pouvoir apporter sa contribution aux besoins  de la famille et participer a la gestion de la dépense quotidienne, des factures d’électricité, etc. Ainsi  elle sollicite un crédit  de 50 000 frs pour renforcer son activité  de vente de lait. Ce crédit  lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices  et de matérialiser  son soutien à la famille.
texts.en:
Fatou T. is a member of the Bambilor savings institution which is part of the U-IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual savings and loans institutions). She is 49 years old and has been a member since November 2009. She is married and mother to five children, whose ages vary between 15 and 30 years old. Mrs. T. is a trader and has devoted herself to buying and selling fresh milk and curd cheese for over ten years. She chose this activity in order to make a contribution to her family's needs and to participate in the management of its daily expenses, such as electricity bills etc.. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 francs to boost her milk selling activity. This loan will allow her to increase her profits and materialise her support for the family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por mujeres muy trabajadoras y unidas, con ganas de salir adelante y mejorar el nivel de vida para que sus hijos tengan un mejor vivir. 

Las integrantes de este comité desarrollan diversas actividades algunas  se trasladan a otra ciudad para vender sus productos, y otras pasan la frontera hasta la Argentina en busca de un mayor ingreso con la venta de sus mercaderías.

Todas las integrantes de este comité se ayudan y realizan actividades para tener fondos en común y así pagar el crédito que se les concedió. Una de las integrantes es la señora Cynthia quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en general como perfumes, maquillajes, cremas en general, carteras y otros.

Ella realiza sus ventas en la zona del centro de Encarnación y en ocasiones se traslada hasta la Argentina para comprar sus mercaderias.
Con esta actividad ella puede ayudar a sus hijos a estudiar y esta muy satisfecha por ello, y solicita el prestamo para la compra de maquillajes, cremas, pefemes y otros.
texts.en:
The committee is made up of very hard-working and united women who wish to progress and to improve their standard of living so that their children have a better life. The members of this committee are developing various activities: some travel to other cities to sell their goods, whilst others cross the border into Argentina, hoping to earn a better income by selling their merchandise. All the members of this committee help each other and carry out activities in order to raise common funds and be able to pay back the credit given to them. One of the members is Cynthia, who sells cosmetics such as perfume, make-up, creams, purses, etc. She trades in the central Encarnación area and sometimes travels as far as Argentina to sell and also buy her merchandise. With this work she can help her children to study and she is very satisfied by it. She is requesting a loan in order to buy make-up, creams, perfumes, and other cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bulk cosmetics such as colognes, creams, make-up, etc., for retail sale.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: Sandra Maria tiene 29 años, su actividad económica es la venta de recargas telefónicas y alquiler de triciclos. Hace más de 5 años que tiene esta actividad, pues dio inicio con el propósito de apoyar a su compañero y mantener a sus 2 hijos por lo que también tiene que ayudar a sufragar los gastos del hogar, no es la primera vez que Sandra realiza financiamientos pues siempre está pensando en el buen mantenimiento del negocio y es mediante estos créditos que su negocio se ha mantenido. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de recargas y realizarles mejoras a algunos triciclos que lo necesitan. El sueño de ella es tener un cyber pues hasta los momentos no ha podido cumplirlos por la falta de recursos.
texts.en:
Sandra Maria is 29 years old. She sells mobile phone electronic loads and rents out tricycles. Sandra started her business more than five years ago with the intention of helping her partner with supporting their two children and paying for the household expenses.

This is not the first time Sandra has received a loan since she has used them to maintain her business. She is requesting a loan to buy electronic loads and make fixes to a few tricycles that are in need of repair. Her dream is to have a cybercafé, but at the moment she is not able to achieve this goal due to a lack of resources.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electronic loads & pay for tricycle repairs

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique was born in 1978 and is married with 3 children aged between 6 and 12 years. Angelique’s husband is a driver and they both work hard for their family. Angelique takes care of one dependent who is 21 years. She has a small restaurant business. Her business is well organized and known in the area where she resides; her business is profitable and that is the reason why it was chosen by her. Angelique in these days employs 12 people from her community.

Angelique is now requesting her second loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more foodstuffs which will allow her to satisfy the demand of her customers. This loan will help Angelique to sell large quantities and good quality food which is one of the ways of earning more profit. With the extra money, Angelique expects to save for her future.

loans.use: Expanding her restaurant business

loans.name: Djilang

texts.fr:
Djiilang B. est une femme de 31 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIARIFA depuis le 12 décembre 2003 et y a reçu 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien géré et remboursé sans difficulté. Elle a commencé son activité par la vente du thé, sucre, cigarette, allumettes etc. Au bout de sept ans, elle a construit un local où elle vend divers produits et denrées de consommation. Les profits qu'elle en tire lui permettent d'aider son mari dans les charges familiales (nourriture et éducation des enfants)
Avec elle souhaite renforcer le capital de sa boutique. Elle souhaiterait générer plus de revenus afin de pouvoir prendre de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Djiilang B. is a 31-year-old woman who is married and the mother of six children to support. She has been a member the Banc Villageois of DIARIFA since December 12, 2003 and has received from it fourteen loans, which she has always managed and repaid without a problem. She started her business by selling tea, sugar, cigarettes, matches, etc. After seven years, she built a place where she sells various products and grocery items. The profits that she derives from it will allow her to help her husband to support the family (food and education for the children). With this loan, Djiilang wishes to boost her capital for her store. She would like to generate more revenue in order to be able to take part in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her investment capital

loans.name: Rocelia

texts.en:
Rocelia D. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old. Rocelia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rocelia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rocelia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rocelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rocelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rocelia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rocelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Eva

texts.es:
La cliente es la Sra Rosa Eva, la misma es separada vive con su hijo, tienen 48 años posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar se dedica a la microempresa ya que posee en su domicilio una despensa y al mismo tiepo tambien atiende la Peluquería que se encuentra instalada en su domicilio denominado Rossi, cuenta con 10 años de antigüedad en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora ya que ademas de sus dos negocios ella tambien atiende su casa, pero se encuentra muy satisfecha con sus trabajos ya que  mediante ellos pudo mantener dignamente a su familia.

Solicita el préstamo que lo destinara a la compra de mercaderías traídas de Posadas Argentina como de aceite, yerba, azúcar y algunos accesorios para peluqueria.
texts.en:
The client's name is Rosa Eva, who is separated and lives with her son. She is 48 years old and owns her own house with all the amenities necessary for a home. She works in micro business as she has a grocery store in her home and also runs a home-based hairdressing salon called Rossi. She has been running the business for 10 years and therefore has a very healthy client base and income. She is a very hard-working woman - as well as running her two businesses she also looks after her house, but she is very happy in her work because it allows her an honorable way to support her family. She is requesting the loan in order to buy merchandise from Posadas in Argentina, including hairdressing items, oil, yerba (maté, or Paraguayan tea) and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise: flour, yerba maté, oil, and hairdressing items.

loans.name: Rejelyn

texts.en:
Rejelyn P. is from the village of Western Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old. Rejelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rejelyn owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Rejelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rejelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rejelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional food containers & working capital. Rejelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Rejelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en:
Fidele is 40 years old, married with one child who is 19 years old and he also takes care of one dependent who is 20 years old.  Fidele is commonly known in the business of selling Irish potatoes and he has been in this business for about 4 years.  Fidele's business hours are from 7 am to 6 pm every day.

Fidele is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing beans, corn, etc..With these additional products (beans, corn), Fidele expects to earn a lot of money which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting for a better future for his family.  By receiving and using this loan, Fidele has a hope for the future.

loans.use: Additional goods mainly beans, corn for sale

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia, tiene 43 años, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo (Emerson tiene 15 años). Su actividad económica principal es llevar verduras a Puerto Maldonado. Ella viaja los días miércoles a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado y vende sus productos los días jueves, viernes y sábados en el campo ferial de la “Alameda”.  Ella requiere el préstamo completar el dinero que le falta para comprar sus productos. Ya es un año que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien.

Su sueño de Alicia es comprar un carro para poder trasladar sus productos a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado.
texts.en:
Alicia is 43 years old and the single mother of one son (Emerson, age 15). Her main business is bringing vegetables to Puerto Maldonado. On Wednesdays, she travels to the city of Puerto Maldonado, and she sells her products on Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays in the Alameda market. She needs a loan so that she will have enough money to buy her products to sell. She has participated in her communal bank for one year now, and it is going very well for her. Alicia's dream is to buy a car so that she can transport her products to the city of Puerto Maldonado.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with five children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Mariam owns a ladies salon and works upon all categories of hair ranging from plaiting, gelling, and relaxing. Besides this salon business she also sells maize bran. 

Mariam rents her business premises at 55,000/= for the salon, and 100000/= for the shop where she sells maize bran. Her customers are mainly women. Mariam buys cosmetics and hair relaxers from shops on Luwum street, Kampala city, and maize bran from Owino market. She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of relaxers and weaves.

Her major business challenge is that of transport, because she uses public transport to and from shopping. She aspires to build her own shops. Mariam joined MCDT to acquire more capital for her business. Mariam resides in and owns a three roomed house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of hair relaxers and weaves.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo tiene 48 años, su actividad económica es el taller de carpintería. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza créditos él se siente muy motivado por continuar trabajando pues es por medio de los financiamientos que ha podido mantener activo su negocio. Los que ofrece en su vivienda, el trabaja con ciertas herramientas rusticas, sus 2 hijos menores que son los que están a su cargo le ayudan en lo que pueden en su actividad, por lo que esto hace que Reynaldo se sienta muy orgulloso. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo en la compra de clavos, pega, maque, madera y herramientas. Siempre sueña con ampliar su pequeño taller y proporcionarle a su familia una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 48 years old. His business is a carpentry shop. He has operated this business for more than 21 years, so this is not the first time that he has taken out a loan. He feels very motivated to continue working, since the loans have allowed him to keep his business active. He works in his home using simple tools, and his two younger sons, who are still in his care, help him as best they can with the business, which makes Reynaldo feel very proud. The loan will be used for working capital, to purchase nails, glue, lacquer, wood and tools. His ongoing dream is to expand his little workshop and provide his family with a more comfortable standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La señora Nélida, tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene un hijo (Joaquin de 6 años). Su actividad económica principal es la venta de ropa en la feria dominical “Altiplano” de la ciudad del Cusco, ella viaja a las ciudades de Lima, Juliaca y Tacna para traer sus productos que son por ejemplo jeans, blusas y polos y su actividad económica complementaria es administrar su pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Ella requiere el crédito para comprar más ropas y para abastecer su tienda con productos de primera necesidad.   
Nélida pertenece al banco comunal “Kantu” de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Nélida is 32 years old. She is married and has one child (Joaquin, age 6). Her main business is selling clothing at the Sunday market called "Altiplano” in the city of Cusco. She travels to the cities of Lima, Juliaca and Tacna to purchase her products, which include jeans, blouses and polo shirts. Her secondary economic activity is running a small grocery store. She needs the loan to buy more clothing to sell and to stock her store with basic staple goods. Nélida belongs to the “Kantu” communal bank of the Arariwa Association, located in the department of Cusco, Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more clothing to sell and stocking her store with basic staple goods

loans.name: Diénéba

texts.fr: Diénéba G. est une femme de 62 ans, elle est mariée et mère 7 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MANKOLICOUNA depuis le 13 décembre 2003 et a eu a recevoir de crédit 14 fois de suite. Elle fait un petit commerce de "nété" (un produit alimentaire fabriqué à base de fruits d'arbre sauvage) et de balais depuis sept ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villages environnants et dans les marchés hebdomadaires de la zone. Elle vend à Dakar et à Kaolack où elle a des correspondants. Les recettes tirées de cette activités lui permette de contribuer à l'éducation de ses enfants. Avec ce prêt elle souhaite renforcer son capital  en vue de faire plus de revenus pour pouvoir prendre en charge l'éducation de ses enfants dans les grandes structures scolaires.
texts.en:
Diénéba G. is a 62 year-old married woman and the mother of 7 children. She has been a member of the MANKOLICOUNA "Banc Villageois" since December 13, 2003 and has received loans 14 times in succession. She has had a small business selling "nété" (a food product made from fruits of the African locust tree) and brooms for seven years. She gets her supplies from the surrounding villages and in the area's weekly markets. She sells at Dakar and Kaolack where she has contacts. The revenue from this activity enables her to contribute to the education of her children. With this loan she wants to build her capital with the aim of increasing her income. This will allow her to provide for her children's education in the large school buildings.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build her investment capital

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
El socio Gabriel, tiene 35 años y su esposa se llama Nélida. 
Gabriel y su esposa se dedican a la venta de ropa como por ejemplo jeans. Ya son 20 años que se dedica a este tipo de negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ellos tienen sus puestos de venta en los centros comerciales el Paraíso, Molino y Polvos Celestes en la ciudad del Cusco. El requiere el préstamo para comprar mas mercadería como por ejemplo Jeans. El sueño del socio es tener su propia fábrica de jeans.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 35 years old. His wife is called Nélida. Gabriel and his wife sell clothes, such as jeans. They have been working in this type of business for 20 years. Work has gone well, thanks to the hard efforts they have made. They have stalls set up at the Paraiso, Molino, and Polvos Celestes shopping centres in Cusco. Gabriel requires the loan to buy more merchandise. His dream is to one day have his own jeans factory.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise, such as jeans

loans.name: Honeylee

texts.en:
Honeylee C. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 22 years old. Honeylee is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Honeylee owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services to local community members. Honeylee has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Honeylee joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Honeylee has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to repair the motorcycle used in the business, by installing an extension back seat. Honeylee is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase repair materials and tools like tire tubes, screwdrivers, and pliers. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Honeylee from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
Maria Cleofe tiene 51 años, es natural de Ayacucho, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos de la cuales tres son independientes y uno todavía depende de ella. Su actividad económica principal de María Cleofe es vender comida en su propio restaurante que se llama “Tres Marias” que está ubicado en el barrio de Luis Vallejo Santoni del distrito de Santiago. (El distrito de Santiago de la ciudad del Cusco es uno de los sitios donde los pobladores son de bajos recursos pero se las ingenian para tener sus propios negocios). Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este tipo de negocio. El trabajo comienza a las 5 de la mañana donde empieza a preparar la comida para las horas del desayuno, del almuerzo y de la cena. Termina su trabajo a las 9 de la noche todos los días. Ella actualmente tiene una cocinera y una empleada que le ayudan con el trabajo. Hay días en que la socia lleva comida a las obras de construcción. 

Maria Cleofe pertenece al banco comunal “Kantu” y requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. El sueño de la socia es abrir un restaurante cerca a la Plaza de Armas de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Maria Cleofe is from Ayacucho. She is a 51 year old married woman with four children; three are living on their own and one is still dependent on her. Maria Cleofe’s main occupation is selling meals in her own restaurant which is called “Tres Marias”. It is located in the barrio of Luis Vallejo Santoni in the district of Santiago. (The district of Santiago in Cusco is one of the areas where the inhabitants manage to have their own businesses despite their low-income status). Maria Cleofe has been doing this type of work for 25 years. At 5:00 in the morning, she begins preparing the meals for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and finishes her work at 9:00 in the evening every day. Currently, she has a cook and an employee who help her with the work. Some days she delivers meals to construction sites. Maria Cleofe is a member of the “Kantu” communal bank and is requesting the loan to buy more supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc. Her dream is to open a restaurant near the Plaza de Armas in Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Odile

texts.en:
Odile is 29 years old and single. Odile lives with her parents and some of her family members work. Odile has chosen as her business selling various products such as : cooking oil, tomatoes, juice, biscuits and so on. Odile has an experience of one year in her business and she employs one person from her community as a helper so that her business runs well. The hours of her business are from 7 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day.

Odile is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision finance Company for the purpose of growing her business through purchasing more products. This expansion will allow her to earn more profit which will help her to change her living conditions.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Leonarda Chana

texts.es:
Chana, tiene 29 años, es soltera y es natural del distrito de Paruro del departamento del Cusco. 

Su actividad económica principal es administrar su pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Antes, su tienda estaba ubicado en el mercado de Rosaspata que está ubicado cerca a la plaza de Armas del Cusco pero como le iba muy bien hasta que los dueños  decidieron aumentar el alquiler de la tienda y tuvo que trasladarse a la urbanización Amadeo Repetto del distrito de Santiago del departamento del Cusco donde actualmente está ubicado. Por estos días del mes de Junio una señora le alquilo cerca a su tienda un local donde venderá Chiriucho (Comida tradicional de la ciudad del Cusco que se expende por Corpus Christi) y por los siguientes meses venderá comidas especiales y cerveza. 

Chana requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar para poder abastecer su tienda. El sueño de la socia es comprar un terreno y abrir un bar.
texts.en:
Chana is 29 years old, is single and is from the district of Paruro in the department of Cusco. Her main economic activity is to run her small grocery store. Before, her store was located in the market of the Rosaspata which is located near the plaza of the Armas of Cusco. Business was very good until the owners decided to increase the rent for the store and she needed to relocate to the urbanization of Amadeo Repetto in the district of Santiago in the department of Cusco where it is currently located. These days a lady rents her a space close to her store where she will sell Chiriucho (traditional food from the city of Cusco that is sold in Corpus Christi) and in the coming months she will sell specialty foods and beer. Chana needs the loan to buy more supplies, for example rice and sugar so that she can stock her store. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and open a bar.

Translated from Spanish by Halea Meese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more supplies such as rice, sugar etc.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou M. est une femme de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MANKOLICOUNDA depuis le 13 décembre 2003. Elle développe un petit commerce de chaussures et de draps de lit. Elle mène cette activité en collaboration avec son mari depuis sept ans. Son mari achète la marchandise en Guinée Bissau et elle s'occupe de la vente dans les marchés hebdomadaires et villages environnants. Avec les recettes ils ont construit un habitat pour la famille et c'est avec les mêmes recettes qu'ils assurent l'éducation des enfants. 
Avec ce prêt elle souhaite renforcer son capital  en vue de faire plus de revenus pour pouvoir mieux prendre en charge l'éducation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Fatou M. is a 43-year old woman, married and the mother of four children under her care. She has been a member of the MANKOLICOUNDA “Banc Villageois” loan group since December 13, 2003. She operates a small business selling shoes and bed sheets. She has been carrying on this activity with her husband for seven years. Her husband acquires the stocks in Guinea Bissau and she handles the sales in the weekly markets and surrounding villages. They used their revenue to build a home for the family and to ensure that their children get an education. With this loan, she hopes to strengthen her capital so that she may increase her revenue and better provide for her children’s education.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and better develop her commercial activity

loans.name: Maguette Diouf

texts.fr: Monsieur  Maguette Diouf M. habite à  Bambilor. Il  est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis mars 2010. Il est marie et père  de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 16ans. Il est âgé de 39 ans. Monsieur  M. n’a jamais bénéficié  de crédit  au sein de l’institution. Pourtant il  évolue depuis 2 ans dans le secteur du commerce et plus particulièrement  dans l’achat et la vente de pièces détachées. Parallèlement  il est chauffeur de clando et conduit un véhicule  R 21. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs destine a l’achat de pièces  détachées  automobiles (courroix -moteur, joints, bidons d’huiles) pour renforcer le local qu’il gère  par le biais de ses frères  immigres qui lui envoient  des matériels  de transport a travers les containers. Par conséquent  le crédit  pourra lui permettre d’accroitre ses bénéfices  et pouvoir prendre en charge les dépenses  imprévues  comme par exemple l’achat de  médicaments en cas de maladie.
texts.en:
Mr. Maguette Diouf M. lives in Bambilor. He has been a member of the Bambilor branch office since March 2010. He is married and the father of four children, varying in ages from 2 to 16. Mr. M., aged 39, has never obtained a loan within this institution. However, he has been in this line of business for two years, more specifically, in the buying and selling of spare parts. At the same time, he is an unofficial chauffeur and drives an R 21 vehicle. Mr. M. is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for buying spare car parts (motor belts, joints, containers of oil) to bolster his premises, which he manages through his brothers abroad who send him transportation supplies and equipment via containers. As a result, the loan will allow him to grow his profits and to cover the cost of unplanned expenses, for example, buying medicines in case of illness.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing his capital

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El socio Edgar, tiene 37años y tiene dos hijos. El socia es maestro panadero y  tiene dos panaderías pues es su actividad económica principal, el empieza su trabajo a las 4 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche todos los días. El requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital para comprar una maquina que cuesta aproximadamente S/. 7,000 soles.  El socio es nuevo y le interesa continuar en el banco comunal.
texts.en:
Edgar, our member, is 37 years old and has 2 children. He is a master baker and has two bakeries which is his principal economic activity. He starts work at 4 in the morning and goes until 11 at night every day. He needs the loan to increase his capital and buy a machine that costs 7000 soles ($2500 dollars). This member is new and is interested in continuing in the community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Gerrit Larsen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his capital to buy a machine.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn M. is from the village of Thailand, Basilan, South Cotabato. She is 40 years old. Ginalyn is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Ginalyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Ginalyn has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ginalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ginalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ginalyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Ginalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el distrito de Zaña, un distrito conocido por sus danzas y tradiciones de raíces afroperuanas, se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella y su esposo cuentan con una mototaxi (motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para transporte) con la cual brindan servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros desde hace mas de diez años. El encargado de manejar el vehículo es su esposo y diariamente recorre rutas en el pueblo de Zaña, el cercano distrito de Cayaltí y los anexos de la zona. Esta actividad es la unica fuente de ingresos con la que cuentan, por lo que siempre tratan de trabajar el mayor tiempo posible.

Precisamente, debido al continuo uso y al estado accidentado de los caminos de la zona, el vehículo ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, es por ello que Amelia ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento de la unidad móvil, así como en la compra de diversos accesorios para equiparla.

Amelia es conocida en su vecindario por ser una persona tranquila y de confianza. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Amelia is 50 years old, married and lives with her husband and their three children in the Zaña district. This district is known for its Afro-Peruvian dances and traditions, and is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She and her husband have a mototaxi (a motorcycle with a transportation cabin attached) and have been offering a freight and passenger transport service for more than ten years. Her husband drives the vehicle and everyday he travels around the town of Zaña, the nearby district of Cayaltí and other neighbouring areas. This work is their only source of income, so they always try to work the longest possible hours. Therefore, due to the poor condition of the area's roads and the continuous use of the vehicle, it has begun to suffer a few mechanical faults which require urgent repair in order for it to run properly. This is why Amelia has requested a loan of $725 (2000 'nuevos soles') from Edpyme Alternativa, which she hopes to spend on the repair and maintenance of the mobile unit, as well as the purchase of various accessories for it. Amelia is known by her neighbours to be a quiet and trustworthy person. She has worked with our institution in the past and has shown that she is punctual and responsible when it comes to making payments.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs involved in repairing, maintaining and equipping a mototaxi.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick O. O. is twenty years old, single and does not have any children yet. His business is located in a busy area called Tassia in Kitengela. He has been making mandazi (doughnuts) and selling to the local people. He has been doing this business for three years and has two employees.

He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is during the rainy seasons, because he does his business in the open air. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, spices, and charcoal to make doughnuts to sell in order to expand his business. He hopes to be able to buy a plot and build his own home in future. He describes himself as very hardworking, polite, and a good cook.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, cooking oil, spices and charcoal.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Chaipé  se encuentra trabajando, cada una realiza una actividad productiva para generar ingreso de esa manera ayudar a su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria quien se dedica a la confección de ropas para damas y caballeros.
Ella adquirio esta profesión muy joven, y actuamente se dedica a este trabajo de manera profesional, y realiza las confecciones sobre medidas. 
Hasta el  momento ella posee buena clientela ya que sus trabajos son muy apreciados por todos sus clientes por la calidad de sus prendas. 
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de materiales que ella utiliza en las confecciones como telas, hilos, botones, cierres, y otros.
texts.en:
This group from the Chaipé neighborhood is made up of members, each of whom engages in productive activities to help their families. Maria, one of the members, makes men’s and women’s clothing. She learned this skill when she was very young and now does this professionally by taking measurements. She has many customers because they appreciate the quality of her articles. She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies, such as fabric, thread, buttons, fasteners, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella es enfermera y estudio en la prestigiosa Universidad San Antonio Abad del Cusco. Actualmente, la socia trabaja en el colegio San José de la Sallé. Ya son 6 años que trabaja atendiendo a los alumnos, Margarita trabaja en dos turnos, el primer turno empieza a las 9 de mañana hasta las 12 del medio día y el segundo turno empieza a las 3 de la tarde hasta las 4 de la tarde, ella trabaja todos los días. 

Margarita nos cuenta que en el colegio dictaron clases de manualidades y la socia participo en las clases y entonces le enseñaron a confeccionar peluches.

Margarita es socia nueva en el banco comunal y requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para elaborar peluches como por ejemplo tela peluche, hilos, agujas y moldes. El sueño de la socia es abrir una tienda de peluches.
texts.en:
Margarita is 31, married, and has two children. She is a nurse and studied at the prestigious University of San Antonio Abad of Cusco. Currently the member works at the San José de la Sallé school. She has been there for 6 years taking care of the students. Margarita works on two shifts: the first shift begins at 9 in the morning and finishes at 12 noon, and the second shift begins at 3 in the afternoon and finishes at 4 pm. She works every day. Margarita tells us that in the school classes are taught in different skills and this member took the classes and learned how to make stuffed animals. Margarita is a new member in the communal bank and needs the loan to buy materials to make the stuffed animals such as the fabric, thread, needles and patterns. This member's dream is to open a stuffed animal store.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make stuffed animals such as the fabric, thread, needles and patterns

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en:
Leonia is a single mother of six children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t have to take care of any additional family members. She owns a bar selling all types of beers and local drinks. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin.

She has been in this business for 15 years. She buys these crates of beer from delivery vans, and local gin from suppliers who get them from Fort Portal district. Leonia works seven days a week. Her business challenges include defaulters and the rainy season. She aspires of owning a fully stocked bar. Leonia joined MCDT because of the low interest charged. Leonia resides and rents a one-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local brew.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn M. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 38 years old. Analyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Analyn owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing hairdressing & beauty services, including pedicure and manicure, to local community members. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Analyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Analyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco F.  tiene 31 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Encarnacion  en el Barrio San Pedro, esta casado tiene una hija.
Es propietario de una despensa muy bien surtida con todos los productos de primera necesidad. 
Es una persona muy trabajadora y gracias a la actividad que realiza ha podido salir adelante e ir creciendo  en su microempresa.
 El Destino del crédito sera para realizar compras de mas mercaderias para su negocio como yerba, harina, fideos, azucar, y otros.
texts.en:
Francisco is 31 years old and lives in the city of Encarnacion in the San Pedro neighborhood. He is married and has a daughter. He owns a well-stocked store and carries a complete variety of staple goods. He is a very hard worker and as a result his efforts he has been able to progress and grow his business. Francisco plans to use the loan to purchase more merchandise for his store such as herbs, flour, noodles, sugar etc.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale merchandise  (flour, oil, sugar, noodles, etc)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana, tiene 22 años, es soltera y es natural de la ciudad Cusco. Su actividad económica principal es administrar su tienda de abarrotes que está ubicado en la urbanización de Amadeo Repetto del distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar un conservador de alimentos que cuesta S/. 1500 soles y también desea comprar comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, carnes y pollos. 

El sueño de la socia es abrir una agencia de viajes y comprar un terreno. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Kantu” de la Asociación Arariwa y ya está un año y medio prestándose créditos de la Asociación, ella se considera una persona responsable y no se atrasa con las cuotas de pago.
texts.en:
Roxana is a single 22 year old from the city of Cusco. Her main economic activity is tending to her grocery store that is located in the suburbs of Amadeo Repetto in the Santiago district of the Cusco province. She needs the loan to purchase equipment to keep her food fresh that costs 1500 soles, and she also wants to purchase food such as rice, sugar, meats, and poultry. Roxana’s dream is to open a travel agency and purchase a plot of land. She belongs to the communal bank “Kantu” of the Arariwa Association, and it has been a year and a half since she started borrowing from the association. She is considered to be a responsible person who does not fall behind her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a machine to keep food fresh and food such as rice, sugar, meats, and chicken

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
