Lilia S. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 48 years old, married, and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
El socio Nicanor, tiene 67 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la carpintería. Su negocio está ubicado en Luis Vallejo Santoni en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. El requiere el préstamo para comprar más madera. El pertenece al banco comunal “Kantu” de la Asociación Arariwa y está varios años prestándose créditos de la Asociación, él se considera una persona responsable y desea continuar participando en el banco comunal porque le gusta ahorrar.   

Nicanor se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Nicanor is 67 years old, married, and has two children. His main business activity is carpentry. He has a business located in Luis Vallejo Santoni in the district of Santiago, province of Cusco. Nicanor needs a loan to buy more wood. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Kantu” and has received loans from Asociación Arariwa for several years. Nicanor is considered to be a responsible person and hopes to continue participating in his Communal Bank because he enjoys saving.

Nicanor is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided, so he promises to complete his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr:
jeune homme homme de 45 ans celibataire et pere de 3 enfants allant de 15 ans a 5 ans,a commence cette activite depuis 10 ans avec un seul carton de viande arriere ; aujourd'hui il vend 12 a 13 cartons par semaines de differents produits de sa boucherie, il a recette journaliere de 50.000f a 70.000f par jour.
Avec ce pret il veut  renforcer son stock en achetant meme les produits qu'il n'a pas comme le cotis de porcs,cartons de saucissons, viande de moutons, et s'approvisionne dans les grands chambre froide de la capitale et de Pointe Noire.
Il a des grandes ambitions ouvrir a la longue une grande boucherie ou les desirs de ses clients seront satisfaits.Tres aimable , tout le monde le connait dans le marche ou il exerce , fait preuve d'une bonne moralite et est entrain de se battre pour amener ses enfants dans des bonnes ecoles et construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
A young single 45 year old man and father of 3 children from 15 to 5 years old. He started this business 10 years ago with a single carton of meat; today he sells 12 to 13 cartons per week of different items from his butcher's shop. His daily income is from 50.000f to 70.000. WIth this loan he would like to increase his back stock and even but some items he currently doesn't carry such as pork chops, boxes of sausages, lamb and get his supplies from the large cold rooms in the capitol and Pointe Noire. In the long term he wishes to open a larger butchers shop where all his clients needs can be met. He is very likable and well known by everyone in the market where he works. He has proven his good morals he is currently fighting to enroll his kids in good schools and build a house for his family.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of cartons of meat, beef, pork and sausages

loans.name: Metche

texts.en:
Metche L. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 44 years old, married, and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Metche owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of dried fish in the local community. Metche has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Metche joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Metche has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Metche is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Metche from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 44 años, vive con su hijo Davis (21), quien trabaja en construcción.Desde hace 7 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de collares, anillos, pulseras, entre otros accesorios para damas, que elabora  a base de mostacillas, y vende los modelos que produce de acuerdo a los pedidos que le realizan. A Gladys le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues además de resultarle bastante rentable, también es como un pasatiempo, donde puede reflejar toda su creatividad, pues muchos de los diseños fueron creados por ella misma. La mayor parte del día la emplea en realizar esta labor, y además  le sobra  el tiempo necesario para realizar las labores de su hogar, pues si no se da sus pausas, el trabajo suele resultarle muy cansado. En el futuro quiere seguir mejorando su negocio y también quiere contratar a algunas  amigas para que le ayuden a instalar un taller.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete que será  muy puntual y responsable  con el pago de sus cuotas.Tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de  material (mostacillas) que necesita  para continuar elaborando mayor cantidad de joyas.
texts.en:
Gladys, 44, lives with her son Davis (21), who works in construction. For 7 years she has been making and selling necklaces, rings, bracelets, and other women's accessories that she makes out of beads. She sells her items according to orders that she has. Gladys likes her work very much, and in addition it is sufficiently profitable. It is also a hobby for her where she can express her creativity. She creates many of her designs herself. She does this work for much of the day, and she also has spare time to carry out the household tasks, because if she does not take breaks the work can be very tiring. In the future she wants to continue to improve her business and also hire some friends so that they can help her set up a workshop. This is the second loan that she has taken from MFP, and she pledges that she will be very punctual and responsible with her payments. She is planning on investing the money requested in the purchase of a large quantity of materials (beads) that she needs to continue producing a larger quantity of jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials (beads) for her business

loans.name: Astrid

texts.es: Astrid tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más D. 4 años se dedica a vender artículos para el hogar como frazadas, colchas manteles entre otros artículos más. Su modo D. trabajo lo realiza dentro D. su domicilio, en donD. lleva a sus clientes para ofrecerle la mercadería que tiene, dejándolo a crédito, y el tiempo D. pago dependerá del acuerdo que tenga con cada uno D. sus compradores. Este negocio le ha sido muy rentable, ya que pueD. aumentar sus ganancias, es por ello que desea aumentar su capital D. trabajo. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por tal motivo será muy responsable con sus pago, puesto que desea volver a contar con nuevos aportes futuro. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más artículos para el hogar como frazadas y colchas.
texts.en:
Astrid is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four children in her own home. For more than four years, she has been selling household items such as blankets, bedspreads, tablecloths, and other articles. Her method of working is by having her customers come to her home to purchase the merchandise she offers. She extends credit and is paid according to the agreement she reaches with each of her customers. This business is very profitable and has allowed her to increase her earnings. For this reason, she wants to increase her operating capital.

This is her second loan with MFP. Astrid has been very responsible with her payments because she wants to be eligible for new loans in the future. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more household items such as blankets and bedspreads.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blankets & bedspreads

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se encuentra  trabajando, y esta conformada por señoras muy  luchadoras y  humildes, y se esfuerzan y realizan sus actividades dependiendo de las facilidades con que cuentan.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Fatima quien se dedica a la venta de ropas desde hace un buen tiempo.
Ella realiza las ventas de sus prendas de vestir desde su casa  donde expone sus mercaderias.
Ella ademas de la venta de ropas hace comestibles para generar otros ingresos y asi se siente muy satisfecha con las actividades que realiza para ayudar  a su familia.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de ropas para invierno como camperas, sueter, pantalones y otros.
texts.en:
This group is currently in operation and is made up of hard-working, humble women who put in a lot of effort to carry out their activities according to the resources they have available. One of the group members is Fatima who has sold clothing for quite some time. She sells her wares from home which is where she displays them. In addition, she sells food to generate extra income and she feels very satisfied with the activities she’s engaged in to help her family. She is asking for funds to buy winter clothes like: jackets, sweaters, pants, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fall-winter season clothing.

loans.name: Goreth

texts.en:
Goreth is married with three children and all her children go to school. She  also takes care of additional family members (cousin, sister). She owns a pharmacy selling tablets and syrups. She wants to use this loan to buy more tins of  tablets and boxes of syrups.

She has been in this business for a very long time. She rents her shop at 45000/= per month and sells mainly on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. Her business challenges are thieves and debts. She aspires of seeing her business grow big and own a fully stocked pharmacy. She joined MCDT because it offers good services and customer care.

She resides in, and owns, a two room house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying utility bills, food, rent for her business premises, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of syrups and tins of tablets.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María es una madre de familia de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en un sector urbano marginal del distrito de Castilla, un distrito que pertenece a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, se encuentra ubicado a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de todo tipo de condimentos y de chifles (aperitivo típico de la región Piura, consistente en finas láminas de plátanos fritos en cocinas de leña o de carbón de algarrobo), este negocio lo tiene instalado en su domicilio y consiste en una de la principales fuentes de ingreso para su familia por lo que dia a dia da lo mejor de si para sacarlo adelante.

Ana María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más chifles, ya que este producto tiene bastante demanda por la zona, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo

Ana María es una mujer trabajadora y que lucha diariamente por sacar adelante a su familia y por darles una mejor calidad de vida. Su mayor anhelo es terminar de construir su casa ya que, al igual de la mayoria de las casas de la zona donde vive , está construida de madera contrachapada (triplay)
texts.en:
Ana María is a 42-year-old mother who lives with her husband and three children in a marginal urban area of Castilla district, a district that is part of Piura province, Piura region, located more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For over five years she has sold all kinds of condiments and chifles (a typical snack of the Piura region consisting of thin slices of fried banana cooked in wood-burning or carob wood charcoal stoves). Her business is in her home and it is one of the family’s main sources of income so she daily gives it her best in order to succeed. Ana María would like to expand her business buying more chifles because this product is in high demand in the area; thus her first request from Edpyme Alternativa for an 800 new sol loan to help her reach this objective. Ana María is a hard-working woman who struggles daily to support her family and provide them with a better quality of life. Her greatest wish is to finish building her house because, like most houses in her area, it’s merely built of plywood.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chifles (fried banana chips)

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia Isabel, tiene 48 años y tiene tres hijos de las cuales uno independiente y dos depende de ella. Ella prepara comida como por ejemplo desayuno y almuerzo. Ella acomodo una habitación de su casa para abrir el restaurante, el restaurante está ubicado en el pasaje Tincoc en la distrito de Santiago y la provincia del Cusco. 

Isabel requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc.   

Isabel se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Isabel is 48 years old and has three children, one of whom is independent while the other two are dependents. She prepares food for breakfast and lunch. Isabel remodeled a room in her house so that she could open a restaurant, which is located on Tincoc Avenue in the district of Santiago, Cusco Province.

Isabel needs a loan to buy more supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her loans on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 50 años,  vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Hace mas de 4 años se dedica a vender productos de belleza de las marcas más reconocidas del mercado. Es así que ofrece gran variedad de productos de buena calidad en perfumes, lápiz labial, rímel entre otros artículos, que son elegidos por catalogo. Además la variedad de muestras que posee son sus herramientas, ya que así sus clientes no dudan en escoger el producto que desean. Este negocio le ha salido rentable por lo que ha decidió incrementar y mejorar sus ventas vendiendo prendas de vestir. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por tanto asegura ser muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza y polos para damas.
texts.en:
Elena is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and son in a house they own. More than 4 years ago, she began selling beauty products from the best-known brands on the market. She offers a great variety of high-quality products, including perfumes, lipstick, mascara, and other items, which her customers choose from catalogs. She also has a variety of samples which she uses as sales tools, so that her customers feel confident in selecting the products they want. This business has been profitable for Elena, and so she has decided to expand it and improve her sales by also selling clothing. This is her second loan with MFP, and she assures us that she will be very responsible with her payments. She expresses her appreciation to the people who will make this loan possible, since it will be very useful to her in advancing her business. With the funds she is requesting, she will invest in buying beauty products and polo shirts for women.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beauty products and clothing to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her twin brother's children. Sarah owns a cosmetics shop selling all types of cosmetics. She buys these cosmetics from Kampala city shops. She incurs little transport costs to and from shopping.

She wants top use this loan to buy more boxes of creams and Vaseline. Besides this cosmetics shop, she also does some catering services like selling cooked food. She has been in this business for six years. She sells on a retail basis only. Her customers are local people. She works seven days a week. Her business challenges include the rainy season because she works in a muddy place.

Sarah joined MCDT because of its good credit discipline and there are no strings attached when one applies for a loan. She resides in and rents a two room house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics and vaseline.

loans.name: Bernalda

texts.es: Bernalda, de 53 años, es una mujer muy emprendedora, vive con su hermana y su familia en su casa que es propia.Se dedica a la venta de comida en su carro salchipapero (especial para frituras), y con él  sale a trabajar en una zona cercana a su casa. Las ventas son buenas, gracias a lo sabroso de sus platillos, que son la delicia de sus comensales, ella ofrece comida rápida como salchipapas (salchichas y papas fritas), alitas de pollo frito, entre otros. Ha ganado varios clientes, no solo por la exquisitez de sus platillos, si no también, por su gran carisma y sencillez. Por las mañanas también trabaja al lado de su hermana en la venta de condimentos, lo cual le da algunos ingresos extras a su economía, además le gusta mucho laborar durante todo el día. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando, pues desea instalar un local propio donde pueda  ofrecer sus platillos con mayor comodidad.Es el  segundo préstamo que tiene  con MFP, y promete que será muy puntual con todos los pagos de sus cuotas, porque desea seguir adelante. Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de  ingredientes que necesita para continuar con la preparación de sus ricos platillos.
texts.en:
Bernalda, 53, is a very enterprising woman who lives with her sister and her family in her own home. She sells food from a "salchipapera" cart (especially fried foods), and with it she goes out to work in an area close to her home. Her sales are good, thanks to her tasty dishes, which are the delight of her guests. She offers fast food such as salchipapas (sausages and fried potatoes), fried chicken wings, and others. She has attracted various customers, not only because of the exquisite dishes, but also because of her charm and unassuming nature. In the mornings she works alongside her sister selling condiments, which gives her additional income. She prefers to work all day. In the future she wants to continue to work; she wants to set up a place of her own where she can offer her dishes in greater comfort. This is her 2nd loan with MFP, and she promises to be very punctual with all of her payments, because she wants to get ahead. She is planning on investing the money requested in the bulk purchase of the ingredients she needs to continue making her delicious dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia L. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 49 years old. Lilia is married and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing specialty tailoring services to local community members. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & thread. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.es:
Este comité se conformo mediante el deseo D. las señoras D. formar parte D. un grupo solidario para tr abajar.
Una D. la integrantes D. este grupo es la señora Francisca quien se dedica a la venta D. comestibles, bebidas, golosinas y otros en un pequeño restauran que posee en su domicilio.
Ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar los comestibles ya que los clientes acuden desD. muy temprano hasta su local.
Por la mañana prepara desayunos con precios especiales asi tambien es el almuerzo y por su buen servicio ella cuenta con numerosa cleintela y por lo tanto con una buena ganancia.
Solicita el credito para invertir en su restauran el cual lo destinara para la compra D. mostradores D. vidrios con focos que podrá mantener los comestibles en buen estado, ademas D. algunas mercaderias que le hacen falta.
Todas las integrantes agradecen por la ayuda crediticia que facilitan las actividades que cada una realiza.
texts.en:
This committee was formed as a result of the women’s wish to be part of a communal group. One of the group members is Francisca who sells food, beverages, snacks, etc. in a small eatery in her home. She rises very early in the morning to prepare her meals because customers start coming by her locale quite early. In the mornings she prepares breakfasts at special prices, she does the same during lunch. Thanks to her good customer service, she has a sizable regular customer base and thus good profits. She is asking for funds to invest in her eatery; she plans to use the funds to buy glass display cases with warming lights installed to keep the food in good condition. She will also buy some merchandise she needs. All the group members are grateful for the loans provided because they make the work that each one does easier.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a glass display case with warmers, snacks, cigarettes, beverages.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: Janet  tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Hace mas de 3 años, Janet y su esposo ofrecen el servicio de consultoría, en el cual consiste en realizar proyectos, como instalaciones de servicio de agua potable y alcantarillado en las diversas comunidades de su localidad. Su esposo es ingeniero de profesión, por lo que es una carta aval que garantiza el profesionalismo con que hacen su trabajo y eso les da ventaja a sus potenciales clientes que acudan para pedir su servicio. Durante todo este tiempo de trabajo ha visto las grandes ventajas en sus ganancias que ha decidido  mejorar las instalaciones de su pequeña oficina que ha implementado en su casa. Este es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por tanto asegura será muy responsable con sus pagos, además confía que este aporte lo ayudará en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en el tramite de renovación de licencia de su consultoría.
texts.en:
Janet is thirty-eight and lives with her husband and two children in a rented house. For more than three years, Janet and her husband have had a consulting business, in which they do projects like installing potable water services and sewage systems in different communities in their town. Her husband is an engineer by profession, a reference that guarantees the professionalism with which they carry out their work, and provides an advantage to potential customers who turn to them for their services. The entire time Janet has been in business she has enjoyed big profits such that she has decided to make improvements to the small office in her home. This is her second loan with MFP, so she's sure to be responsible with her payments, and she's confident the support will help her progress her business. She plans to use the loan to pay for the renewal process for her consulting license.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the renewal process for her consulting business.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 36 años, vive con su hija Karin (9) en su casa que es propia.Desde muy joven, se ha dedicado a trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante a su hija quien es su razón de vivir, es por ello que incursionó en la venta de diversas bebidas como aguardientes, gaseosas, cervezas, además de cigarros. Actualmente comercializa  ropa que es lo más rentable, además tiene clientes fijos a los que le da las prendas a crédito. Desde hace 9 años se dedica a esta actividad y se esfuerza mucho en conseguir pedidos de sus vecinas, quienes son las que mayormente le realizan encargos, por la lejanía de las zonas por donde viven. Se siente muy contenta ya que gracias a su buen trabajo tiene muchos pedidos, sobretodo de casacas por el intenso frío de la temporada.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete que será  muy puntual con los pagos de  sus cuotas, pues desea seguir progresando.Karina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa de invierno  ya que tiene varios  pedidos pendientes.
texts.en:
Karina, age 36, lives in her own house with her nine year old daughter, Karin. Since she was very young Karina has worked very hard to get her daughter ahead. Her daughter is her reason for living. That is why she established a business selling various drinks like liquor, soft drinks, beer, and cigarettes. She currently sells clothes because it is the most profitable. She has fixed customers who she gives the clothes to on credit. She has been doing this activity for nine years, and she puts forth great effort to get orders from her neighbors. They are the ones who mainly order from her because of how far away the areas where they live are. She is very happy because she has lots of orders, thanks to her good work. Her orders are mostly for jackets because of the seasonal intense cold. She commits to being very punctual with her payments because she wishes to keep progressing. Karina plans to use the requested money to buy a larger quantity of winter clothes because she has various pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes for her business

loans.name: Kanungu Kwetungura Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Henry K. is 47 and the father of five. He is married and, to cater for his family’s needs, he operates a carpentry workshop.

This workshop has been in existence for the last twenty years and the reason why it has existed this long, Henry says, is on the grounds of his perseverance in the face of hardships. He cites financial hardships, intrigue and the high cost of timber as some of the problems that have plagued his business. Without his strong-hearted sense of resilience, he says, he would not have come this far.

Henry makes all kinds of furniture such as chairs and desks that he has been selling to the many mushrooming schools around Kihihi Town. He also has a small milk-selling business that helps him earn some side profits. In a week, he makes 200,000 shillings. With this loan, he wants to buy more timber that he will use to make more furniture to sell.

loans.use: To buy more timber to make more furniture to sell

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana G. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 52 years old. Luciana is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Luciana owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling cosmetics products in the local community. Luciana has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luciana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Luciana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Luciana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen tiene  21 años, vive con su  madre y sus dos hermanos en una casa arrendada. Hace mas de 10 meses se dedica a la venta de productos envasados, en donde se asoció con su madre y su hermana mayor. De esta manera su trabajo consiste en contratar jóvenes, quienes se encargarán de distribuir su producto en las diferentes bodegas de su ciudad. Entre los productos que vende son: condimentos envasados, sopa instantánea, fideos, entre otros. Ahora procura adquirir al por mayor su mercadería de proveedores, quienes le vende esto producto de marcas de calidad que satisfagan a su clientela. Desde entonces, el trabajo que ha desempeñado le ha  ayudado a crecer su negocio, por lo que esta pensando extender su mercado de ventas. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por tanto será muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para así tener mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Karen, age 21, lives with her mother and her two siblings in a rented house. She has been selling packaged goods for over ten months. She works with her mother and her older sister. Her work consists of hiring young people to distribute the product to different grocery stores in her city. Some of the products she sells are packaged condiments, instant soup, and noodles, among others. Now she gets her merchandise wholesale from suppliers. They sell the brand and quality of products that satisfy her customers. Since then the work she has done has helped her business grow. She is thinking of expanding her sales market. This is her second loan with MFP, and she will be very responsible with her payments. She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise. That way she will have a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Ablaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Ablaye G. vit dans la localité de Bambilor ou il exerce l’activité  de couture depuis plus  de 30 ans déjà. Il est âgé  de 41 ans et a sa charge une femme. Il est sociétaire  de la caisse de Bambilor depuis mars 2010. Il est surtout spécialisé  dans la confection de prêts à porter, taille basse et robes de femmes. C’est une activité qu’il a choisi par passion car depuis le bas âge il a commence à coudre. Grace à son activité  il parvient à se prendre en charge. Monsieur G. sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs destine a l’achat de tissus et accessoires dans le but de confectionner des prêts  a porter prévus  pour la vente. Ce crédit  pourra contribuer a l’accroissement de ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Ablaye G. lives in Bambilor where he has been in the tailoring business for more than 30 years. He is 41 years old and supports one wife. He has been a member of the Bambilor branch of the U-IMCEC since March 2010. He specializes in making ready-to-wear "taille basse" (a popular West African dress) and other women's dresses. He chose this business because he loves sewing, which he began at a young age. Thanks to his work, he manages to support himself. Mr. G. is seeking a loan of 100,000 francs, which will be used to buy material and accessories in order to make ready-to-wear clothing to sell. This loan could help increase his profits.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie P. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 39 years old. Elvie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvie owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seafood products to sell & working capital. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Elvie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Elba De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Elba es una mujer trabajadora de 53 años de edad, madre de un hijo, vive en el bario Esquipulas.
Desde joven se dedico a trabajar, en servicios domésticos, ya que no tenia la ayuda de su compañero ya que estando embarazada falleció lo que fue para ella un gran dolor pero con la esperanza de tener a su hijo. 

Comienza  a buscar trabajo para poder cubrir sus gastos y encuentra  en servicios domésticos  en una casa particular.  En donde hace todos los oficios del hogar lo que le resulta cansado,  también cuida a un niño.
Con su salario cubría los gastos y apoyaba a su hijo, lo que ahora se graduó en mercadeo y la ayuda con los gastos de la casa. Ella se siente contenta por tener un trabajo fijo. A Futuro  espera  ahorrar y vender algo para estar en su casa
Sus planes para su casa es lograr tener mejores condiciones. Con este préstamo comprara láminas para cielo raso el cual instalara para amortiguar el calor, mejor higiene, como una mejor presentación.
texts.en:
Elba is an enterprising woman of 53 years. She is the mother of a son, and she lives in the Esquipulas neighborhood. Since the time she was young, she has worked as a domestic. She didn't have the help of her partner, since he died when she was pregnant. For her this created great pain, but yet she had the hope of having his son. She began looking for work so she could cover the household expenses, and started working as a domestic in a private residence. There she did all of the household tasks, which was tiring for her as she also had to care for a son. With her salary she covered the expenses and supported her son. He is now a graduate in marketing, and he helps her with the household expenses. She feels content to have a regular job. In the future she hopes to save some money and to sell something so that she can remain in her home. She plans to make some improvements to her home. With this loan she will buy ceiling plates which she will install to absorb the heat, and to provide better hygiene and a better appearance.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ceiling plates which she will install to absorb the heat, and to provide better hygiene and a better appearance.

loans.name: Honey Fe

texts.en:
Honey Fe G. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 40 years old. Honey Fe is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Honey Fe owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling beauty products and other cosmetics in the local community. Honey Fe is just starting this business.

In 2010, Honey Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Honey Fe is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Honey Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Marizela

texts.es: Marizela de 32 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de  su esposo y sus tres hijos.Desde hace 9 años, se dedica a la venta de verduras en uno de los mercados de la zona por donde vive. Su trabajo comienza desde muy temprano, y se prolonga  hasta las 4 de la tarde y solo le sobra  el tiempo necesario  para almorzar. Las ventas son mayores alrededor de las 11 de la mañana, porque todas las amas de casa visitan su puesto para adquirir los vegetales necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas, para lo cual ella siempre trata de tener los productos mas frescos del mercado. En el futuro quiere seguir mejorando su puesto y desea implementarlo muy bien, además tiene planeado renovar las maderas de su puesto para hacerlo mas atractivo a su clientela.Es el  décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete que será muy puntual con los pagos de todas sus cuotas.Marizela tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de vegetales que necesita  para aumentar sus ventas, y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Marizela is 32 years old. She lives in her own house, together with her husband and three children. She sells vegetables in one of the markets in the area where she lives. She starts work early in the morning and finishes at 4 in the afternoon. The time she takes off during the day is just enough to have some lunch. Peak sales occur at about 11 in the morning, which is when all the housewives visit her stall to buy the food they need for preparing the mid-day meal. To satisfy demand, she always seeks to ensure she has the freshest produce. In the future, she would like to improve her stall. She also hopes to renovate the wooden structures of her stall, to make it look more attractive to customers. This is the tenth loan she has secured from MFP, and she promises she will make all her payments on time. Marizela is planning to spend the money on purchasing a large quantity of vegetables, so as to increase sales and secure greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase produce for her vegetable stall

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 50 años, vive con sus 2 hijos  en una casa arrendada. Hace mas de 4 años se dedica a vender productos envasados, como: condimentos, arroz,  sopa instantánea, entre otros. Por lo general recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, quienes se dedican en la distribución de éstos productos a los diversos puntos de venta de su ciudad. Paralelo a esta actividad, María también se dedica a decorar salones y espacios para eventos sociales como matrimonios y demás fiestas. Con el tiempo espera conseguir nuevos clientes y de esa manera continuar distribuyendo la mercadería que posee. Es la segunda oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, por tanto asegura que será muy responsable con sus pagos y por tanto agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo, puesto que sabe que le ayudará en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercadería para aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old and lives with her two children in a rented house. Since over 4 years ago, she works by selling packaged products like: condiments, rice, instant soup, and others. She usually receives help from her children. They work on distributing these products to the various points of sale of the city. In addition to this job, Maria also works by decorating rooms and spaces for social events like weddings and other parties. In time she hopes to get new clients and in this way continue to distribute the merchandise she owns. This is the second time that she has received a credit with MFP, thus it assures she will be very responsible with her payments. She thanks those people who will be managers of the loan, since she knows that they will help her in the progress of her business. With the credit she asks for, she will invest in buying merchandise to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Gerrit Larsen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products to increase her working capital.

loans.name: May Joy

texts.en:
May Joy F. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 31 years old, and is single. To make a living, May Joy owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. May Joy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, May Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. May Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. May Joy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by May Joy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. IMELDA BEATRIZ, (LA UBICAMOS EN LA FOTOGRAFÍA CON LA MANO EN ALTO) TIENE 41 AÑOS, TIENE 2 HIJOS MAYORES D. EDAD, QUIENES SON SU APOYO Y ALICIENTE. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "LAS MARGARITAS" INTEGRADO POR 11 PERSONAS TRABAJADORAS Y RESPONSABLES RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO. LA SRA. IMELDA BEATRIZ FUÉ ELEGIDA POR SUS COMPAÑERAS COMO TESORERA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
HACE CUATRO AÑOS INICIÓ SU NEGOCIO D. LA VENTA Y ALQUILER D. DISFRACES, EL CUAL SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN SU DOMICILIO, SE ANIMÓ A PONER SU NEGOCIO YA QUE TENÍA LA NECESIDAD D. APOYAR A SUS HIJOS EN SUS ESTUDIOS Y A LA VEZ ELLOS LA APOYAN EN EL NEGOCIO YA QUE ES SU ÚNICO INGRESO POR EL MOMENTO.
CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO IR AUMENTANDO POCO A POCO SU STOCK, SIENDO SU PROXIMA META AMPLIAR EL NEGOCIO, OFRECER MAS VARIEDAD D. DISFRACES TANTO PARA NIÑOS PEQUEÑOS, JOVENES Y ADULTOS.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. DISFRACES PARA SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Imelda Beatriz (who is raising her hand in the photo) is 41 years old and has 2 adult children who are both her helpers and her motivation. She is a member of “Las Margaritas” group, which is maD. up of 11 individuals who are hardworking and responsible residents of the district of Carabayllo. Four years ago Imelda Beatriz started her business selling and renting costumes. Her business is located in her home. She was inspired to set up her business because she needed to help her children with their studies, and they in turn are helping her with her business since it is her only source of income at the moment. Through her work Imelda Beatriz has managed to increase her stock little by little. Her next goal is to expand her business so she can offer more varieties of costumes for small children, young people, and adults. She will invest the loan she is requesting in purchasing costumes for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in the purchase of costumes for her business

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth B. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 35 years old. Lilibeth is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilibeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Lilibeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Zoila Yanina

texts.es:
ZoiL. D. 26 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo D. Guayaquil, elL. tiene una papelería (en Ecuador se le llama “bazar”),  venD. todo tipo D. papelería como cuadernos, hojas y otros artículos D. tienda. 

Empezó hace cinco años atrás con una vitrina y poca papelería, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido agrandar su negocio, trabaja con una hermana desD. las 09h00 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Para agrandar su tienda elL. quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos y ropa para vender otras cosas, en el futuro quiere tener sucursales en todo el Guasmo D. Guayaquil.
texts.en:
ZoiL., 26, lives in an urban area of El Guasmo, Guayaquil. She has a stationery shop (in Ecuador it’s called a “bazaar”) where she sells all types of paper goods like: notebooks, sheets of paper and other merchandise. She started five years ago with a single display case and few inventory items. Gradually, with effort and dedication she has managed to enlarge her business. One of her sisters helps her and she’s open from 9am until 10pm every day. In order to enlarge her store she wants to use the funds to buy notebooks and clothes in order to have a more varied stock inventory available to sell. In the future, she wants to have branch stores throughout El Guasmo.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For notebooks and clothes.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz María tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo, vive junto a su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Zaña, un distrito conocido a nivel regional por sus danzas y tradiciones de raices afroperuanas, se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la ganadería. Esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposo. Ellos crían vacas para extraer la leche que producen y venderla diariamente a los vecinos de la zona. Los animales son criados al aire libre, en unos terrenos de cultivo cercanos a su vivienda. 

Con los ingresos que percibian de esta actividad han venido instalando una pequeña bodega en su vivienda, el negocio está creciendo y cada vez su clientela aumenta más, por ello Luz ha decidido ampliar su bodega comprando mas productos para ofrecérselos a sus clientes. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Luz es una mujer entregada a su familia y a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su menor hijo una buena educación. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos la consideran una persona tranquila y de confianza.
texts.en:
Luz María, 30, is married and has a son; she and her family live in a rural area of Zaña district, known throughout the region for its dances and traditions rooted in Afro-Peruvian culture. It is located forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has raised cattle with her husband for the last 6 years. They raise cows for milk that is sold daily to their neighbors in the area. They raise the animals out in the open in fields near their house. With profits from this activity they have been equipping a small store in their home; this business has been gradually growing and every day they have more customers. Because of this, Luz has decided to expand it buying more stock items to have on hand for her customers. To reach this objective, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first-ever loan in the amount of 500 new soles. Luz is a woman who is dedicated to her family and to her work. Her greatest wish is to provide her son with a good education. Her neighbors consider her to be a level-headed, trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es: Obdulia tiene  40 años , vive con su  esposos y 4 hijos en casa de su suegra. Hace mas de 3 años se dedica en la venta de dulces y golosinas en la puerta de una escuela primaria cercana a su casa, atendiendo en el tiempo de recreo y de salida. Desde entonces distribuye su tiempo, sin descuidar con las labores domesticas y la atención de su negocio en donde se utiliza una pequeña carreta, para que pueda trasladar sus dulces y otros productos, de su casa a la escuela. Durante este tiempo de trabajo ha visto las ventajas de su negocio, como las ganancias que obtiene, es por ello que desea incrementar la cantidad de productos que vende. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con MFP, por lo tanto será muy responsable con sus pagos, es por ello  que agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo, puesto que le ayudará en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería en dulces y golosinas.
texts.en:
Obdulia, age 40, lives with her husband and four children in her mother-in-law’s house. For more than three years she has been engaged in the sale of sweets and candy at the gate of a primary school near her house, tending to the business during recreation periods and at the end of the school day. She divides her time, without fail, between domestic duties and attending to her business, in which she uses a small cart to transport her sweets and other products from her house to the school.

During the time she has worked, she has seen the benefits of her business, such as the earnings she has obtained. This is why she wants to increase the number of products that she sells.

This is the first time she has applied for a loan with MFP. As a result, she will be very responsible about making her payments. It is also why she is grateful to those persons who will be funding the loan since they will help the business progress. With the loan she is applying for she will buy merchandise in the form of sweets and candy.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sweets and candy.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: Demetria, de 43  años, vive en su casa propia junto a  su esposo y su hija Margot (7).Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar arduamente por el bienestar de su familia incursionando en variedad de oficios. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de condimentos, y este negocio le genera ingresos económicos necesarios para brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su familia. Ella ofrece estos condimentos en un mercado cercano a la zona por donde vive, prepara diferentes salsas y especias como ocopa, ajíes licuados, ajos molidos, entre otros, y tiene la preferencia de  las amas de casa que frecuentemente adquieren estas salsas  para la preparación rápida de sus comidas . Además paralelamente se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos de belleza que vende por catalogo a sus amigas y conocidas. En el futuro quiere instalar  un negocio más estable para lograr  administrarlo desde su casa, pero se siente tranquila en sus trabajos porque quiere salir delante de a pocos.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y promete que será muy puntual con los pagos de sus cuotas.Demetria tiene planeado invertir  el dinero del crédito en la compra  de mayor cantidad de ingredientes que necesita  para la preparación de sus condimentos y también invertirá una parte en la compra de algunos productos de belleza que se encuentren en promoción.
texts.en:
Demetria, 43, lives in her own home with her husband and her daughter Margot, 7. Since she was very young, she has worked hard for the well-being of her family and has had a variety of jobs. Currently she sells condiments. This business generates the necessary economic income for her to provide a high quality of life to her family. She offers these condiments in a market that is near the area where she lives. She prepares various sauces and spices like ocopa (a spicy sauce made of peanuts, chili peppers, and herbs), chili sauces, ground garlic, and others. The housewives in the area prefer her and frequently acquire their sauces from her to prepare their food quickly. She also sells various beauty products by catalog to her friends and people she knows. In the future, she wants to establish a more stable business and to administer it from her home. She feels at peace with her jobs because she wants to get ahead little by little. This is her second loan that she has had with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she promises to be very punctual with her repayments. She plans to invest the money from her credit in the purchase of a larger quantity of ingredients that she needs to make her condiments. She will also invest part of it in the purchase of beauty products that are on sale right now.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies that she needs for her business

loans.name: Raquel Armanda

texts.es:
RAQUEL P., TIENE 46 AÑOS ES SEPARADA VIVE CON SUS DOS HIJOS TODAVIA SOLTEROS Y ESTUDIANTES. VIVE EN CASA PROPIA.
ELLA TIENE UNA AMPLIA EXPERIENCIA DE SU NEGOCIO COMO COMERCIANTE DE TODO TIPO DE VERDURAS, SU NEGOCIO ESTA UBICADO EN EL MERCADO MUNICIPAL DE SANTIAGO SACATEPEQUEZ, DESDE HACE 15 AÑOS. RAQUEL ATIENDE SU PUESTO Y CON SU  CALIDO TRATO A SUS CLIENTES LOGRA QUE LOS MISMOS LA VISITEN DE NUEVO TAMBIEN POR SU AMPLIO SURTIDO DE VERDURAS FRESCAS. ES POR ESO QUE HA TENIDO ÉXITO Y HA LOGRADO AGRANDAR SU PUESTO. GRACIAS AL CREDITO ANTERIOR LOGRO MONTAR OTRO NEGOCIO DE PRODUCTOS MEDICINALES NATURAL  Y DESEA OTRO CREDITO PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO CON OTROS PRODUCTOS QUE SUS CLIENTES LE PIDEN, ELLA HA TRABAJADO DURO POR SALIR ADELANTE  Y TIENE VARIAS METAS COMO POR EJEMPLO  SEGUIR AYUDANDO A SUS HIJOS CON SUS  ESTUDIOS
texts.en:
Raquel P., 46, is separated and lives with her two, still-single, student sons in her own home. She has ample experience as a vegetable merchant. Her stand has been located in Santiago Sacatepequez’s municipal market for 15 years. Raquel tends to it herself and, thanks to her warm customer service and wide selection of fresh vegetables, she insures that her customers return regularly. Thanks to the previous loan she was able to set up an additional business consisting of natural products sales. She is asking for a new loan to stock other products her customers are asking for. She works hard to get ahead and has several goals one of which is to help her sons with their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To better stock her business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma C. is from the village of Extension, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 44 years old. Gemma is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:

To make a living, Carolina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Carolina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Carolina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carolina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Carolina is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Carolina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

loans.use: To purchase: Cheese, Cream, Curd and Eggs.

Marisa is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the thirrd loan taken out by Marisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina tiene 57 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas de 9 años se dedica en la elaboración de panes y pasteles en su misma casa, donde ha implementado su taller de panadería, siendo su familia quien participa activamente en este negocio, en donde participan repartiendo los panes en las diversas bodegas y pastelerías  de su ciudad. Este trabajo le es rentable para su familia, porque las ganancias que obtienen la ayudan a cubrir las diversas necesidades que tienen, además le han ayudad a concretar en mejorar su  taller, implementando maquinas para que puedan elaborar pan. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, es por ello que será muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará los insumos, como: harina, manteca y levadura para la elaboración de más panes y pasteles.
texts.en:
Sabina, age 57, lives with her husband and their four children in her own house. She has been making breads and cakes in her own house for nine years. She has set up a bakery workshop, and her family actively participates in this business. They deliver the breads to various grocery stores and bakeries in her city. This work is profitable for her family. The income that they get helps cover the diverse necessities that they have. Also, it has helped her to improve her shop by installing machines so that they can make bread. This is her first loan with MFP. Therefore, she will be very responsible with her payments. She will use the requested loan to buy supplies like flour, shortening, and leavening to make more breads and cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and ingredients to make more breads and cakes

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 46 años, vive al lado de su pareja y su última hija, pues sus otros hijos son mayores y viven independientes.Se dedica al alquiler de lavadoras en su casa, a tiempo completo,  pues es su principal fuente de ingresos. Además instaló un criadero de cuyes de raza, y obtiene buenas  ganancias, pues le pagan regular por cada cuy vendido. María se siente muy satisfecha con su trabajo ya que la permite sentirse  independiente y contenta  de poder brindarle todo lo que desea a su pequeña hija. Ella siempre esta pensando en el futuro, es por esta razón que quiere modernizar sus cinco lavadoras, las que  por su alquiler y constante uso se han desgastado, y dice que le esta resultando mucho más caro mandarlas a reparar. Por eso tiene planeado vender las lavadoras usadas y adquirir nuevas lavadoras.Es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con  MFP, y promete que será muy puntual con los pagos de todas sus cuotas.María tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra de  una  moderna  lavadora que le facilitaría su trabajo de alquiler de estos artefactos.
texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old and lives with her husband and their youngest daughter. Their other children are grown up and live on their own. Maria has a laundry service which she runs out of her house full time. It is her primary source of income. She also set up an area to raise guinea pigs, which are also profitable to sell and provide regular income. Maria is satisfied with her work because it makes her feel independent and content that she can provide everything her daughter wants. Maria is always thinking about the future. She'd like to upgrade her 5 old washing machines, which through constant rental and use, would be more expensive to repair than to replace. She is planning to sell the old machines and purchase new ones. This is the 4th loan with MFP, and she's committed to make all of her payments on time. She will use the money to purchase more modern machines for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new washing machines for her laundry business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy S. is from the village of Thailand, Basilan, South Cotabato. She is 47 years old. Lucy is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Lucy runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Lucy has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Lucy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lucy is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Lucy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Marieme

texts.fr: Madame Marieme F. est une femme de 42 ans qui habite à Bambilor. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse depuis juillet 2009. Elle a déjà  bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur. Elle est mariée et s’active dans l’élevage de poussins depuis  plus d’un an. Avec le soutien de son mari qui travaille dans une ferme avicole  elle a eu l’idée  d’investir dans le secteur de l’aviculture. La réalisation de bénéfices  lui permet de  satisfaire  ses quelques besoins personnels tels que l’achat de vêtements, de  bijoux, etc. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs destine a l’achat d’une bande de 150 poussins pour renforcer son activité. Si ses gains le lui permettent madame F. pourrait même aller jusqu'à soutenir son mari a prendre en charge ses factures d’électricité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marieme F. is a 42-year old woman living in Bambilor. She has been a member of the mutual fund since July 2009. She already obtained a loan in the past. She is married, and her line of business is raising poultry, something that she has been doing for over a year. With the support of her husband, who works on a poultry farm, she decided to go into aviculture. The resulting income allows her to meet some personal expenses such as purchasing clothing, jewelry and so on. She is seeking a loan of 150,000 in order to purchase a flock of 150 chickens in order to bolster her enterprise. If her income allows it, Mrs. F. would like to help her husband with the electricity bills.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es: Cynthia  tiene 23 años, vive con  su pareja en la casa de sus  padres. Hace mas de 2 años se dedica a vender carteras y accesorios como: cartucheras, bufandas para damas, de los cuales son ofrecidas a sus amigas de la universidad. Desde entonces sus ventas lo realiza de manera diaria, de esa manera recibe las ganancias rápidamente. La mercadería lo obtiene en la ciudad capital, ya que lo adquiere a menor precio y eso le da más ventaja en las ventas. Hasta el momento su negocio le ha resultado rentable por lo que esta planeando incrementar más su capital de trabajo. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por tanto será responsable con sus pagos, asimismo agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo, puesto que le ayudará a mejorar su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más mercadería.
texts.en:
Cynthia is 23 years old and lives with her husband in her parents house. More than 2 years ago, Cynthia began to sell handbags and women's accessories to her friends at university. Since then, she has been running her business every day, growing her sales rapidly. She purchases the merchandise in the capital, where she can pay a lower price and generate more profit. So far, her business has been viable, which is why she would now like to have more capital to invest. This is the first time she is requesting a loan with MFP. She will be responsible with her payments, and she is also grateful to the people who make these loans, because they enable her to grow her business. With the loan, Cynthia will invest in more merchandise to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise, handbags and women's accessories, for her growing business.

loans.name: Jennifer Janina

texts.es:
Jennifer de 24 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, ella hace cinco años atrás se enfermo por la carga de trabajo que tenía en la tienda, casi da el brazo a torcer pero su mama la motivo para que continúe trabajando el su tienda. 

Poco a poco fue pasando el tiempo y ella se recupero y continuo con su tienda, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ella ha tenido mejores ingresos y la ha surtido más con productos. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Pero para surtirla aun más ella quiere comprar con el préstamo confites, bebidas y víveres. Pero en el futuro ella quiere tener un minimarket para asegurar su futro y el de su mama.
texts.en:
Jennifer, 24, lives in an urban zone in El Guasmo, Guayaquil. Five years ago she became ill due to the hard work she had in the store, she almost dislocated her arm but her mother encouraged her to continue working in her store. Gradually, as time went by she recovered and continued with her store. From then until now she has had improved income and has been able to stock it with more items. She works from 8am until 10pm every day. However, in order to stock it even better still with sweets, beverages and groceries, she is asking for funds. In the future, she’d like to have a minimarket to insure her and her mother’s futures.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For sweets, beverages, groceries.

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. ISIDORA, (LA UBICAMOS EN LA FOTOGRAFÍA SENTADA AL LADO DERECHO)TIENE 48 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES CASADA, TIENE 2 HIJOS UNO MENOR Y OTRO MAYOR DE EDAD. HACE TRES AÑOS Y MEDIO FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "SARITA COLONIA" FORMADO POR 11 INTEGRANTES QUE VIVEN LA ZONA DE SAN FELIPE EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS. HA SIDO ELEGIDA POR SUS COMPAÑERAS COMO PRESIDENTA DE LA JUNTA  DIRECTIVA DE SU GRUPO.

LA SRA. ISIDORA, SE DEDICA A LA ATENCIÓN DE SU BODEGA QUE FUNCIONA EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO, Y QUE INICIÓ CON UN PRÉSTAMO PEQUEÑO QUE SE HIZO, Y POCO A POCO EL INGRESO DE SUS VENTAS VOLVÍA A INVERTIRLO. CON SU NEGOCIO HA PODIDO APOYAR A SUS HIJOS EN EL PAGO DE SUS ESTUDIOS, HA HECHO CRECER SU NEGOCIO Y APOYA A SU ESPOSO EN LOS GASTOS DE LA CONSTRUCCIÓN DE SU CASITA.

AHORA SE SIGUE ESFORZANDO Y TRABAJANDO DURO PARA PODER APOYAR A SU ÚLTIMA HIJA QUIEN EMPEZARÁ MUY PRONTO SUS ESTUDIOS SUPERIORES.

EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS PARA SURTIR SU BODEGA.
texts.en:
Isidora, who you will see in the photo seated on the right side, is 48 years old and married with 2 children. 3 1/2 years ago she became a part of the group called Sarita Colonia, made up of 11 members who live in the zone of San Felipe in the district of Comas. Isidora was elected by her colleagues to be the president of the group. Isidora runs a small general store from her home. She began the business with a small loan, and little by little she reinvested the income from her sales. Her business has enabled her to help pay for her children's education. She has grown her business and also helped her husband with the costs of constructing their small house. Now she continues with all her efforts and hard work so that she'll be able to help her youngest daughter who will soon start her secondary studies. Isidora's portion of the loan will be used to purchase more inventory for her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan is shared amongst all the members of the communal bank.  Isidora will use her portion to purchase inventory for her small general store.

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es: La Sra. E. Saravia Maria Ysabel, vive en el caserio de sacta perteneciente al distrito de Santiago. Tiene a cargo a su nieto. Trabaja como obrera de campo en agrícola la venta desde hace 6 meses. Cuenta con casa propia a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para realizar acabados a su vivienda. Su sueño es poder darle mejor calidad de vida a su nieto. La Sra. E. agardece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a tráves de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
E. Saravia Maria Ysable lives in the district of Santiago and is responsible for her grandson. For the last 6 months, Maria has been doing agricultural work. She has her own home, but it is in need of some basic repairs. She is requesting a loan so that she can make these necessary repairs. Her dream is to be able to provide a better quality of life for her grandson. Maria appreciates the support that we can offer her through this micro loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make necessary repairs on the home she shares with her grandson.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for her store

loans.name: Jose Baldemar

texts.es:
José de 56 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, con el fin de pasar mas tiempo con su esposa y dos hijas el decidió tener su negocio de comidas rápidas, poco a poco con la ayuda de su esposa ha podido tener su propio comedor. 

Trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm, su esposa le ayuda a cocinar mientras que el reparte la comida. Venden hotdog, hamburguesas, papas con pollos y yogur. Su casa la utilizan para hacer la comida y afuera la venden. Pero para tener mas ingresos ellos quieren comprar con el préstamo una cocina, mesas y sillas . 

En el futuro el quiere tener un restaurante y poder así ayudar con el empleo a los chicos del sector de por su casa que no encuentran trabajo.
texts.en:
José, 56, lives in Las Orquídeas, Guayaquil. In order to spend more time with his wife and two daughters he decided to open a fast-food business. With his wife’s help, he gradually succeeded in having his own eatery. He works daily from 6am until 10pm. His wife helps with the cooking while he is in charge of making the deliveries. They sell hot-dogs, hamburgers, potatoes with chicken and yoghurt. They prepare the food inside their home and sell it outside. However, in order to increase income, they want to use the loan to buy a stove, tables and chairs. In the future, he wants to have a restaurant so that he can employ youngsters from the neighborhood who can’t find employment.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For a stove, table and chairs.

loans.name: Joffre Alberto

texts.es:
Joffre de 29 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento aun no terminada de construir,  solo cuenta con alcantarillado y luz como servicios basicos, el es guardia de seguridad y tiene una niña de tres años.
