Joffre  se caso muy joven y tuvo que trabajar y ya no seguir estudiando para darles una mejor viva a su familia, pero como los ingresos de el no superan el presupuesto que tiene para construir su casa el quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques y hierros para que su esposa e hija puedan vivir en mejores condiciones. 

El quiere un buen futuro para su familia, y tiene pensado en un futuro independizarse y tener su propio negocio para asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Joffre, 29, lives in Las Orquídeas, Guayaquil, in a concrete house that is still unfinished; the only utilities it has are electricity and sewage. He works as a security guard and has a three-year-old daughter. Joffre married very young and had to go to work and drop out of school in order to provide for his family. However, because his income is insufficient to cover home construction costs, he needs a loan to buy cement, concrete blocks and iron so that his wife and daughter can live in better conditions. He wants a good future for his family and is considering becoming independent and having his own business in order to insure his family’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Del Barrio San Pedro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio San Pedro  que se encuentra trabajando esta integrada por la señora Norma quien se dedica a la venta de ropas.
Ella viaja hasta la Argentina para comprar sus mercaderias ya que el costo en el vecino pais es mucho mas bajo que el mercado local.
Una vez que ella cuenta con las mercaderias suficiente recorre  varios lugares para ofrecer sus productos a emplados de empresas privadas y publicacas quienes compran las ropas y lo pagan a crédito.
Ella comenta que su actividad deja buena ganancia para ayudar con  los gastos de alimentación y vestimenta de toda su familia y en el futura ella desea comprar un vehiculo que facilitara sus traslado hasta sus clientes.
Solicita el prestamo para un nuevo viaje donde quiere comprar gran cantidad de ropas para temporada de invienrno que esta llegando en Paraguay como sueter, camperas, pantalones y otros.
texts.en:
This group from the San Pedro neighborhood is in operation and is made up by Norma, who is a clothing merchant. She travels to Argentina to buy her merchandise because prices in the neighboring country are much lower than in the local marketplace. Once she has sufficient merchandise she travels to several locations to offer it to employees of private and public firms who buy the clothes on credit. She comments that her activities produce good profits that help provide the basics for her family. In the future, she hopes to buy a vehicle that will make her travels to visit customers easier. She is asking for a loan for a new trip to buy large quantities of clothing appropriate for the winter season, like sweaters, jackets, pants, etc., that is about to start in Paraguay.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fall-winter clothing.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
Celso es un hombre que desde joven se dedico al trabajo con sus padres, actualmente está casado y trabaja como proveedor de frutas y verduras en la zona, cuenta también con su local de venta donde atiende su Señora.
El opto por el crédito con la Fundación para adquirir más gas como cebollas, lechugas, naranjas, manzanas,  mandarinas, con el fin de ir aumentando el margen de su negocio.
El cliente manifiesta su satisfacción por trabajar con la Fundación por el apoyo al desarrollo y crecimiento para su actividad.
texts.en:
Since he was a young man, Celso has worked with his parents. Today, he is married and works as a regional fruit and vegetable producer. He also relies on his store for income, which his wife manages. He seeks a loan through the Fundación so that he may acquire a greater variety of produce, such as onions, lettuce, oranges, apples, and mandarins, which would increase the profit margin of his business. Señor Celso expresses his satisfaction at working with the Fundación, and for the support they have provided in helping him to develop and grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de frutas y verduras (manzanas, naranjas, mandarinas, cebollas, lechugas, tomates, pimientos )

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolás de 53 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. El tiene cuatro hijos y tiene una lubricadora. 

Hace algún tiempo uno de los hijos de Nicolás gano dinero y se lo dio al papa para que pusiera su propio negocio, el decidió tener su propia lubricadora, por esa buena decisión ahora sus hijos trabajan con el desde las 09h00 hasta las 22h00 todos los días. 

Para surtir mas su negocio el quiere comprar grasas, repuestos para su lubricadora de carros. En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de su negocio.
texts.en:
Nicolás, 53 years of age, lives in the urban zone The Orchids (so called because, at one time, there were many orchids in the area) of Guayaquil. He has four children, and has a store where he sells car lubricants. Some time ago, one of Nicolás’ sons earned a sum of money that he gave to his father to start his own business. He decided to start a lubricants business. Due to this smart decision, his sons now work with him from 9 am until 11 pm every day. He would like to buy more lubricants in order to supply his enterprise, and mechanical replacement parts. In the future, he would like to open multiple branches of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lubricants, replacement parts.

loans.name: Unidas De San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes que conforman el  comité  Unidas de San Antonio se dedican al comercio  y para ello producen dentro de su propio hogar, verduras (huertas), gallinas, chanchos, carritos donde salen a vender sus productos como ser, arroz, maíz, mandioca, huevo, leche, miel, frutas de estación, etc. 
También la mayoría de ellas han podido construir una casilla frente a su casa donde exhiben sus productos sobre la ruta.
Todas ellas son vecinas del barrio donde comparten en las reuniones las posibles actividades que desean realizar durante el año.
Una de la integrantes es la señora Ana V. quien se dedica a la venta de varios productos que ella misma produce en su casa con la ayuda de su marido quien se dedica la agricultura.
Ella tiene varios panales de abeja en su casa de donde se provee de miel para la venta, ademas posee cria de aves para la produccion de huevos, posee una huerta donde tiene todo tipo de hortalizas, y tambien tiene vacas lecheras para la producción de leche.
Todos los rubros que ella tiene lo vende en el centro de la ciudad donde traslada todos los productos que tiene en su casa.
En la ocasion solicita el prestamo para la compra de materiales de construccion para mejorar los establecimientos de sus animales, ademas desea invertir en la sanitacion de los mismos y en la compra de balanceados.
texts.en:
The members of the Unidas de San Antonio committee are merchants. They home produce the merchandise they sell: vegetables (orchards), chickens, pigs, carts that they go out to sell their products in like rice, corn, manioc, eggs, milk, honey, seasonal fruit, etc. Most of them have also managed to build a small stand in front of their homes where they display their products on the roadside. All of them live in the same neighborhood where they also meet to discuss possible activities they can perform during the year. One of the group members is Ana V. who sells a variety of products she herself makes at home with help from her husband who is a farmer. She has several bee hives at home that produce honey for sale. She also raises chickens for egg production and has an orchard where she grows all kinds of vegetables; in addition she has dairy cows for milk production. All of her products are sold downtown where she transports them from home to sell. In this occasion she is asking for funds to buy building materials and supplies to make improvements on her animal pens; she also wants to invest in sanitation for them as well as in the purchase of nutritionally balanced animal feed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies and nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos, tiene 38 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, es casado y vive con sus dos hijos y su señora, se dedica a la elaboración de pan. 
Hace cinco años se dedica a la venta de pan dulce, el cual lo comercializa de forma ambulante en una bicicleta de carga, sus clientes  son vecinos y amigos, personas que encuentra durante sus recorridos, con este negocio el solventa las necesidades básicas de su familia,
Juan actualmente compra el pan ya elaborado por terceras personas, pero el necesita un préstamo para compra de un horno industrial para que el pueda elaborar sus propios productos ( pan dulce) y comercializarlo, es espera que con esto pueda obtener más ganancias y mejora la calidad de vida de su familia.
Sus aspiraciones son tener su negocio establecido en su casa de habitación, hacer pan de buena calidad para sus clientes, para obtener ingresos  para ayudar a su familia y mantener su trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, age 38, lives in San Miguel. He is married, and he lives with his wife and their two children. He devotes himself to making bread. For five years he has been selling sweet breads. He sells as a street vendor with a bicycle, which carries the bread. His customers are neighbors, friends, and the people he meets on his trips. With this business he pays for his family’s basic necessities. Juan currently buys the bread already made by third parties. But, he needs a loan to buy an industrial oven in order to be able to make his own products (sweet bread) and sell them. He hopes that with this he will be able to get greater earnings and improve his family’s quality of life. His aspirations are to have an established business in his house, and to make good quality bread for his customers. He will do this in order to get income to help his family and to maintain his job.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an industrial oven to make bread

loans.name: Belgica Petra

texts.es:
Bélgica de 62 años, ella vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil un lugar urbano donde esta la mayor parte de la gente de bajo recursos económicos, tiene dos hijos. Ella tiene una tienda de víveres. 

Antes de tener la tienda ella tuvo que sacrificar muchas cosas, una de ellas fue vender ropa artesanal a sus conocidos, poco a poco y con la ayuda de su esposo compro víveres para venderlos desde la ventana de su casa porque no tenia un local. Por ahora ya tiene un local y trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm. 

Para incrementar su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar y aceites. En el futuro quiere darles a sus hijos la tienda para que ellos la administren.
texts.en:
Bélgica is 62 years old. She lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil, a urban area where the majority of the people have limited economic resources. She has two children and she has a grocery store.

Before her store, she had to sacrifice lots of things. She sold handmade clothing to acquaintances. Little by little and with the help of her husband, she bought groceries to sell from her house’s window because she did not have an actual business location. Now she has a business location and she works from 6:00am to 9:00pm.

In order to increase her business she wants to buy rice, sugar and oil with her loan. In the future, she wants to give her children the store so they can manage it.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Bertha Maria

texts.es:
Bertha de 45 años, ella vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil un lugar urbano donde esta la mayor parte de la gente de bajo recursos económicos. Es madre soltera con una niña de 17 años. Ella tiene una tienda vende carnes, granos y bebidas. 

Pero antes de tener su tienda ella tuvo que trabaja muy duro como comerciante informal, poco a poco con dedicación ella pudo comprar algunos víveres y venderlos a sus vecinos. Ahora ella trabaja con ayuda de una sobrina desde las 08h00 hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. 

Para tener mas surtida su tienda y asegurar el futuro de su hija ella quiere comprar arroz, aceites y bebidas con el préstamo. En el futuro quiere tener un local de ropa y pasticos.
texts.en:
Bertha, 45, lives in the Guasmo neighborhood of Guayaquil, an urban area where the majority of the population is low-income. She is the single mother of a 17 year-old daughter. She has a store where she sells meat, grains and drinks. Before having her store she had to work very hard as a street vendor. But gradually, with her dedication, she was able to buy some food items and sell them to her neighbors. Now she works, with the help of a niece, from 8am until 11pm every day. In order to restock her store and assure the future of her daughter, she wants to buy rice, cooking oil and drinks with this loan. In the future she wants to have a place where she can sell clothing and plastic items.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase polar fleece to make clothes

loans.name: Consuela

texts.es: Consuela es una amable y carismática mujer de 62 años, comparte su vida con su esposo Ivan de 65 años, juntos viven en su casa propia. Ambos, desde muy jóvenes se han dedicado a la venta de artesanías, actividad que heredaron sus dos hijos, quienes ahora pusieron su propio taller y se dedican a la misma labor. La elaboración de estatuillas de santos y adornos es lo que más frecuentemente realizan, puesto le es rentable. Ivan, su esposo trabaja al lado de sus hijos, que se dedican a elaborar santos (estatuillas) de tamaños muy grandes para el misterio en navidad o en iglesias, capillas. Por otra parte, Consuela se dedica a su propio negocio de venta de estatuillas del niño Jesús en tamaños pequeños, que los vende por pedidos, pues es menos trabajoso realizarlos por su tamaño, pero ello no significa que sea menos difícil, pues debe ser muy minuciosa, procurando colocar la mezcla en los moldes y cerrarlos con gran precisión para que ambas mitades se unan en armonía y así salga bien modelada la imagen, en el que luego pasa a tallarlos y darle el acabado necesario. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que será muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que necesita, quiere comprar materiales necesarios para acabar con los pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Consuela is a very friendly and charismatic woman of 62. She shares her life with her husband, Ivan, 65, and they live together in their own home. Since they were both very young the couple has worked selling artesanal goods, an activity that their 2 children have inherited, having now established their own stall and working at the same activity. The most frequent work Consuela and Ivan do is making very large statues of saints for Christmas and for churches and chapels. Apart from this, Consuela also has her own business selling small statues of the baby Jesus, which she sells by order. This is less work because of the statues' size, but this doesn't mean it's less difficult as the statues are very detailed - putting in place the mix into the moulds and closing them with great precision so that both sides are in harmony and the image is modelled well. Later the moulds are sculpted and given the finishing touches necessary. This is the couple's third loan with MFP, and as usual they will be very punctual with the repayments. With this loan they will purchase the materials necessary to finish the orders that they have waiting.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material to make statues to fill an order

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
Regina, tiene 54 años, es casada, tiene cinco hijos y es natural de Huambutio. Ella tiene un negocio familiar de brindar servicios de internet al público en general, la cabina de internet está ubicada en la avenida de la Cultura de la ciudad del Cusco donde contrató a una persona para que atienda el negocio. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias el esfuerzo que realiza en su trabajo.

Regina requiere el préstamo para comprar una computadora y también para el mantenimiento de las computadoras que actualmente tiene. La socia pertenece al banco comunal Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son 10 años que participa en el banco comunal y es una de las socias fundadoras.   

Regina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Regina is 54 years old and is married with 5 children. She's from the Huambutio area. Regina has a family business providing internet services to the public. Her internet cabin is located in the Cultura avenue in Cusco city, where she has contracted a person to attend to the business. Regina has had the business for 2 years and it's going very well thanks to the efforts she has made in her work. Regina requires a loan to purchase a computer and for maintenance on the computers she already has. The member belongs to the communal bank Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio de la Asociación Arariwa. She has been part of the bank for 10 years and is one of the founding members. Regina is thankful for the opportunity given to her and promises to meet the repayments within their corresponding time period.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchas a computer and computer maintenance

loans.name: Las Cariñositas Group

texts.es:
Las Cariñositas es un grupo conformado por once integrantes los cuales se ubican en Sta. C. Valle de Chalco, Estado de México. Los integrantes son: Micaela R. M. (Venta de batas), Judith L. Martínez (Elaboración de galletas), Verónica R. F. (Lencería y zapatos por catalogo), Pedro A. M. (Venta de Frutas y Legumbres), Concepción A. C. (Taller Mecánico), Rocío A. V. (Arreglos Florales), Delfina A. García (Venta de Lencería), Aurora López C. (Venta de Cosméticos y Fragancias), Brenda Tania A. Martínez (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo), Janeth Araceli Hernández López (Venta de Ropa) y Cristina R. Méndez (Venta de Antojitos).

Pedro A. M. es el único hombre del grupo, por eso decidieron ponerle el cariñosito, tiene 47 años, con una familia conformada por tres hijos (solo uno de ellos  estudia la primaria  ) y su esposa Elvia, Hace 23 años el trabajaba en un taxi pero cuando vio que las necesidades de que su familia iban creciendo decidió emprender un nuevo negocio así que comenzó con la venta de frutas y legumbres, el vende todos los días en los diferentes tianguis que se hacen por su comunidad, Pedro sale a surtirse de frutas y verduras desde las tres de la mañana para poder encontrar buenos precios y productos de buena calidad ya que de esa forma se hace de clientes, los días de mayor venta para el son los domingos y cuando hay cosas que casi no se venden se las regala a la gente que lo necesita para que no se eche a perder, sus planes de Pedro son poner otro puesto de frutas y legumbres para darle un buen futuro a su hijo.
 
Con este crédito que le ha sido brindado, decidió invertirlo en lonas, mantas, frutas y legumbres y con las ganancias obtenidas quiere darle mantenimiento a su camioneta ya que es su medio de transporte para su mercancía.

Las Cariñositas se sienten muy afortunadas de que los prestatarios de Kiva estén dispuestos a brindar su ayuda para que puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Las Cariñositas" (The Caring Ones) group is made up of 11 members who are from the Santa C. neighborhood of Valle de Chalco in the state of México. The members are: Micaela R. M. (who sells robes/housecoats), Judith L. Martínez (who makes cookies), Verónica R. F. (who sells lingerie and shoes by catalog), Pedro A. M. (who sells fruit and vegetables), Concepción A. C. (who has a mechanic's shop), Rocío A. V. (who does floral arrangements), Delfina A. García (who sells lingerie), Aurora López C. (who sells cosmetics and perfumes), Brenda Tania A. Martínez (who sells shoes by catalog), Janeth Araceli Hernández López (who sells clothing) and Cristina R. Méndez (who sells snacks.) Pedro A. M. is the only man in the group; for this reason, they decided to call him "el cariñosito." He is 47 years old and has a family that includes 3 children (only one of whom is in school) and his wife Elvia. He has worked as a taxi driver for 23 years, but when he saw that the needs of his family were growing he decided to start up a new business. In this way he began selling fruit and vegetables. He sells every day in the different street markets in his community. Pedro goes out to stock his business with fruit and vegetables at 3 in the morning so that he can find the best prices and high quality products, since that is how you build a customer base. The best selling days are Sundays, and when there are things that don't sell, he gives them to the people who are in need so that they don't spoil. Pedro plans to get another fruit and vegetable stall so that he can give his son a good future. With the loan that has been provided, he decided to invest in canvas covers, blankets, fruit and vegetables. With the earnings he obtains he wants to do maintenance on his truck, since this is the way that he transports his merchandise. Las Cariñositas feel very fortunate that the lenders of Kiva are willing to lend their assistance so that they can succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy canvas covers, blankets, fruit, vegetables, lingerie and shoe catalogs, clothing and supplies to make Mexican snacks

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Mujeres Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es:
LA SRTA. JHEYNI SOFIA, TIENE 27 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SOLTERA Y HACE 5 MESES FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "MUJERES SIN FRONTERAS", FORMADO POR 9 INTEGRANTES RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA DE BELAUNDE EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS, SUS COMPAÑERAS LA ELIGIERON RECIENTEMENTE COMO SECRETARIA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
HACE UN AÑO SE DEDICA A LA ATENCIÓN DE SU BODEGA DE NOMBRE "BODEGA P.", QUE ESTÁ INSTALADO EN UN ESPACIO DE LA CASA DE UN FAMILIAR. INICIÓ SU NEGOCIO COLOCANDO UNA MESITA EN LA PUERTA DE LA CASA DONDE FUNCIONA SU BODEGA, DONDE COLOCABA UN POCO DE GOLOSINAS. HOY EN DÍA ES UNA BODEGA SURTIDA, Y CON SU TRABAJO HA IDO AMPLIANDO MAS EL NEGOCIO HA PODIDO CONTRATAR PERSONAL DE APOYO Y SOBRETOD APOYAR A SU ABUELITO.
UNA DE SUS METAS ES TENER UN MINIMARKET, PARA LO CUAL SE ESFUERZA Y TRABAJA MUCHO.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE UN TELEVISOR PARA SU BODEGA, PARA QUE SUS CLIENTES PUEDAN PASAR UN BUEN RATO EN LA BODEGA MIENTRAS CONSUME LOS PRODUCTOS OFRECIDOS POR JHEYNI.
texts.en:
Jheyni Sofia is 27 years old. She is single and has been a member of the group "Mujeres Sin Fronteras" for 5 months. The group is made up of 9 members who live in the Belaunde area of the Comas district. The other members recently elected her secretary of the group's board of directors. A year ago she began working in her store called "BODEGA P.", which is set up in a space in the house of a relative. She started her business with a table in the door of the house where her store is. She sold candies from it. Today it is a store with a variety of products and with her work she has expanded the business and been able to hire support staff and above all support her grandfather. One of her goals is to have a minimart, and for that she is working very hard. The loan she is asking for will be invested in buying a television for her store, so that her clients can spend awhile in the store while the consume the products offered by Jheyni.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy a television for her store

loans.name: Fany Narcisa

texts.es:
Fany de 49 años, ella vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil un lugar urbano donde esta la mayor parte de la gente de bajo recursos económicos. Ella tiene una taller de costura en su casa. 

Para tener su taller de costura ella tuvo que trabajar por muchos años cociendo para comprar su primera maquina de coser. Hace 5 años atrás ella pudo comenzar con el taller de confección en la sala de su casa. Ahora trabaja desde las 09h00 hasta las 19h00pm. 

Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar telas, hilos para su taller de confección. En el futuro quiere tener un ayudante para su taller de confección.
texts.en:
Fany is 49 years old and lives in Guasmo in Guayaquil, an urban area where most of the residents are of limited financial resources. She has a sewing workshop in her home.

In order to start this business, Fany had to work many years as a cook so that she could buy her first sewing machine. Five years ago, she established her workshop in the living room of her house. She now works from 9am until 7pm.

With this loan, Fany wants to buy fabrics and thread for her sewing workshop. In the future, she wants to hire an assistant for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & thread

loans.name: Prisca

texts.es:
La socia Prisca, tiene 34 años, tiene dos hijos y es natural de Ccatca provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal es fabricar tejas de arcilla con la ayuda de su esposo. Ellos empiezan a trabajar a las 3 de la mañana hasta las 12 de la tarde todos los días. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y les va muy bien. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar ramas de árboles que traen de las ciudades de Huancarani y de Urcos que utilizan para quemar, y así de esa forma hacen secar las tejas.

Ellos venden las tejas en su domicilio a la personas que vienen de las ciudades Abancay, Calca y Urubamba. Su actividad económica complementaria es llevar productos como por ejemplo papa, chuño, carne y habas a la ciudad de Huancarni donde vende, otra de sus actividades es administrar una pequeña tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad com o por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc.

Prisca se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member Prisca is 34 years old. She has two children and is from Ccatca province of Quispicanchis, of the department Cuzco. Her main economic activity is making clay roof tiles with her husband's help. They start working at 3 in the morning and continue until 12 in the afternoon every day. They have had this business for 15 years and it is going well for them. She needs the loan to buy tree branches brought from the cities of Huancarani and Urcos and are burned to dry out their tiles. They sell the tiles in their home to people who come from the cities of Abancay, Calca and Urubamba. Her additional economic activity is bringing products, for example potatoes, potato flour, beef and beans, to the city of Huancarni where she sells them. Another of her activities is running a small store where she sells basic items such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc. Prisca is thankful for the opportunity offered through this program and she is also committed to making the corresponding payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tree branches.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.es:
Fausta, tiene 39 años y tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal es elaborar teja de arcilla y su esposo Cirilo le ayuda. Ellos empiezan a trabajar de madrugada aproximadamente a las 3 y terminan a las 12 del medio todos los días. Ellos elaboran las tejas en su domicilio que está ubicado en la comunidad de Huayllapampa de la ciudad de Huambutio. Ya son 20 años que se dedican al negocio y les va muy bien. Sus clientes vienen de distintos lugares alejados como por ejemplo de la ciudad de Urubamba, Calca y del mismo lugar a comprar sus productos porque son baratos y de buena calidad.
 
Fausta pertenece al banco comunal aproximadamente de 2 a 3 años y ella requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo arcilla, arena y rama que sirven para la fabricación de tejas.
texts.en:
Fausta is 39 years old and has three children. Her main economic activity is making ceramic tiles. Her husband Cirilo helps her with this work. They start very early, at about 3 in the morning, and finish around noon every day. They make the tiles at their home, which is located in the Huayllapampa community in the city of Huambutio. They have worked at this business for 20 years now, and it is going very well for them. Their customers come from a range of places, such as the cities of Urubamba and Calca as well as the local community, to buy their products, because they are inexpensive and of good quality. Fausta has belonged to the communal bank for 2-3 years, and she needs the loan to buy materials necessary for making tiles. such as clay, sand and wood.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies such as clay, sand and wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy AVON, ZERMAT, ORIFLAME products

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura, tiene 63 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. La socia hace varios años atrás tenía una fábrica de elaboración de yeso junto con su esposo, pero su esposo tuvo que viajar a la ciudad del Cusco por motivo de trabajo y entonces tuvieron que cerrar la fábrica. Como la socia permanecía en la casa su esposo le motivo para pueda ella emprendería un nuevo negocio entonces decidieron abrir una tienda de abarrotes. Actualmente su actividad económica principal de la socia es atender la tienda de abarrotes donde vende comestibles, verduras, cervezas y muchas cosas más. Ya son nueve años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE HUAMBUTIO” desde hace 15 años y su primer crédito fue de 100 dólares. Actualmente, la socia requiere un nuevo préstamo para comprar productos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más y asi de esta manera va poder abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Laura is 63 years old and married with four children. Several years ago she had a factory for the production of plaster together with her husband, but her husband had to travel to Cusco for work, and so they had to close the factory. Since Laura was still living in the house, her husband encouraged her to undertake a new business. So, they decided to open a grocery story. Presently her main economic activity is tending the grocery store where foods, vegetables, beer, and many other things are sold. She has been working at the business for nine years, and it has gone well thanks to the determination she puts in her work. Laura has belonged to the communal bank Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio for about 15 years, and her first loan was for $100. Currently, Laura needs a new loan to purchase products such as rice, sugar, noodles, and other things to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and stock her store with products such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina, tiene 39 años, es natural de Ccatca, vive en Huambutio y tiene tres hijos de las cuales uno es independiente y dos depende de ella todavía. Alejandrina y Aniceto son esposos y se ayudan mutuamente en el hogar y tiene un negocio familiar que consiste en elaborar tejas de arcilla. Ya son 20 años que se dedican al negocio y les va muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo.  Ellos requieren el préstamo para comprar ramas. Las ramas de arboles sirven para hacer secar las tejas y la arena sirve para mezclar con la arcillas para se ha más compacto la teja. Su actividad económica complementaria es administrar su pequeña tienda de venta de comestibles.

Alejandrina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 39 years old. She is originally from Ccatca but currently lives in Huambutio. She has three children; one is already grown and independent, and the other two still depend on her. Alejandrina and her husband Aniceto both help each other at home, and they also have a family business making ceramic tiles. They have worked in this business for 20 years now, and it has gone very well for them thanks to the dedication they bring to their work. They need the loan to buy tree branches, which are used in drying the tiles. They also need sand, which is mixed with the clay to make the tiles more compact. As a secondary economic activity, the couple also runs a small food store. Alejandrina is grateful for the opportunity provided to her in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tree branches and sand

loans.name: María Esmeralda

texts.en:
María is a 59-year-old mother of four who lives with her husband and daughter in San Jose, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. María is a seamstress/dressmaker by trade. She earns a living by giving sewing classes and by selling clothing that she makes. 

María is a versatile entrepreneur; she can make all types of clothing including school uniforms, pyjamas, dress clothes, etc. She hopes to use this loan to finance the purchase of a machine to make clothing alterations. She plans to use the new machine to create more detailed clothes to offer to clients.

María is also a grandmother and during the day she takes care of her granddaughter until 2 pm, when the child´s mother (María´s daughter) comes to pick her up. When her granddaughter is relaxed or sleeping, María goes to work producing various clothing items. 

Two days a week, María teaches a sewing class in Guadalupe (less than an hour away by bus). On these days, she returns home around 4pm to continue making clothes. 

María´s goal is to sell more uniforms and increase her market share. She hopes to use the profits from her business to improve her family's standard of living. One of the main obstacles for María and her family has been the low level of income the family earns as a whole. At the moment, María´s husband is out of work, rendering the income generated from clothes-making all the more important.

loans.use: buying a machine to make clothing alterations

loans.name: Lesbia Verónica

texts.es:
La Sra. V. M.  es una profesora  que trabaja en una Esc. Ubicada en el municipio del Viejo donde a la vez habita.

Ella va a utilizar el crédito para reparar el techo de su casa ya  que según ella cada vez que llueve, toda el agua se les pasas por medio del zinc y sus niños se le están enfermando 

La Sra. V. M.  es madre de 3 niños los cuales ella sirve de padre y madre para ellos ya que su padre no vive con ellos, pero con la ayuda de Dios y su trabajo ha podido darles la educación necesaria a sus hijos, nos dijo la Sra. 

Este es el primer crédito que ha Sra. Tiene con la Institución, a lo cual dice estar muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le han otorgado y espera seguir trabajando con CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Ms. V. M. is a teacher at a school located in the city of Viejo where she currently lives. She is going to use the loan to repair her roof as every time it rains, the water leaks through the zinc sheet metal and her children are getting sick. Ms. V. M. is both mother and father to her 3 children as their father does not live with them. She tells us that with the help of God and by working, she has been able to provide her children with the education they need. This is her first loan with the institution. She is grateful for the opportunity that she has been given and hopes to continue working with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement and repair

loans.name: Zoila Hortencia

texts.es:
Zoila de 25 años, ella vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil un lugar urbano donde esta la mayor parte de la gente de bajo recursos económicos. Para el bienestar de sus dos hijos ella decidió hace un año invertir sus ahorros en víveres y venderlos en su casa. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo ella ha trabajado desde las 06h00am hasta las 19h00pm, ahora no solo vende víveres sino también verduras y legumbres. Ella quiere continuar con su tienda porque la ha ayuda a tener mas tiempo con sus hijos. 

Para poder incrementarla mas con alimentos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo legumbres, carnes y frutas. En el futuro quiere tener mas ingresos para poder comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Zoila is 25 years old and lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil, a place located where most of its inhabitants are of limited means. For the well being of her two children, she decided to invest her savings and buy foodstuffs to sell out of her home one year ago. Little by little and with much effort, she has been working from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm and now she also sells vegetables and beans. She wants to continue running her store because it allows her to spend more time with her children. She would like to use the money from this loan to buy more beans, vegetables, and meats. Someday she would like to have enough of an income in order to be able to buy her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Casiano

texts.es:
Casiano,  tiene 39 años, es casado, tiene 6 hijos y es natural de provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco de la comunidad de Pitucando. Actualmente,  el socio vive en la ciudad de Huambutio donde tiene una pequeña fábrica de extracción y elaboración de yeso. 

Casiano pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE HUAMBUTIO” y hace dos años atrás, su primer crédito fue de S/. 1,000 soles y ahora requiere el préstamo de los S/. 500 soles para comprar más leña que cuesta la arroba 8 soles. 

Casiano se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Casiano is 39 years old, is married, and has 6 children. He is from the province of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco, from the town of Pitucando. He currently lives in the city of Huambutio, where he has a small factory for the extraction and processing of chalk. Casiano belongs to the “Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio” communal bank. His first loan, two years ago, was for PEN 1,000.00 and now he needs a loan of PEN 500.00 to buy more firewood, which costs PEN 8.00 per 14 kg. bundle. Casiano is grateful for the opportunity provided by him through this program and he promises to make his payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
Este grupo  se llama san Felipe, lleva el nombre de su barrio que se encuentra en hueyapan, tétela del volcán son 6 integrantes: Paula, ella se dedica a la venta de pollo; Julia, Florivel y Marisol venden fruta de temporada, Francisca vende refrescos, MA. Natividad vende aguacate y fruta de temporada, todas las  integrantes pertenecen a la misma comunidad en Morelos.
Marisol que es de quien vamos a platicar cuenta con 30 años de edad, lleva 11 años de casada con el Sr. Gustavo, tiene 4 pequeñitos: Alexis tiene 11 añitos  cursa el 5º. De primaria, Gustavo de 9 años (primaria), Imanol de 6 años(inicio de primaria) y el mas chiquito Julián de 1 años de edad.
Ésta es la segunda ocasión en la que el grupo San Felipe pide un préstamo a FRAC, ellas se dieron cuenta que en FRAc las tasa de interes son bajas y por eso decidieron  seguir trabajando con FRAC. 
Marisol utilizará este crédito para la compra de fertilizante y poder abonar sus plantas de frambuesa y chayote que es a los que dedica, el sueño que ella tiene es de poder levantar unos cuartos mas para su vivienda, ya que con sus pequeñines  necesita darles sus espacio, otra meta que ella quiere alcanzar es poder adquirir otro lote para sembrar mas plantas esto lo hará una vez  que termine de pagar a FRAC el nuevo préstamo q le darán. 
Lo que mas le gusta de su comunidad es el clima fresco, y productivo todo el año hay fruta de temporada (Manzana, frambuesa, fresa, pera, tejocote, chilacayote, aguacate, perón, etc.) Todo lo que se produce en tierra fría. Y también la fiesta de su pueblo del día 4 de agosto le festeja a santo Domingo.
Todas las integrantes tienen una bonita amistad y se sienten a gusto de formar el grupo de san Felipe. Quiere agradecer a fundacion realidad y kiva por el apoyo que han estado recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group is called San Felipe after the neighborhood in Hueyepan, Tétela del Volcán, in which it’s located. It has 6 members: Paula, who sells chicken, Julia, Florivel and Marisol who sell seasonal fruit, Francisca who sells beverages, María Natividad who sells avocadoes and seasonal fruit; all the members are from the same community in Morelos. Marisol, whom we will feature, is 30 years old. She has been married to Gustavo for 11 years and she has 4 little ones: Alexis, 11, who is a 5th-grader, Gustavo, 9, who is in elementary school, Imanol, 6, who is just starting elementary school, and the baby, Julián, who is one year old. This is the second time that the San Felipe group has requested a loan from FRAC. They realized that in FRAC the interest rates were low so they decided to continue working with FRAC. Marisol will use the funds to buy fertilizer so that she can fertilize her raspberry and chayote crops. Her dream is to be able to add a few rooms to her home because she needs more space for her children. Another goal is to be able to buy another lot so that she can plant more; she will do this once she finishes paying back the new loan FRAC will grant. What she likes most about her community is the cool and productive year-round climate. There is seasonal fruit available (apple, raspberry, strawberry, pear, Mexican hawthorn, chilacayote [a type of pumpkin], avocado, perón [a type of tomato], etc.); everything common to cold climates. In addition, her community’s feast day which is August 4, Santo Domingo day. All the group members are good friends and feel comfortable forming the San Felipe group. She wants to thank Fundación Realidad and Kiva for the help they have been providing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chemical and natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Martha Paola

texts.es: La Sra. Martha Paola E. L., tiene 38 años de edad. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo e hijo. Trabaja como obrera de campo en la empresa Ica Pacific desde hace 4 años. Su esposo tambien trabaja en la misma empresa desde hace 6 años. Quiere terminar la construcción de su vivienda, la cual ha venido construyendo poco a poco con sus ingresos. La Sra. Martha es una  persona muy trabajadora que le ha brindado una buena  educación a sus hijos con mucho esfuerzo y pretende tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es poder concluir con la construcción de su casa. La Sra Martha Paola E. L., agradece la ayuda que le brindemos para lograr hacer realidad su sueño a tráves de esye financiamiento.
texts.en:
Martha Paola E. L. is 38 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and son. She has been working as a field laborer for the Ica Pacific business for the past 4 years. Her husband has also been working for the same business for the past 6 years. She wants to finish building her house, which she has been building bit by bit with her income. Martha is a very hardworking person who has provided a good education to her children through much hard work and she aspires to a better quality of life. Her dream is to finish building her house. Martha Paola E. L. is grateful for the support we are providing her so she can achieve her dream through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her housing

loans.name: Ruth Rocio

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Ruth; ella tiene 30 años de edad y la socia es soltera y se dedica a su trabajo de lleno, ella trabaja en el municipio de Oropesa y le gusta mucho todo lo que aprende cada día, ella es una mujer muy empeñosa y disfruta mucho su trabajo, pero la socia también le ayuda a su mamá que vende granos los fines de semana en el mercado de Angostura, ella es muy buena hija y desea para su mamá lo mejor, sabe que su ammá disfruta lo que hace y por eso le deja que mantenga su negocio de venta de granos y los fines de seman le ayuda. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el negocio chico de su mamá, ellas le compran a lso proveedores de granos al por mayor para la venta. 

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y de este modo seguir creciendo y apoyando a su madre; así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The client belongs to the “Purified Virgen – Angostura” communal bank. She lives in the district of Angostura, in the province of Saylla, department of Cusco. The client is Ruth and she is 26 years old. She is single and works full time. She works in the municipality of Oropesa and she likes everything that she learns everyday. She is a very dedicated person and enjoys her job very much. She also helps her mother, who sells grains at the Angostura market on the weekends. She is a very good daughter and wants the best for her mother. She knows that her mother enjoys what she does, so she lets her keep running her grain-selling business and helps on the weekends. She is requesting a loan to buy more inventory for her mother's small business, they buy in bulk from local grain providers and then resell the grains. This client values and is infinitely grateful for the loan granted to her, since it will allow her to grow and continue to support her mother. She promises to make her payments in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Meris

texts.es:
La Sra. Meris C. es dueña de una pulpería que está ubicada  en el municipio del Viejo, Departamento de Chinandega.

Ella va a utilizar el crédito para comprar mercadería ya que su negocio es un producto revolverte y a la vez perecedero en cuanto a las verduras, cuajada, leche, etc. y necesita surtirlo a menudo.

La Sra. C. es una Señora de 63 años de edad la cual vive solamente con su marido ya que nunca tuvo hijos y entre los dos trabajan en la pulpería.

Este es el crédito No. 27 que tiene con CEPRODEL, y todos los han cancelado en tiempo y forma, razón por la cual dice estar muy agradecida con la Institución por todas las atenciones y ayudas ofrecidas para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Meris C. is the owner of a convenience store located in the town of Viejo, Chinandega Department. She is going to use the loan to buy merchandise since her business has high product turnover and also has perishable products like vegetables, curd, milk, etc., and she needs to restock often. Mrs. C. is 63 years old. She lives with only her husband since she never had children, and the two of them work in the store. This is her 27th loan with CEPRODEL, and she has repaid all her loans on time, for which reason she says she is very grateful to the Institution for all the attention and help offered her to support her business.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome, tiene 29 años, tiene tres hijos (Junior de nueve años, Sharmeli de cuatro años y Joseph de un año medio). Salome nos cuenta que es madre y padre para sus hijos pues su esposo los abandono, ella vive en la ciudad de Huambutio y tiene un pequeño negocio de venta comestibles en su domicilio y también vende salchipapas y pollipapas de forma ambulatoria, ella nos cuenta que tiene un pequeño carrito donde prepara la comida. 

Salome saca el carrito y empieza a preparar la comida en la puerta de su casa desde las 5 de la tarde y hasta que termine de vender la comida. Ya son tres años que se dedica a la venta de salchipapas y pollipapas. 

Salome pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio” y requiere el crédito para comprar arroz, pollo, papas, aceite, salchichas, etc. 

La socia nos cuenta que al próximo mes va empezar a trabajar en una fábrica donde se elabora papilla, ella trabajara desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde de lunes a viernes. La fábrica está ubicada en la ciudad de Oropesa que queda a media de hora de su casa entonces, ella tiene que levantarse muy  temprano para atender a sus hijos y después dirigirse al trabajo. El sueño de la socia es comprar una congeladora para su tienda de abarrotes y sacar profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Salome is 29 years old and has three children (Junior, nine; Sharmeli, four; and Joseph, one and a half). Salome tells us that she is both mother and father to her children, since her husband abandoned the family. She lives in the city of Huambutio and has a small business selling groceries in her home. She also sells salchipapas (sausages and french fries) and pollipapas (chicken and french fries) as a mobile vendor. She tells us that she has a small cart which she uses to prepare the food. At 5 in the evening, Salome gets out her cart and begins to prepare the food in front of her home. She continues until all the food is sold. She has sold salchipapas and pollipapas for three years. Salome belongs to the “Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio” communal bank. She needs the loan to buy rice, chicken, potatoes, cooking oil, sausages and other supplies. The borrower tells us that next month she will start work in a factory that makes pureed foods. She will work from 7 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon, Monday through Friday. The factory is located in the city of Oropesa, which is half an hour from her house. Because of this, she will have to get up very early to take care of her children and then go to work. Salome's dreams are to buy a freezer for her grocery store and help her children pursue professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, chicken, potatoes, cooking oil, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Maria De Cristo

texts.es:
La Sra. P. N. es una comerciante  que vende ropa usada y Huevos en su casa de habitación y ambulante, Ella habita en el municipio del Viejo, Departamento de Chinandega.

Ella va a utilizar el crédito en la compra de pacas de ropa usada para revender y así crecer más en su negocio.

La Sra. P. N. vive sola en su casa de habitación ya que hace años se separo de su marido,  y sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y viven fuera del país.

Actualmente la Sra. Lleva 25 créditos al día de hoy los cuales todos los ha pagado muy bien en tiempo record, y a la vez dice estar muy agradecida por todas las oportunidades que le ha brindado la Institución ya que ella siente y ve que su negocio ha crecido y mucho
texts.en:
Mrs. P. N. is a merchant who sells used clothes and eggs from home and door-to-door. She lives in Viejo, Chinandega department. She will use the funds to buy bundles of used clothing to resell in order to grow more in her business. Mrs. P. N. lives alone in her home since she has been separated from her husband for several years and all her children are adults living abroad. Currently she has had 25 loans all of which she has repaid in record time. She states that she is very grateful for the opportunities she has been granted by the institution because she feels and sees that her business has grown quite a bit.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bundles of used clothing and crates of eggs.

loans.name: Las Kiwis Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA LOS KIWIS ESTA UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE JALOXTOC, MORELOS, MEXICO, EL GRUPO ESTA FORMADO POR 5 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN Y SON VECINOS Y SOLICITAN SU PRIMER PRESTAMO EN FUNDACION REALIDAD, LA SRA. ZENAIDA  TIENE UN PUESTO DE DULCES, LA SRA. ELIZABETH VA INICIAR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA DE ZAPATOS, LA SRA. MARGARITA VENTA DE ZAPATOS, LA SRA. SARA A LA VENTA DE ROPA Y LA SEÑORA MARLEN DEPOSITO DE REFRESCOS

LA REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO ES LA SRA. SARA  J. V. TIENE 45 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA EL 2º. AÑO DE PRIMARIA, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA PARA DAMA, ESTA SOLICITANDO SU PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCANCIA COMO SON PANTALON DE MEZCLILLA, BLUSAS Y PLAYERAS,   TIENE 6 AÑOS EN EL NEGOCIO  Y CON EL CREDITO  PIENSA  AMPLIARLO, TENER VARIEDAD DE ROPA PARA OFRECER A SUS CLIENTES Y ASI SUS GANACIAS SE INCREMENTEN

LA SRA SARA ESTA MUY CONTENTA Y AGRADECE A LOS PRESTATARIOS DE  KIVA LA CONFIANZA QUE DEPOSITAN EN ELLA Y EN SU GRUPO.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called The Kiwis and is located in Jaloxtoc, Morelos, Mexico. It has 5 members who know each other and are neighbors. They are asking Fundación Realidad for their first loan. Zenaida has a candy stand, Elizabeth is going to start to sell shoes, Margarita sells shoes, Sara sells clothing and Marlen has a soft-drink depository. The group representative is Sara J. V., 45. She finished 2nd grade and she sells women’s clothing. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as denim trousers, blouses and t-shirts. She has been in business for 6 years and plans to use the funds to expand it by having more stock available for her customers thereby increasing profits. Sara is very happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the trust they place in her and her group.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy denim trousers and ladies' blouses.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina, tiene 45 años y es natural de Huambutio. Su actividad económica principal es llevar comida a la ladrillera. Ella también se dedica  a la elaboración de yeso. Su esposo Julio trabaja con la elaboración de tejas. Requiere el préstamo para comprar leña y rama que sirve para hacer secar las tejas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
        
Martina se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Martina is 45 years old and she is from Huambutio. Her primary business is taking food to the brick factory. She also makes chalk. Her husband, Julio, makes roof tiles. She needs the loan to buy firewood and branches to dry the tiles on. She belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Vírgen del Carmen de Huambutio” communal bank. Martina is grateful for the opportunity granted her through this program and she promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy branches and firewood

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, tiene 54 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos  y esposo Juan es profesor. Su actividad económica principal es vender comida, Su restaurante está ubicado en la calle Tarapaca del distrito de San Jerónimo del departamento del Cusco.  Gladys pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio” y ella es la presidenta del banco comunal. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplos papa, carne, fideos y muchas cosas más.   
        
Gladys se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gladis is 54 years old. She is married, has two children, and her husband, Juan, is a teacher. Her main business is selling food. Her restaurant is located on Tarapaca street, in the district of San Jerónimo, in the department of Cusco. Gladys belongs to the “Vírgen del Carmen de Huambutio” communal bank and she is the president. She needs the loan to buy more ingredients, such as potatoes, meat, noodles, and many other things. Gladys is grateful for the opportunity granted her through this program and she promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more ingredients, such as potatoes, meat, noodles, and many other things

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
La señora Justa, tiene dos hijos, tiene 33 años y vive en la cuidad de Huambutio. Su esposo Fredy trabaja en la municipalidad de Cusco. Su actividad económica principal es vender comida y tiene un pequeño restaurante que está ubicado en la avenida principal de la ciudad de Huambutio. Justa pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio” y ella es la secretaria del banco comunal. Ella requiere el crédito para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo arroz, carne, vegetales y  muchos más.  
        
Justa se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Señora Justa Q. D. is 33 years old. She has two children and she lives in the city of Huambutio. Her husband Fredy works in the municipality of Cusco. Her principal business activity is selling food and she has a small restaurant in Huambutio's main street. Señora Justa Q. D. is a member and the secretary of the “Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio” community bank. She needs a loan to buy supplies such as rice, meat, vegetables and so on. She is grateful for this opportunity and is therefore committed to making the loan repayments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies such as rice, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Lucinda Maria

texts.es:
Lucinda de 52 años, ella vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil un lugar urbano donde esta la mayor parte de la gente de bajo recursos económicos. Ella hace manualidades con fomix y papelería como artesanías. 

Comenzó hace mucho tiempo como aprendizaje y lo convirtió en su primer medio de ingresos, poco a poco con esfuerzo ha podido tener clientela y vender tanto que ahora su casa la convierte en local para sus manualidades. Una de sus hijas ahora le ayuda a vender las manualidades que hace. 

Hace dibujos, caricaturas, muñecas, artesanías etc. Pero para poder continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo fomix, pegamento y la otra parte alquilar un local para su negocio. 
 
En el futuro ella quiere tener un almacén de manualidades y seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucinda, 52, lives in El Guasmo, Guayaquil, an urban area whose inhabitants are mostly low-income. She makes handicrafts with Styrofoam and paper. She started out long ago as an apprentice but eventually turned it into her main source of income. She has gradually acquired regular customers through her efforts and now sells so much that she has turned her house into a store for her crafts. One of her daughters helps her sell the crafts she makes. She makes drawings, caricatures, dolls, crafts, etc. But, in order to be able to continue with her business, she wants to use the loan to buy Styrofoam and glue and use another part of it to rent a space for her store. In the future, she would like to have a large crafts store and continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For Styrofoam, glue and locale rent.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia Victoria, tiene 43 años, es separada y tiene dos hijos, ella es madre y padre de  para sus hijos y les da lo mejor para que ellos puedan ser felices.  Su actividad económica principal es la venta de comestibles, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la cuidad de Huambutio y su segunda actividad económica complementaria es vender alfalfa. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y muchas cosas más.  

Victoria se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Association member Victoria Q. F. is 43 years old, separated, and has two children for whom she acts as both mother and father, giving them the best she can to make them happy. Her main business activity is selling groceries and she has a small grocery store in the city of Huambutio. Her supplementary business activity is selling alfalfa. Victoria Q. F. needs a loan to buy more goods such as rice, sugar and so on. She is grateful for this opportunity and is therefore committed to making the loan repayments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more goods such as rice and sugar

loans.name: Fanni Leonor

texts.es: La Sra. A. P. Fanni Leonor, de 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus pequeños hijos. Vive en casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en pasaje Ramos Lujaraja perteneciente al distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como obrera de campo en Agrícola Valle Del Sol. Su esposo también trabaja como obrero de campo. La Sra. es una persona muy responsable y emprendedora, con todas las ganas de salir adelante.La Sra fanny requiere el préstamo para poder terminar de construir su casa. Su deseo, según nos comenta es terminar de construir dicha vivienda, para poder darle a sus hijos unamejor calidad de vida. Ella está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento propuesto por nuestra entidad.
texts.en:
Señora Fanni Leonor A. P. is 38 years old and she lives with her husband and young children. She lives in her own house, located in a small street, Ramos Lujaraja, in the district of Santiago. She works as a field laborer for Agrícola Valle Del Sol. Her husband also works as a field laborer. Señora A. P. is very responsible and enterprising, with great enthusiasm for getting on in life. She needs a loan to finish building her house. She says she wants to complete the construction of her dwelling so that her children have a better quality of life. She is grateful for the support that we can provide by offering this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es: Juan David, tiene 37 años, es soltero y es natural de Huambutio. Actualmente, el socio trabaja en el gobierno regional como albañil, el trabaja desde el mes de Julio del 2009 hasta hoy día. Antes el trabaja en el INC como obrero de investigación. Su actividad económica complementaria es dirigir un grupo musical llamado “Los Devis”. Ya son dos años que tiene el grupo musical y le va muy bien. El socio requiere el  préstamo para comprar un amplificador que cuesta S/. 1,800. El pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio”. Ya son dos años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Juan David is 37 years old, single, and a native of Huambutio. Currently, he works with the regional government as a bricklayer. He has been working for them since July 2009. Before, he worked with the INC as an investigative construction worker. His complementary job is directing a musical group called, Los Devis. This group has been together now for two years and it is going very well. He is seeking a loan so that he can purchase an amplifier that costs S/. 1,800. He is a member of the communal bank, Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio. He has been a participant for the past two years and it is going quite well for him.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an electronic device.

loans.name: Las Pulguitas De Yumbel Group

texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Las Pulguitas de Yumbel” and it is made up of 22 members (20 women and 2 men) from the city of Puerto Montt, Chile.  Their businesses are primarily fishing, selling used clothes, a dessert shop, a butcher shop and a perfume and accessories shop.

The group member interviewed was María, who is the president of the group. In the picture she is in the first row on the far right, wearing a green scarf and holding a white hat in her hand. She is an ambulatory used-clothes saleswoman. She sells in five different parts of the city, including at the flea market on Yumbel street on Sundays. She takes Tuesdays and Thursdays off.  

With her earnings, she helps economically support her family, which includes her husband, her daughter and the two young granddaughters who live with her.

María purchases her merchandise both in fairs and in stores. She plans on investing this loan in clothing and in curtains or other household fabrics. Her dream is to have a set locale from which to sell, in some part of the city.

María very much enjoys the support she receives from her Fondo Esperanza loan officer, and the atmosphere of trust that exists within her communal bank.  She also says that thanks to the loans she has received, she feels more secure in her business.

Puerto Montt is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Lagos region.  The attractions of Puerto Montt are its beautiful green landscapes; its beaches, which are special because they do not have many tourists; its artisan crafts and goods; and its cuisine, especially its reputation for fish and seafood. Puerto Montt is also the port of entry to the Isla Grande de Chiloé, which is rich in traditions and legends.

loans.use: Used clothing and fabrics

loans.name: Marta Regina

texts.es:
La joven Marta Regina es casada con un hijo de 3 años de edad, su esposo es profesor de educación primaria pero en la actualidad no ejerce su carrera por falta de plaza en los centros escolares, por tal razón él se esta dedicando a la siembra, ya que aparte de su profesión se han dedicado a la agricultura.
 Marta Regina es nacida y criada en una comunidad llamada el ojochal Posoltega y es precisamente en esa misma comunidad donde ella labora para la Escuela San José desempeñándose como maestra de educación primaria desde hace 9 años.
Marta Regina ha sido financiada por nuestra institución desde el año 2006 obteniendo 4 créditos siendo los primeros 3 para mejoramiento de vivienda y este último que ha sido para siembra de Ajonjolí ya que ella y su esposo también se dedican a esta actividad.
texts.en:
Marta Regina is married and has a 3-year-old son. Her husband is an elementary school teacher but isn’t practicing his profession due to lack of teaching positions in schools. For this reason, he is farming because he’s been a farmer in addition to his profession. Marta Regina was born and raised in a community called El Ojochal Posoltega and it is precisely in this community that she has been employed as an elementary school teacher in the San José School for the past 9 years. Marta Regina has been financed by our institution since 2006; she has had 4 loans. She used the first three of them to make home improvements and this last one will be for sesame crops that she and her husband also are dedicated to.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For farming expenses (purchase ingredients and till the land)

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
En el barrio Germán pomares   Municipio de Somotillo La señora Reyna Isabel C. P. se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en la escuela Bertha Núñez de Somotillo.
Ella nos dice que el crédito será utilizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como es cemento bloques arena piedra para la construcción de una pared de contención en su casa de habitación.
Este es el cuarto crédito que nos solicita y nos dice que los primeros créditos la beneficiaron para empezar la construcción de su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Germán Pomares in the town of Somotillo, Reyna Isabel C. P. works as a elementary school teacher at the Bertha Núñez de Somotillo School. She tells us that this loan will be used to purchase construction materials such as cement blocks, sand, and stone for a retaining wall in her home. This is the fourth credit that she has requested, and she tells us that the first loans that she received allowed her to begin construction on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair a wall in her home

loans.name: Geovan Antonio

texts.es:
Geovan de 36 años, el vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil un lugar urbano donde esta la mayor parte de la gente de bajo recursos económicos. Tiene dos hijos, el tiene un asadero de pollos. 

El trabajo por 10 años en un asadero de pollo pero como necesitaba mas ingresos para su familia, el decidió invertir sus ahorros en pollos y en un asadero para vender pollos con menestra y banano frito. Por ahora trabaja desde las 16h00 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Cada pollo asado lo vende a $8.00. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mesas, sillas y pollos para su negocio de venta de pollos, en el futuro quiere comprar un carro para dar a domicilio los pollos.
texts.en:
Geovan is 36 years old and lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil, an urban place where much of the population has few economic resources. He has two children, and he owns a chicken roasting shop. Geovan has worked for 10 years in a chicken roasting shop, but since he needed to increase his income for his family, he decided to use his savings to invest in purchasing chickens and his own roasting shop so that he could sell chicken with vegetable stew and fried bananas. For now, he works from 4:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m. every day. He sells each roast chicken for $8.00. With this loan, he would like to buy tables, chairs and chickens for his business selling roast chickens. In the future, he would like to buy a car so that he can deliver the chickens to homes.

Translated from Spanish by Anne R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, and chickens

loans.name: Nelly Socorro

texts.es:
En el barrio Las colinas Municipio de Somotillo La señora Nelly socorro L. A. se desempeña como comerciante en el mercado municipal  de Somotillo.
Ella nos dice que el crédito será utilizado para la compra de mercadería por mayor y variada como es arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, golosinas etc.
Este es el segundo crédito que nos solicita y nos dice que el primeros créditos la beneficio para empezar a surtir su  pulpería.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Las Colinas in the town of Somotillo, Nelly Socorro L. A. works as a merchant in the Somotillo town market. She tells us that this loan will be used to buy various wholesale merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, beans, sweets, etc. This is the second loan that she has requested, and she tells us that the first loan allowed her to begin to supply her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various merchandise for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Moisés

texts.es: El señor Moisés es un maestro de educación primaria que se ha desempeñado desde hace muchos años junto con su esposa, ha demostrado honradez en este municipio de cinco pinos, de igual manera su esposa es maestra que ayudan a sacar adelante a la familia, pero tiene un hijo en la universidad que esta a próximo de culminar sus estudios por lo cual ha gastado por lo tanto se presentaron a nuestras oficinas a solicitar un crédito para cubrir un poco sus necesisidades.
texts.en:
Moisés and his wife have been elementary school teachers for several years. He has demonstrated trustworthiness in the community of Cinco Pinos. Hi wife, who is also a teacher, helps him support the family. However, he has a son at university who is about to finish his studies and this has meant additional expenses. Therefore, he came by our offices to request a loan to cover some of his needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay his son's university costs.

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es:
En el barrio Francisco Reyes  de Somotillo La señora Norma Isabel C. D. se desempeña como Maestra de educación secundaria en el Instituto Alfonso Cortez De la Ciudad de Somotillo.
Ella nos dice que el crédito será utilizado para la compra de  materiales de construcción cemento y bloques para la construcción de una pared divisoria en su casa de habitación.
Este es el tercer crédito que nos solicita y nos dice que el primeros créditos la beneficio para empezar a construir su casa de habitación y hoy ella la esta acondicionando.
texts.en:
Norma Isabel C. D. is a secondary school teacher at Alfonso Cortez Institute located in Somotillo’s Francisco Reyes neighborhood. She tells us that the loan will be used to buy building materials and supplies like cement and concrete blocks to build a dividing wall in her home. This is the 3rd loan she has requested from us and she tells us that she used the first loans to start building her house and now she is furnishing it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy assorted clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Fortunata;  ella tiene 35 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos menores la socia se dedica a apoyar a su conyugue en la carpintería, ella también realiza algunos pequeños trabajos en el taller, la socia junto a su pareja tienen una carpintería en su casa y ella da los acabados finales, de laqueo y cepillado, o barnizado, también agrega jaladores a los muebles y mucho más. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de madera, herramientas para la carpintería. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member pertains to the communal bank, Virgen Purificada-Angostura. She lives in the district of Angostura, in the province of Saylla, a department of Cusco. Her name is Fortunata y she is 35 years old. She has 4 young children. She helps her husband with their carpentry business and does some small projects in their workshop. She, along with her spouse, have a carpentry shop in their home and she does the final touches on the pieces: the lacquering, the brushing, and/or the tarnishing, and much more. She is seeking out a loan to invest in the purchase of wood and other carpentry tools. She is grateful and deeply values the loans that she has been offered and from which have permitted her business to grow and her and her family's quality of life to improve. She promises to make timely payments on her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood and carpentry tools.

loans.name: Benita De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
En el barrio Las Colinas  de Somotillo la señora Benita de los Ángeles G. T. se desempeña como comerciante de verduras en el mercado municipal de somotillo atendiendo los clientes del casco urbano como los que nos visitan a diario de las comarcas aledañas
Ella nos dice que el crédito será utilizado para la compra de mercadería por mayor y variado y de esta manera incrementar sus ganancias en su negocio.
Este es el primer crédito que nos solicita y nos dice que la beneficiaran para aumentar su capital de trabajo y de esta manera maximizar su ganancias en su negocio de venta de verduras.
texts.en:
In the Las Colinas de Somotillo neighborhood, Mrs. Benita de los Ángeles G. T. sells vegetables in the municipal market of Somotillo. She works with the customers from the urban area such as those that we see daily from the neighboring regions. She tells us that the loan will be used to buy merchandise wholesale and with a greater variety, and in this way she can increase her earnings from the business. This is the first loan that she is requesting and she tells us that it will help her build up her working capital and thus maximize the income from the business of selling vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise wholesale and in greater variety for her vegetable business.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito D. Angostura en la provincia D. Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Melchora; ella tiene 71 años D. edad y La socia es viuda y tiene 1 hijo la socia tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes, ella se dedica a administrar su tienda, la socia también cría animales menores, ella tiene pollos, gallinas y cuyes; La socia es muy conocida en el distrito D. Angostura y la gente la quiere y aprecia mucho, ella sabe que por la edad que tiene no es fácil adquirir un préstamo y es por todo ello que está muy feliz D. seguir siendo miembro del banco comunal; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche al por mayor para la tienda abarrotes. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member is part of the communal bank, Virgen Purificada-Angostura. She lives in the district of Angostura, a province of Saylla, in the department of Cusco. Her name is Melchora and she is 71 years old. She is a widow and has one son. She has a small grocery store and spends her time running it. She also takes care of small animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs. She is well-known in the district of Angostura and the people are very fond and appreciative of her. She knows that because of her age it is not easy to obtain a loan and as such, she is very happy to continue to be a member of this communal bank. She is asking for a loan to invest towards the purchase of products in bulk for her shop, such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk. She deeply values and is very grateful for the credit that she has been offered from which has allowed her business to grow and her quality of living to improve. As such, she promises to make timely payments on her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Celia; ella tiene 24 años de edad y La socia es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos menores, la socia se dedica a administrar su pequeña tienda de abarrotes, La socia tiene en Angostura una tienda de abarrotes y ella desea implementar y poner más cosas de librería y surtir de esta manera su tiendita, ya que en esta zona es muy difícil encontrar una librería. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales de librería como son cuadernos, útiles escolares entre otros menores.
