La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Banco Comunal Virgen Purificada - Angostura (Purified Virgin Communal Bank, Angostura). She lives in the Angostura district, located in Saylla, a province of the Cusco region. Her name is Celia. She is 34 years old, she has two young children and she is a single mother. Se dedicates herself to the managing of her small grocery store. She has a grocery store in Angostura she would like to expand and sell more bookshop items and thus furnish her shop, as it is very difficult to find a bookstore in this area. The loan she is requesting to buy bookshop items such as notebooks, school supplies, among other small items. She deeply values and is immensely grateful for the loan received, as this will help her improving her business and the quality of her life; at the same time, she commits to repaying her dues respecting the set deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials (wood, nails, and zinc) to repair his roof

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Sonia; ella tiene 31 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos su pareja es transportista y la socia se dedica a administrar su pequeña tienda de abarrotes también cría algunos animales menores como son, cuyes, y aves de corral; La socia también prepara gelatinas y hedos artesanales para la venta en su tienda. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería e implementar su tienda de abarrotes. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Banco Comunal Virgen Purificada - Angostura (Purified Virgin Communal Bank, Angostura). She lives in the Angostura district, located in Saylla, a province of the Cusco region. Her name is Sonia. She is 31 years old, she lives with her partner and has 2 children. Her partner is a truck driver and she dedicates herself to the managing of her small grocery store and to the breeding of some small animals, such as cuyes (Quechua for Guinea Pigs) and poultry. She also prepares gelatin desserts and artisanal ice-cream to sell them in her shop. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy core products to furnish her grocery store. She deeply values and is immensely grateful for the loan received, as this will help her improving her business and the quality of her life; at the same time, she commits to repaying her dues respecting the set deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products.

loans.name: Sixto  Arquímedes

texts.es:
En el barrio Las Colinas  de Somotillo el señor Sixto Arquímedes G. F.   se desempeña como contratista en el municipio de Somotillo brindando su servicio atados los pobladores del municipio y comarcas aledañas.
El nos dice que el crédito será Compra de materiales para la terminación de una obra como es cemento hierro arena piedra etc.
Este es el tercer crédito que nos solicita y nos dice que los primeros créditos la beneficio para empezar el acondicionamiento de su casa de habitación por lo cual esta muy agradecido con ceprodel.
texts.en:
Sr. Sixto Arquímedes G. F. works as a contractor in the neighborhood of Las Colinas, which is in the city of Somotillo. He provides his services to the local residents and those living in the surrounding areas.

Sixto says this loan will be used to buy materials such as cement, iron, sand, and stone to finish one of his jobs. This is the third loan he has requested. His first few loans were a benefit because he was able to begin remodeling his house. For this reason, he is extremely grateful to CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish one of his jobs

loans.name: Claudia Guissel

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Guissel T. es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, desde hace 11 años y se desempeña como operaria de limpieza, solo barre por las madrugadas y en la tarde se dedica a un negocio de venta de tajadas, es casada y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolares, su esposo también trabaja para la Alcaldía de Chinandega, ambos son bien trabajadores y emprendedores para sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Lleva ya 7 créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha pagado muy bien  y siempre que han adquirido crédito lo han sabido administrar y han ido mejorando su vivienda poco a poco.
texts.en:
Sra. Claudia Guissel T. has been employed by the City of Chinandega for eleven years. She is a janitor and works by herself in the early morning hours. In the afternoon, she runs a business selling sliced plantains. Claudia is married and has two children in school. Her husband also works for the City of Chinandega. Both of them are excellent workers and entrepreneurs who want to move their children forward.

Claudia has already had seven loans with CEPRODEL and all of them have been repaid on time. With the loans she has acquired, she always knows how to manage the funds and use them to gradually make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (zinc, nails, and window frames)

loans.name: Eugenio Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Eugenio Ramón O. S., es propietario de una joyería de nombre RUBI, que se encuentra ubicada en el sector del mercado el Bisne, es  casado con 3 hijos de los cuales solo una depende de él, ya que tiene problemas mentales.
El señor O. S. lleva ya 41 créditos con CEPRODEL, los cuales los ha pagado bien pues a pesar de trabajar solo ha demostrado ser una persona bien responsable.
texts.en:
Sr. Eugenio Ramón O. S. is the owner of a jewelry store called “Rubi”, which is located in a section of the Bisne Market. He is married and has three children, one of whom is a dependent and suffers from mental health problems.

Sr. Oliveres S. already has 41 loans with CEPRODEL, all of which have been repaid on time. Even though he works alone, he has demonstrated that he is a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gold

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
La joven Gloria A. es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña en el área de planilla desde hace 13 años, es madre soltera y habita en casa de sus padres, pero sus padres le asignaron parte del solar para que ella construyera una pequeña vivienda para ella y su pequeño hijo de tan solo 5 añitos . 
Lleva ya 4 créditos con CEPRODEL los cuales los ha cancelado en tiempo y forma, además esto le ha ayudado para salir adelante y brindarle una mejor forma de vida a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Young Gloria A. is an employee of the City of Chinandega and has worked in the payroll department for 13 years. She is a single mother and lives in the house of her parents. However, her parents have set aside a portion of their land for her to build a small house where she and her five year old son can live.

Gloria has already had four loans with CEPRODEL which were repaid on time and according to form. The loans have helped her get ahead and provide a better way of life for her young son.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (zinc, toilets, doors, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Luis Alfonso Díaz, se dedica a reparaciones de electrodomésticos en un taller que tiene en su misma casa de habitación, es casado y ya no tienen hijo a cargo todos son independientes.

El señor lleva ya 16  créditos con  CEPRODEL, los cuales los ha pagado en tiempo y forma, es una persona muy responsable y luchadora para salir adelante por cuenta propia.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis Alfonso Díaz repairs electrical appliances from a workshop located in his house. He is married and does not have any children under his care since all of them are independent.

Luis has already had 16 loans with CEPRODEL, all of which have been repaid on time and according to form. He is a very responsible person who struggles to get ahead through his own efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for making repairs

loans.name: Lourdes De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes de la Concepción C. D., es trabajadora de la escuela José Montealegre , se desempeña como maestra de primaria, es casada con 3 hijos de los cuales 2 están en edad escolar , habita en el barrio Ayapal.
Ella lleva ya 4 créditos con ceprodel los cuales le han ayudado para desarrollarse económicamente y ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Sra. Lourdes de la Concepción C. D. works as an elementary school teacher at the José Montealegre School. She is married and has three children, two of whom are of school age. They live in the Ayapal neighborhood.

She has already had four loans with CEPRODEL which have helped her develop financially. Lourdes has demonstrated that she is a very responsible person with her obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (zinc, blocks, and cement)

loans.name: Isabel Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Reyna V.  es soltera vive en el barrio San Agustín junto a su familia tiene una hija fuera del país su negocio es venta de tortillas, ubicado en su casa de habitación   tiene dos personas empleadas, dice sentirse muy bien por qué ayuda a dos familias indirectamente brindándoles empleo en su negocio. 
Doña Isabel V. tiene más de cuatro años de trabajar con créditos de los cuales ha  cancelado veintitrés demostrando ser una persona responsables. Todos los créditos anteriores han sido muy importantes para el desarrollo de mi negocio y la estabilidad económica de mi familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel Reyna V. is single and lives in the neighborhood of San Agustín with her family. She has one daughter who lives outside of the country. Isabel sells tortillas from her home and has two employees. She says she feels very good because she has indirectly helped two families by providing employment through her business.

Doña Isabel V. has worked with loans for more than four years and has repaid 23 of them, thereby demonstrating that she is a responsible person. All of her previous loans have been very important in developing her business and stabilizing her family’s finances.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her business

loans.name: Luisa Emilia

texts.es:
La señora Luisa Emilia González, es comerciante se dedica a la venta de repuestos de vehículos, fricciones, y repuestos de bomba inyectoras, es casada y habita en el barrio san Agustín no tiene hijos a cargo pues ya todos son casados y son independientes, su esposo tiene un taller de fricciones y reparaciones de motor de vehículos.

La señora Luisa Emilia González, lleva ya 3 creditos con CEPRODEL,  y ha sido excelente cliente, con estos financiamientos ha logrado crecer su negocio y ha salido adelante, pues no le gusta depender de su esposo.
texts.en:
Sra. Luisa Emilia González is a merchant who sells automotive parts, brakes, and spare parts for injection pumps. She is married and lives in the San Agustín neighborhood. Luisa does not have children in her care since all of them are married and independent. Her husband has a workshop where he fixes brakes and performs engine repairs on all types of vehicles.

Sra. Luisa Emilia González has already had three loans with CEPRODEL. She has been an excellent client who used her loans to increase her business and get ahead since she does not like having to depend on her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction supplies & pay for labor

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Eugenia M. G., es trabajadora de la escuela José Montealegre, se desempeña como maestra de primaria, es casada con tres hijos de los cuales solo uno depende de ella, su esposo es comerciante y trabaja por cuenta propia.

Ella lleva ya 4 créditos con ceprodel los cuales le han ayudado para desarrollarse económicamente y ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia Martinez G. works at the Jose Montealegre school, where she is a primary teacher. She is married with three children, of whom only one depends on her. Her husband is a merchant and works for himself. She has now had 4 loans with Ceprodel, which have helped her to develop economically and she has proven herself to be a very responsible person with her obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of materials (zinc, blocks and cement)

loans.name: Silvia Marlene

texts.es:
La señora  Silvia Marlene  P. P., es comerciante se dedica a la venta de queso, tiene un puesto en la esquina del alhambra, es casada y tiene un hijo de dos añitos, su esposo también le ayuda a atender  la venta del queso.
La señora solicita créditos con ceprodel para ofrecer a sus clientes producto fresco y bueno todos los días, es muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Silvia Marlene P. P. is a merchant who sells cheese. She has a stall in the Alhambra square. She is married and has a little child of two years. Her husband also helps her to sell cheese. She is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to offer her customers a good and fresh product every day. She is very responsible with her obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of cheese

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase corrugated roofing, wood, nails, cinder blocks, cement and manual labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: the purchase of materials (wood, nails, zinc, flooring)

loans.name: Srey Oun's Group

texts.en: This group loan has six people who live in Ta Tai village, Takeo province. Mrs. Srey Oun S. is the group leader, selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. She was born in 1968. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she can grow rice to sell to support her family. She also runs a general store out of her home, where she sells groceries to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. To improve this business, Mrs. Srey Oun S. is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to retail. She is a widow with a child who is attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to retail

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina B. is from the village of  Talon Gingoog City. She is 40 and married with five adult children. To make a living, Josefina owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop from selling both food and daily use products. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Josefina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu D. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 25 and married with a small child. To make a living, Marichu owns a  sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Marichu has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marichu joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She  is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marichu from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Beloy

texts.en:
Beloy L. is from the village of  San Juan, Gingoog City. He is 42 and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Beloy provides a motorcycle service to transport passengers. Beloy has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Beloy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beloy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. He is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Beloy from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mrs. Sriv Nuon Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has 14 people who live in Angk Sangkae village, Takeo province. Mrs. Sriv N. is the village bank president, selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. She is 40 years old. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell, in order to support her family. She is a widow with four children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, another is helping her to do the farming, while the others are attending a local public school. Although they try to work hard, they earn little money. So to improve her family's standard of living, Mrs. Sriv N. is applying for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her child taxi driver. All the members are shown in the picture but one of them is blocked.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her child taxi driver

loans.name: Everliene

texts.en:
Everliene M. is from the village of  San Isidro Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Everliene is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Everliene works in a family member's business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Everliene has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Everliene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Everliene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Everliene is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Everliene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Vong Village Bank Group

texts.en: Thirteen people who live in Angk Sangkae village, Takeo province, make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Sokha V. is the village bank president, selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes, in order to improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. V. was born in 1967. She is a fruit seller at her local market, where she earns some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Lim Rut, is a construction worker. Her problem is that her husband’s workplace is far away from her home. So to make the commute easier, Mrs. Sokha V. is asking for a loan to buy a new motorbike to support her husband’s business. She is a mother of six children, one of whom is a construction worker, another is a driver who gets a low salary, while the others are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike
